position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

location.city: Dallas • Japan • Seattle • London • Sunnyvale • United Kingdom • Bengaluru • Remote

description:
Are you passionate about building systems and software that lasts and will make an impact? Do you relish in the satisfaction of solving challenging problems? Do you want to build complex systems from the ground up? If these questions resonate with you, you’ve come to the right place!

ThoughtSpot is disrupting the Business Intelligence world in a big way and to do so, we need and welcome ideas from many areas within computer science: information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design and more.

ThoughtSpot relational search appliance brings the ease of search to enterprise data analysis. It includes a new kind of search engine, tightly integrated with large-scale, in-memory computing. The result is a consumer-class user experience combined with enterprise-class scalability while maintaining enterprise data governance and manageability for IT. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who want to make a big impact in their work.

This position is an unpaid internship. College credit is available. Our internships provide real-world experience to undergraduate and graduate-level students. As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that will empower you to learn, build, and grow.

What it takes to be a Software Engineer at ThoughtSpot:

  • Strong coding skills in modern languages such as C++/Javascript/Python
  • Strong problem solving skills, algorithmic thinking and a strong foundation in how systems work.
  • Very strong computer science fundamentals
  • Bachelor/Masters in Computer Science, PhD preferred
  • Experience in designing and developing scale-out, high-performance systems OR experience with database design OR experience in building search engines including areas such as search relevance, aggregation and indexing OR full stack/frontend development experience in building complex web/mobile applications is a plus.
  • 12 weeks are required for the internship.

Education :

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field with an expected graduation date no earlier than December 2020

About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located Sunnyvale office with onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $550 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.

#LI-RG1 #LI-REMOTE

Learn something every day building real products for real users

What you will learn:

  • How our product development process works from inception to deployment
  • How to write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python/Django and ES6/React
  • How to collaborate with other engineers over code review and discussion

What you will do:

There are no intern projects. We treat you like full-time engineers and get you onboarded as quickly as possible.

  • Ship code to users in your first week and every week after
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other engineers on projects small and large
  • Take ownership and lead your own project within 8 weeks

Examples of past intern work include:

  • Architecting the backend database schema and designing the REST API for our trading platform
  • Implementing the redesign and refactor of our entire investment search page in a reactive framework with front-end routing and browser history
  • Building a process for users to upload and unpack zip files and replicate the folder structure in our database

Benefits & opportunities:

  • Autonomy - Work autonomously to set your own timeline, architecture, and task breakdown
  • Mentorship - Meet with mentors one on one to develop technical and non-technical skills
  • 10% Time - Every other Monday, utilize your curiosity to develop your technical skills on personal projects
  • Snack - We're not unique here but we love our coffee and snacks and we've got you covered

What we are looking for:

  • Motivated individuals looking for industry experience and to develop their technical skills
  • People with a foundational understanding of software engineering
  • Curiosity for technologies, concepts, and practices
  • Individuals who enjoy collaborating with roles outside of engineering

What are our goals:

We think it should be just as easy to trade in private companies as it is in public companies. Many believe that startup employee equity is only worth something if the company IPOs or is acquired. However, with a robust, centralized, efficient market to trade in private companies, that equity becomes liquid and is valuable from the day it vests. We are building that market for stockholders and institutional investors, and we could use your help doing it.

Other Details

  • Given the uncertain circumstances around the pandemic, we are only accepting candidates residing in the Bay Area.

Learn more about us at https://www.zanbato.com or https://www.facebook.com/zanbatoinc/

position: Product Development and Infrastructure Operations Intern
description:
WorkBoard

Work with purpose.

WorkBoard’s mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard’s platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.

WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space – it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, Microsoft’s M12 Fund, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.

THE OPPORTUNITY

In this role you will join our Technology Operations team for the summer, supporting Product Development and the larger Workboard Organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with business leaders and a broad cross section of employees across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and People teams. You’ll build transparent, repeatable processes and help strengthen our culture of continuous improvement in areas of Program Management, Release Management, IT, business operations and analytics.

This person will ensure that all priorities are defined, specified, planned and delivered to meet defined targets, mandates and ongoing business imperatives. This position applies solid multi-tasking, program management, analytics and self-starting skills & experience in working with internal and external stakeholders executing initiatives with agility, nimbleness and on time delivery. You will work on projects that impact business performance and will play a key role in supporting critical strategic operations efforts in a fast paced hyper growth start-up.

Your projects for the internship will include:

  • Supporting our Release Management activities to assure our weekly releases are deployed and signed off with transparency and alignment across our Engineering, Product and Testing organizations.
  • Driving our Product Development Onboarding activities: assigning new hires to the right training, post training creation of weekly polls and analytics to assure we are providing sufficient training to expedite effectiveness and maintain our targeted NPS.
  • Track and manage on-time renewal and ample availability of software subscriptions managed by our IT team to support execution in a hyper-growth start-up.
  • Be central point of contact in our PMO to curate, consolidate and maintain the necessary content for our Product Development Intranet, including FAQs and How to docs. You will participate as a key core team member as Workboard designs and deploys this new Intranet.
  • Work with IT Management to assure all WorkBoard equipment assigned to employees have required Asset Tags on their equipment.
  • Work with Security Ops, Dev Ops and Tech Ops teams to consolidate all contract obligations and establish a calendar to assure that the Product Development maintains and delivers all commitments on time to meet customers and vendor requirements.
  • Facilitate communication, participation and delivery of bi-weekly happy hours and monthly town halls to support our Product Development team.

COMING IN

  • Ability to work effectively as part of a diverse team, have fun and get stuff done 
  • Good presentation skills – verbal and written
  • Strong analytic mindset; has data driven approach to problem solving
  • Self-starter, quick learner and detail oriented.
  • Available for approximately a 10-12 week summer internship and available to work 40 hours per week.
  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university.

OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 Hs

Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team

A FEW OF OUR AWESOME BENEFITS

  • Flexible PTO & sick days
  • Paid holidays
  • Quarterly All-Hands Meetings
  • And much more!

THE WORKBOARD STORY

WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you’re hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates’ contributions, then come join us!

Smarttwigs is a software consultancy firm that focuses on combining platforms, tools, and methodologies to help companies build software and run their most strategic applications. Our team connects customers, partners, and contributors to deliver trusted and high-performing technical solutions across various industries.

Join our team as a Frontend Engineering Intern and get experience building enterprise level applications using the most cutting-edge technologies and tools in the industry. Start off with sample projects and work your way up to low risk client modules. It will be a safe environment to gain real world knowledge.

Smarttwigs focuses on Consulting, Technology, and Mobile Application. The company has offices in Jersey City. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.smarttwigs.com

Smarttwigs is a software consultancy firm focusing on accelerating enterprise and start up tech teams by combining platform, tools, and methodology to help the companies build software and run their most strategic applications. Our team works with companies and developers to give software development and IT operations a strategic advantage.

Join our team as a Backend Engineering Intern and get experience building enterprise level application development using the most bleeding-edge technologies and tools in the industry. Start off with sample projects and work your way up to low risk client modules. It will be a safe environment to gain real world knowledge.

You will help us create, maintain and research subjects related to current backend technologies for a variety of applications that will run on iOS, Android, Apple Watch, Alexa, etc.

position: MBA Summer Intern - Technical Product Management
description:
This is a remote position

Our Company:

Today, 1 in 3 Americans say they suffer from mental health problems like anxiety, depression, or insomnia. Despite this mental health epidemic, seeing a psychiatrist can take up to 3 months and cost as much as $500.

Shocked? Us too. That’s why we started Cerebral, a telemedicine-first mental health startup. We are breaking down the barriers to access mental healthcare so that anybody can get the care they need immediately. We provide tens of thousands of individuals across the nation with medication management, therapy, and counseling services. We launched publicly in January 2020 and are growing at over 40% month-over-month, and need your help.

How you will contribute:

  • Manage specific project(s) or initiative(s) end-to-end during your summer internship
  • Identify and implement initiatives that move company metrics; partnering with cross-functional teams to improve systems that drive company-wide change
  • Build beautiful products that change the lives of patients and providers by improving the access and outcome of mental healthcare
  • Utilize a combination of metrics, interviews, stakeholder strategy, and market data to inform the product roadmap
  • Own the end to end strategy and feature development while partnering with engineering for telehealth visit and communications user experiences for both patients and providers to deliver a continuously
  • Demonstrate a mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of the organization
  • Own the delivery of OKRs, define KPIs and their drivers, while meeting SLAs
  • Inspire, champion, and coach as the need arises

Skills you’ll bring:

  • 3+ years' experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment banking, and/or experience in a Product, Business Operations, Internal Strategy or cross-functional operational role at a technology company
  • Accepted into an M.B.A. program
  • Eagerness to work independently with a strong sense of ownership
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, prioritize and juggle multiple priorities with cross-functional stakeholders while hitting deadlines on time sensitive projects
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationships
  • Resourcefulness, persistence, and ability to thrive in fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • You have sharp attention to detail with a natural feel for numbers and data, and have a high degree of accuracy in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
  • You are proactive and have a positive attitude with a can-do, service-oriented mentality

About You:

  • Passionate about improving the access and outcomes of mental healthcare.
  • Strategic thinker with a pulse on the market.
  • Visionary
  • Utilize data to inform both tactical and strategic decisions
  • Adept at prioritizing value and shipping complex products requiring coordination across multiple teams
  • Love working with some of the best world-class engineers, product managers, and architects.
  • Strive to excel, innovate and take pride in your work
  • Work well with other leaders

Bonus points:

  • You are familiar with our tools & systems - Asana, Looker, Iterable, Google Optimize, Chargebee, Google docs, MS Office
  • You have experience with AB testing and leveraging data/analytics to evaluate outcomes
  • You have experience with telemedicine or mental health care start ups

Must be based in the United States, and legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are not able to sponsor work visas at this time.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About the Role:

Sezzle currently partners with over 20,000 active merchants to offer their customers the ability to split orders into 4 interest-free payments over 6 weeks. As a Credit Analyst, you will work to ensure that new merchant applications are fully investigated to accurately project the potential monetary risk the accounts pose to Sezzle and take proactive steps to mitigate that risk.

Our Company

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the numerous eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle’s goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.

At Sezzle, we’re committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate high risk merchant applications and ambiguous data to confidently make credit recommendations.
  • Define, execute and document processes and reports for all merchant credit application functions.
  • Automate merchant decision processes in order to proactively mitigate merchant account losses.
  • Work closely with Merchant Success and Support teams to resolve merchant risk issues and provide guidance on overall risk tolerance and policy.
  • Challenge the status quo by working collaboratively as well as independently on projects focused on improving internal methods, policies, and internal tools

Ideal Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or currently enrolled in an accredited college or university in Finance/Business/Math/Statistics
  • Some knowledge of financial statements analysis and ratios
  • Experience with MySQL a plus
  • Passionate problem solver and strategic thinker with strong analytical problem-solving skills
  • High attention to detail and ability to multitask effectively
  • Self-starter, intellectually curious and comfortable operating in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Detective sense. You have natural intuition when something is wrong and are able to identify the issue
  • Able to problem solve and innovatively work your way around roadblocks on your own
  • GPA of at least 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale

About You:

  • A+ character. We are team-first here at Sezzle.
  • A hard-working mentality. It’s early and there is still a lot to build.
  • An excellent communicator.
  • A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things.
  • Smarts. We need people that are smart enough to make decisions on their own and also smart enough to know when they need input from others.

What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome?

At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators; we are skilled musicians, yogis, cyclists, chefs, golfers, dog-lovers, and rock-climbers. We believe in surrounding ourselves with not only the best and the brightest individuals, but those that are unique and purpose-driven in all that they do. Sezzle recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting our mission.

Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.

Sezzle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, familial status, veteran or military status, status regarding public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
Platform Team

At Carbon, we are a team of passionate entrepreneurs, engineers, designers, programmers, and materials scientists who value creativity and the ability to get things done. Our company is built on the idea that when diverse fields of study come together, we can solve challenging problems. Carbon’s Application Development team owns the collaboration with visionary manufacturing partners from concept to production readiness. Once applications have been identified to be a strong fit, Design Engineers help prospective customers successfully implement Carbon’s technology within their business. Our team drives and educates customers on Design for DLS best practices while creating products that meet or exceed customer’s requirements and objectives. As a successful Application Engineer Intern, you will work with Application Engineers and external OEM customers to support their development of end use products with DLS. You thrive in employing your creative problem solving abilities and growing your depth of expertise across a variety of functional areas (including software, materials, hardware, product development processes and cross-functional team leadership). You are comfortable presenting to external and internal company stakeholders and can handle tough situations with poise and confidence.

Responsibilities

  • Learn and become proficient in Design for DLS best practices and their implementation in part and product design.
  • Use hypothesis-driven approaches to understand problems, define test methods, evaluate solutions, use feedback, iterate and provide recommendations.
  • Work closely with colleagues to guide clients from initial product concept evaluation through technical feasibility to production readiness.
  • Develop internal tools and resources to improve design process quality and efficiency.
  • Support implementation of custom product workflows for serial production.

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • BS / MS Engineering degree candidate with a focus on Product Development or Product Design.
  • Experience with CAD tools for solid, surface, or mesh modeling (OnShape, SolidWorks, CATIA, Rhino, ZBrush, MeshMixer, etc.).
  • Experience with office productivity software for documentation, presentation, and data analysis (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Google Suite).
  • Detail oriented with strong verbal, graphical, and technical communications skills.
  • Demonstrated creative problem solving abilities and positive attitude.
  • Flexibility to adjust to a changing work environment (remote, hybrid, etc.).

Bonus Skills

  • Experience with manufacturing technologies and physical prototyping.
  • Experience with scripting, basic programming principles, or visual coding.
  • Understanding of common material properties and their implications for part design.
  • Passion for manufacturing tech, digital design, innovative product development, etc.

The Team
Since our founding in 2015, Codecov has evolved from a one person team to a distributed remote family. We have team members all across the world and we’re committed to building disruptive testing tools and code coverage reports that will allow developers to ship healthier code. Similar to the customers we serve, Codecov is a diverse group of curious and creative individuals. Join us on a mission to devise, validate, and oversee the creation of software testing and code coverage products.

The Opportunity
Codecov is searching for an intern to work with our Software Engineering team.

Our engineering team is grouped into three focus areas: The frontend, the core APIs, and the worker. The frontend team is responsible for everything the users sees after they log into codecov (Awesome Dashboards, Insightful Coverage Metrics) The Core API team is in charge of making sure that Codecov reliably handles all API and incoming webhooks requests and the worker team makes sure that all our asynchronous jobs process flawlessly (Calculating Coverage, Setting statuses on the git providers)

The internships focus depends on your interest and you will ship code on products used by over 1M people.

  • Frontend (React.JS)
  • API (Python, Django REST framework, Django, Postgres, Kubernetes, Envoy)
  • Worker (Python, Celery, Postgres, Kubernetes)

This opportunity is conducive for university students looking for a summer internship, but we can also support non-university students for a similar time frame (3-6 months).

Requirements

  • 0-2 years of computer science learning AND/OR software work in a corporation
  • Some combination of experience in React.JS and/or Python

Our Benefits

  • Employer stipend for work computer
  • Remote workforce anywhere from GMT-8 to GMT+3

Linqia is the leader in the growing influencer marketing industry. At Linqia, we partner with the world’s largest brands including Danonne, AB InBev, Kimberly-Clark, Unilever, and Walmart to build compelling and effective influencer marketing campaigns. Our AI-driven platform and team of experts are leading the transformation of influencer marketing.

We value intelligence, recognize talent and have instilled a culture that supports career development and growth for our employees. We thrive on innovation and accountability, with a customer first attitude that adds true value to everything we touch. Our team members are smart, hard-working, have integrity and love to have fun as we play to win. At Linqia, you’ll be working with others who are passionate about marketing in a fun, fast-paced and data-driven environment.

The Role:

We are growing fast and looking for a talented machine-learning software engineering intern to join the engineering team this summer for a 3 month paid opportunity. The ideal candidate should be someone who is currently or just graduated with a relevant degree and has some knowledge of ML foundations. This is a great opportunity to work on an impactful project, while learning ML applications with Linqia’s backend team. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you're surrounded by driven, passionate, and motivated people, then Linqia is the place for you!

Responsibilities:

  • Design and Develop Automation workflows for provisioning Software Infrastructure span
  • Design and Develop Microservices and Applications for Data Extraction, Information Retrieval and Data Analysis
  • Manage deployment and orchestration Infrastructure and related Automation (Apache Mesos, Kubernetes)
  • Manage and Deploy Distributed Queuing and Streaming platforms (Apache Kafka, Apache ActiveMQ)
  • Manage and Deploy Database Infrastructure (Relational and Non Relational)

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing or completed a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D in computer science, statistics, mathematics, electrical engineering, machine learning, or related technical field
  • Python, Java, Shell Scripting
  • Hands-on experience with machine learning, data mining, natural language processing or statistics
  • Experience with Data Analysis and Machine Learning Libraries like Pandas, Gensim, Pytorch, TensorFlow, etc.
  • Experience with Source Control Management esp. Git
  • Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to other team members.
  • Familiarity with Agile software development processes
  • Very good understanding of Relational Databases and SQL
  • Very good understanding of Linux/Unix platforms and System Tools.

Nice to Have:

  • Masters or PHD in computer science or other technical related field.
  • Experience working and writing automation workflows for AWS, Google Cloud Platform or other cloud infrastructure
  • Experience deploying, configuring and managing Queuing Systems
  • Experience deploying, configuring and managing Non Relational Databases
  • Experience with Microservice based infrastructure.
  • Experience with Software Infrastructure Automation and tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Docker

This position description is intended to describe the duties most frequently performed by an individual in this position. Linqia is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes or candidates through this Web site or directly to employees. Linqia does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.

TapTab is a cutting-edge mobile application that is inventing the future of the dining experience, and we’re looking for great people who are excited about that future.

We are currently seeking a Backend Engineering Interns to join our development team. Our summer internship program runs from June 28 - September 3, 2021. As a Backend Engineering Intern, you will work on backend development tasks. Specific assignments will vary depending upon your interests and skills.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate in an exciting, emerging startup at an early stage; learn from a fun, friendly and highly-motivated team of developers; gain valuable work experience; and enhance your resume for future opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities will be to:

• Work with TapTab backend engineers on innovative web applications
• Research, test and contribute to the adoption of software architecture, programming languages and new technologies
• Write, test and document code, and ensure code quality, reliability and optimal performance

QUALIFICATIONS

• Recent Sofware Engineering Bootcamp graduate OR full-time undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Science or related field at an accredited college or university
• 3.0 GPA or higher
• Proficiency in and experience with backend end programming languages, specifically Node.js and Postgres SQL databases
• Interest in developing scalable, adaptive, high-performance apps
• Ability to write and test high-quality, readable, reliable and well-architected code
• Ability to define, understand, develop, test and iterate new product features
• Experience with markup languages
• Familiarity with Git version control
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS & QUALITIES

• Deep interest in software development and knowledge of latest technological developments
• Knowledge of frontend or mobile development using React.js, Swift or Kotlin
• Interest in startups

The Backend Engineering Intern position is an unpaid role, and the intern is not considered an employee for wage purposes and shall not receive employee benefits, such as health or dental insurance, or pension or retirement credit. Participation in the internship does not guarantee the intern a job at the conclusion of the internship.

Applicants who receive college/university credit for internships are strongly encouraged to apply. And TapTab is happy to work with your educational institution to help you earn credit for your internship.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

Greetings Adventurous Programmer

We, the artists, builders, dreamers and denizens of StartupLandia have evolved to the point that we think we'd like to create an internship program.

We are a small team of senior level engineers and a few designers.

We love the intersection of entrepreneurship, design and technical product engineering.

Many of us have been founders and generally speaking, we build exclusively for founders in the Seed to Series A range.

As an intern, you would have the opportunity to...

  1. Pair with senior engineers on 4 different projects ranging from rails, to node, react native, to flutter with maybe some elixir or swift mixed in there.
  2. Work directly on an in house ticketing app that StartupLandia CTO is hammering on, a rails/twilio/stripe/pay-musicians direct thingy.
  3. Write some cool blog posts about your experiences that hopefully document soon to be accelerated changes in your professional skills.
  4. Gain valuable expeience and possibly some references that will help you make the jump into a full time junior position somewhere.

As an intern, you would...

  • Probably be self taught or someone who completed a coding bootcamp
  • Interested in learning from the fire hose and very self directed
  • Capable of signing an NDA and working like a professional
  • Have a good understanding of the HTTP roundtrip web software process
  • Have some exposure to rails & react
  • Have great communication skills
  • A desire to help Startuplandia's mission while helping yourself

We think that this is a six week kind of program where the payment mechanism is based on us paying you for a weekly blog post, something like $200/post/week would work out to $1200 for 6 weeks (1099 contract). You can pair with senior devs and work on an internal project we have as much or as little makes sense for your growth. After 6 weeks has past, if things go well, you would then have a professional grade commit history and a recommendation from me to assist your journey into the great unknown.

If this sounds interesting to you, please respond to this post with 3-5 bullet points about yourself that support the above scenarios.

Cheers,

John D
Founder, CTO
startuplandia.io

P.S. - DO NOT EMAIL ME OR ATTEMPT TO GET ON MY RADAR DIRECTLY, I'M SUPER BUSY & CONSTANTLY FIGHTING FOR MY FOCUS :)

Join a leading fintech company that’s democratizing real estate investing for all.

Fintor was founded with a simple idea: real estate investing markets should be accessible to all, not just the wealthy. Fintor is a mobile app to buy and sell fractional shares in real estate properties with as little as $5 per share within a few taps. We enable everyone to have access, liquidity, and clarity to the real estate markets that have traditionally been available to a selected few. Just as we focus on our customers, we also strive to create an inclusive environment where our employees can thrive and do impactful work.

You will be joining as one of the first interns at a fast growing startup backed by some of the most recognizable investors including 500 Startups, Graphene Ventures, Hustle Fund, celebrities like Manny Khoshbin, and more. We share the same investor as Robinhood, Lyft, Facebook, Snapchat, Udemy, Canva, Venmo and many more unicorns.

You will be working directly with the co-founders of Fintor. Learn more at https://fintor.com

*Please check out our website to get a better understanding of what we are building.

About the role
Our react native app intern helps us deliver on our mission by creating high quality code and outstanding user experiences. As an intern, you’ll work directly with our team on projects and products from ideation to rollout, and beyond. Security and simplicity is core to Fintor’s mission on the engineering team and critical to how we build our products from inception and design to deployment in the cloud. This role will work closely with our CTO to build beautiful user experiences, highly performant, scalable systems, and develop state of the art support software to power Fintor’s trading engine. Internships are about learning and at Fintor you will learn about startups and what goes on behind the scenes in working with serial entrepreneur founders.

In this role you will be

  • Build customer facing features in our React Native applications for iOS and Android, working with native modules when required.
  • Write and maintain clean, tested, and well-documented code.
  • Work with the mobile app serverless backend on a modern cloud infrastructure and integrate with internal and third-party APIs.
  • Collaborate with UX design and implement designs with clean, modern transitions that provide an excellent user experience.
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs, ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application at scale.
  • Work with CI/CD pipelines for testing and deployments.

We are looking for

  • Someone that believes in our mission with a positive mindset and understanding of the early-stage startup environment.
  • Development experience for high-quality production React Native projects.
  • Experience with serverless architecture on a AWS cloud infrastructure, including integrating with API.
  • Proficient in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES 6), NodeJs, React Native, Expo and experience in related tools like Redux, REST, GraphQL, and Git.
  • Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, and testing platforms.
  • A strong passion for creating innovative user features and interactions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Benefits

  • An opportunity to join a fast-growing fintech startup that is changing the world of finance and real estate investing.
  • Learn about every aspect of building a company by working directly with founders.
  • A seat at the table to share your ideas and make your voice heard.
  • Be part of a company with a real mission you can be proud of.

Fintor is committed to fostering a fair, inclusive, and equal work environment. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities that we serve, where each team member is empowered to come to work as their true self. Diverse teams are more successful, which is why Fintor aims to be a leader in workplace equality and move both our company and the industry forward.

The Position

KAYAK is growing rapidly and seeks to hire an intern/co-op to bolster the IT Support team. The ideal candidate will understand the basics of troubleshooting hardware and software. A friendly demeanor and great communication skills are very important to ensuring success.

The position will be based in Cambridge, MA.

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. position: Financial Engineering and Data Science Intern

location.city: Los Angeles • Santa Monica • Los Angeles County

description:
Our new startup, Pace It, is focused on helping retirees convert their hard-earned assets into lifelong paychecks. Millions of baby-boomers are retiring and are facing a tough problem of enjoying their retirement without running out of money. Our digital platform tailors a personalized drawdown strategy for them and assists them to stick by it. By addressing the unique financial circumstances of retirees, PaceIt is poised to become the one-stop solution for all the boomers’ financial needs.

We are four founders with many years of combined experience in the retirement space. We have been helping individuals accumulate for retirement and have realized that there is no good solution to guide them through withdrawals once those individuals retire. We are leveraging our experience and wide network with retirement plan providers and record keepers to distribute our solution. We have already signed a major 401(k) record keeper as our launch partner. We are now focused on building our core team towards a launch of our MVP in 2021. The company is well funded to achieve that goal.

We’re currently looking for a phenomenal financial engineer with data science capabilities for an unpaid internship starting on June 21, 2021. The internship will allow you to grow and to take part in a multi-disciplinary development effort. Two of the founders are UCLA professors with many years of experience coaching graduate students.

Example of the tasks that you might be asked to complete:
• Develop Monte Carlo simulations for modeling retirement portfolios.
• Use machine learning algorithms to improve portfolio modeling.
• Analyze transaction data and develop algorithms for tracking individuals spending versus their budgets.
• Develop machine learning algorithm to predict life expectancy and spending patterns of retirees.

Requirements:
• Previous work in a start-up and/or hi-tech environment is a plus.
• Experience modeling investment risk and return using Monte Carlo simulations.
• Experience using statistical computer languages (mostly Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
• Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, tree-based techniques, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Familiarity with Tensor flow and Keras is a plus.
• Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
• Previous experience with cloud technology (AWS in particular) is an advantage.

This is a rare opportunity to take part in a high-growth venture at an early stage and help build a company with an important mission. If you want to do good and do well, help us create a needed financial solution for the many baby boomers retiring every day.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.
