About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

description:
Prune AI presents a scientific approach to social media marketing. We are building an AI-powered marketplace to help businesses promote their products via word-of-mouth on social media. We have a MVP in stealth mode and are currently testing in closed beta.

The engineering team works directly with Machine Learning Scientists, so there is opportunity for significant technical learning. Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.

  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.

  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About Anyscale:Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We’re commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund.

With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.

We are looking for passionate, motivated people who are excited to build tools to power the next generation of cloud applications.

Must be willing to work onsite in our office.

  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. Apply Now and Join Us.

Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Site Reliability Engineer internship position is responsible for a variety of process and infrastructure initiatives, including platform maintenance and enhancements for our flagship cloud-based genomics product, automating existing pipelines to improve efficiency and long-term ecosystem health, performing software updates across our AWS platform, and ensuring that managed assets are performing as expected through the use of telemetry, automated alerts, and self-healing infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an intern, your job duties may involve some or many of the below duties:

  • Ensure that the infrastructure supporting our genomics platform is highly available, scalable, and maintainable
  • Maintain and extend existing configuration management deployments
  • Perform software installations using existing infrastructure and configuration management tools
  • Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to migrate existing deployment tools into a fully automated and managed process
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to extend and enhance existing CI/CD pipelines
  • Work directly with the DevOps team and software engineers to ensure system integrity
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve telemetry gathering, reporting, and alerting
  • Follow all best practices and procedures as established by company
  • Review, understanding, and compliance with Invitae HIPAA Security policies and procedures
  • Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data
  • Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology

EXPERIENCE

As an intern, you should be familiar with many of the items below, though it is also expected that many of these skills would be developed while serving in this position:

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience
  • 3 years in an SRE/DevOps role, or related IT or operations field
  • Familiar with Linux and Bash
  • Familiar with configuration management tools (e.g. Salt, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Familiar with AWS tools and infrastructure (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS, Lambda, and CloudWatch)
  • Familiar with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and scripting languages (Python strongly preferred)
  • Familiar with IAC tools such as Terraform (preferred)
  • Familiar with containerized systems in a cloud environment
  • Familiar with Scrum and Agile development methodologies
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Drive and determination
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively to enhance the success of the projects and maintain strong relationships within all parts of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-starter
  • Driven to perform
  • Able to organize, prioritize, and delegate tasks to efficiently move projects forward

EDUCATION

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

position: Web Development Intern – Work on new challenges while learning new skills
description:
Who we are.

Part consulting group; part startup accelerator we are a startup of startups. Our goal is to build a team that can quickly find the valuation of any idea and help bring it to market in an efficient low-cost manner. This may include software development, UX/UI design, marketing or a number of other skills. Whether it's a client company or an internal idea we have what it takes to make it successful.

We’re looking for a co-founder to join the team and lead a team of senior developers and interns, help with product development and become part of the face of the company.

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies. So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Who you Are
• People tell you that you have a high attention to detail
• You are a bottom-up thinker, and are wholly unsatisfied with a functional solution that you do not understand
• You write clean, readable, testable and maintainable code
• You love working with other people, and people love working with you

Skills

• Front end development experience, using at least one major client side framework (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
• API development experience, using at least one major server side framework (Django, Rails, Node/Express, etc.)
• Experience using a variety of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, key-value stores, etc.), and familiar with the tradeoffs and use cases for each

Bonus Skills
• Familiarity with React Native, Firebase/Firestore, GraphQL/Apollo, Docker/Kubernetes, and/or streaming content analytics would be considered a strong plus
• You have solid software engineering fundamentals:
o You understand unit/integration/system testing, and have a practical understanding of when each is necessary
o You have good software design skills, and know how to apply separation of concerns, inversion of control, dependency injection, etc.

Symbl.ai is an early-stage, venture-backed startup working at the forefront of AI. We are creating the first developer platform for Conversational Intelligence. Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Whether on the go, in the subway, or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colorful by the day, ensuring users see themselves reflected —not just in our product but also in the world, allowing them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Gabb. We currently have fifteen people from more than six nationalities working in New York, Los Angeles, and D.C., challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to connecting with more users in every hemisphere. As we complete our pilots at universities, we need someone to create fun immersive social media content to provide a refreshing language learning experience to our customers for our launch in 2021. We are looking for a talented Social media intern to join our team and create and maintain a robust online presence for Gabb Global. Your role is to implement online marketing strategies through social media accounts. As a Social media coordinator, you will develop original content and suggest creative ways to attract more customers and promote our brand. Ultimately, you should increase web traffic and customer engagement metrics aligned with broader marketing strategies.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As al Back End Developer Spring/Summer Intern you:

  • Are experienced with client-server architectures, networking protocols, application development, and using databases.
  • Have experience using and developing APIs.
  • Understand user and system requirements
  • Have an understanding of or experience with, Agile development methodology.

What You'll Do:

  • You'll work in a dynamic, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code, and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.
  • Design and code servers, services, applications, and databases that are reusable, scalable, and meet critical architecture goals.
  • Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use.
  • Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large-scale systems and Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Who You Are:

  • You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products. Problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • You have a basic understanding of software development and programming languages.
  • You can learn new skills quickly and use the skills efficiently.

Job duties and responsibilities
The Virtual reality designer shapes up the user experiences in the team by using all the possibilities offered by the 3D tools. Augmented reality, immersion, oculus rift headset, holograms…
Some experiences will remain in the virtual world, while others will integrate our reality. The Virtual Reality designer will be able to apply design principles to create tomorrow's 3D products and services and the experiences of their uses in recreated real conditions. He will help us design a 3D world for our platform, and he will also show how to distort these tools to realize, prototype, model these 3D experiences before launching their development.

Skills
Perfect knowledge of 3D: history, tools, methodology…
Perfect knowledge of design methodology
Ability to coordinate teams
To research the context and the users' needs (interviews, questionnaires, observation, etc.), to identify the behaviors and formalize the results of the analysis in the shape of personas.
To definer the target experience and the interactions to highlight
To formalize the experience(s) to implement
To elaborate on the specifications.
To define the stakeholders of the implementation.
To guide the conception with the tools

WHO WE ARE

We are a virtual reality language learning platform called Gabb Global. www.gabbglobal.com We are looking for a front end developer intern that can help us create language learning experiences for students across the country. Though this internship is unpaid, once we get funding you will be offered a full time. We are a team of 13. We want to launch our app in March, and we are doing pilots at UC Davis right now. Our mission at Gabb Global is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. With over 500 pilot users, we strive to become the most popular language-learning application in the world. But we have got more left to do — and that is where you come in! You will help create and define cohesive, high-visibility branding projects tied to increasing brand awareness and equity. We are a multilingual, diverse group of people who work in small, cross-functional teams to create the world's first gamification and virtual reality language learning app. From composing landing pages to collaborating closely with our marketing team on innovative projects, you will have the opportunity to work on brand projects and marketing campaigns that push Gabb's mission forward, help us become an iconic brand, and transform the future of education. You’ll work with our front and back end team to tackle unique Gabb Global's technical challenges ! You will work with a fun and diverse team to build intelligent software used by hundreds of students in California.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Model and texture characters and environments for multiple styles of play
  • Collaborate with designer and engineers to create the look and feel of our products
  • Define how environmental elements interact with users and function within the world
  • Give and receive constructive and creative feedback across art disciplines

WHO YOU ARE

As a 3D artist, you can model anything and everything. You are in school or starting a career in product design. Since we're still growing, we need someone who can make the world, character, textures, and light and animate the whole scene! You might wear many hats, but at the end of the day, you're a doer, like us. You've spent some hours honing your artistic skills - degrees are pleasant, but portfolios speak volumes. You're at your best when working with others. You're not afraid to speak up, take critique, or push for and take ownership of something you passionately believe in. You're someone who wants to take creative risks and enjoys solving problems. You're a passionate gamer yourself and understand how the aesthetic and fiction of a game can be just as impactful as the core game loop, and you enjoy playing games when you can

WHAT'S REQUIRED

  • 3+ years of 3D modeling (low poly, high poly, standard map extraction)
  • You have professional experience in a game engine like Unreal, Unity, or Lumberyard
  • Expert at Maya, 3D Studio Max, Blender, or similar 3d program
  • Strong organic and hard surface modeling/texturing skills
  • Ability to create efficient in-game geometry & textures with clean topology
  • Ability to transform concept art or reference photos into a high-quality 3D model
  • Experience texturing in Substance Painter/Designer or similar programs
  • Experience creating PBR materials
  • Desire to improve and grow yourself and continually hone your skills
  • Ability to own a project from beginning to end
  • Proficient in Agile/Scrum development

SKILLS

  • Knowledge of 3D: history, tools, methodology…
  • Perfect knowledge of design methodology
  • Ability to coordinate teams
  • To do research on the context and the users' needs (interviews, questionnaires, observation, etc.), identify the behaviors, and formalize the analysis results in the shape of personas.
  • To definer the target experience and the interactions to highlight
  • To formalize the experience(s) to implement
  • To elaborate the specifications
  • To define the stakeholders of the implementation

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our mission is to facilitate alms and donations collection and distribution to help the elderly and people with disabilities who work in the informal sector to get better livelihood through micro-business management, giving them greater market exposure.

Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.

Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

And, we are also developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. The crowdsharing for goods and food donation. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

 ZAKKI provides equal volunteering opportunity for everyone regardless of age, sex/gender, color, race, creed, nationality/origin, marital status, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit essential performance job functions. All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one’s ability to perform the job, as well as one’s dedication to ZAKKI’s Mission and needs.  

General Requirement: 

  • Very effective interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building 
  • Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands 
  • In-depth knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence 
  • Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate tools:  -Agile Project Management tools such as Jira, Asana or equivalent  -Google Suite, all Office Tools  
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level 
  • Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view   Specific Requirement: Knowledge of one or more of these skills below is preferred;
  • Partnering with hiring managers to determine staffing needs
  • Screening resumes
  • Performing in-person and phone interviews with candidates
  • Administering appropriate company assessments
  • Performing reference and background checks
  • Making recommendations to company hiring managers
  • Coordinating interviews with the hiring managers
  • Following up on the interview process status
  • Maintaining relationships with both internal and external clients to ensure staffing goals are achieved
  • Communicating employer information and benefits during screening process
  • Staying current on the company’s organization structure, personnel policy, and laws regarding employment practices
  • Serving as a liaison with area employment agencies, colleges, and industry associations
  • Completing timely reports on employment activity
  • Conducting exit interviews on terminating employees

We are a software company. Code is what we live and breathe.

But being an iOS engineer at TeraThought is so much more than writing code. It’s about creativity, solving problems, your left and right brain working together. It’s about spreading your wings beyond development and collaborating with other teams. It’s about having the courage to stay at the bleeding edge of technology, not merely keeping up with the industry standard of today, but trailblazing what it will be tomorrow. From the frontend to the backend, we have innovated on all parts of the iOS stack:

  • SwiftUI - Apple's latest UI toolkit that allows for efficient UI development
  • Kotlin Multiplatform - A shared backend with a best-in-class integration experience, even for iOS
  • Firebase, SQLDelight and Coroutines - Tooling that makes backend endpoints simple

We don't expect you to know any parts of our iOS stack, after all these tools are incredibly new. However, we expect you to be excited about learning and developing with the coolest iOS stack!

If all of that’s been the “what” and the “how”, then Connexus is the “why”. Connexus is our flagship product - it defines a new industry as the first resource sharing network. By leveraging circles of trust from existing communities, Connexus helps people borrow and lend nearly anything, saving people’s money as well as the environment.

If you’re wondering how many years of experience you need for this, don’t.

Your enthusiasm and desire to learn is far more important than how much you know coming in. We invest heavily in the growth of each of our teammates, and through our team of domain-experts, there are endless learning opportunities in and outside the world of development.

So, are you a curious, lifelong learner? Do you relish solving creative problems? Do you yearn to make a real and unique impact on the communities around you? Is a tight-knit, agile team of like-minded individuals up your alley? Are you an eager, driven individual who loves code?

Then you’re perfect for our team, and our team is perfect for you. Apply!

position: Machine Learning Remote Fellowship-United States-Mountain Time (fellowship.ai/apply)
description:
Data Science is not knowledge to be acquired but rather an art that must be learned through practice. The number one qualification employers look for when hiring a data science candidate is previous experience. Our fellowship gives aspiring data scientists the chance to hone their skills by building real-world machine learning applications.

  • build scalable machine learning models with agile software development methodology
  • full-time for 4 months mentoring by seasoned data scientists pair program with other fellows and mentors we are based in San Francisco, New York, London and Singapore
  • apply latest research in deep learning, ensemble learners, optimization techniques, etc.
  • interface directly with commercial customers
  • work on enhancement to the solution portfolio https://launchpad.ai/solutions

Check out https://platform.ai/blog which showcases the work done by some of our fellows.

Fellows from previous cohorts are now in data science roles at Uber Advanced Technologies Center, Google Brain, Sentient Technologies, Yelp, Orange, etc.

Please apply at www.fellowship.ai/apply

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications

description:
Who Are We?

Sanomind is building an audio creator platform for licensed mental health professionals. Think, Patreon for therapists.

We are an open platform where any licensed mental health professional can sign up, create, publish, and earn money from their audio content.

We respect the seriousness of mental health, but we want to make it as fun and cool as going to the gym to work on your physical body.

We're not just another mental health startup, company or directory. We're building a brand and a culture. Not just inside the company, but beyond.

Still with us? Keep reading : )

What's important to us?

We care deeply about the people who are lost and looking for answers. The people who can't afford therapy, but need a little guidance.

We want to help people who can afford therapy find the right therapist.

We care about our partners; the licensed mental health professionals on our platform and the future members.

We're looking for someone that is passionate about using technology for good. You like going in the opposite direction. You don't follow the crowd or what's "in." You start trends and create new lanes. You have ideas and more importantly, you execute on those ideas.

And of course, you are fascinated by the brain and excited about mental health and wellness.

Your Mission

• Develop internal QA process and quality plan
• Actively participating in test suite and test run design for both mobile and web application
• Develop, modify, and execute automated and manual test cases
• Prepare test statistics documentation
• Research and provide astute client software/upgrade recommendations
• Working on MixPanel to analyze the user activities and site traffic

Qualifications

• Understanding of basic software engineering concepts, software testing life cycles, and Agile development
• Knowledge of open source concepts, relational databases, and web/mobile technologies with experience in any of the following areas being a bonus: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, Appsync, AWS Amplify
• Familiarity with developer technologies and testing/collaboration tools with experience in any of the following specific areas being a bonus: Youtrack, Cypress, Github, MixPanel
• Meticulous attention to detail is required
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Proactive, team player able to work adeptly in a fast-paced environment
• Passion for quality assurance and testing of internet websites
• Ability to quickly grasp technical concepts and master new technologies

We are pre-revenue, so there is no salary at the moment

Who Are We?

We are an open platform where any licensed mental health professional can create and publish audio content.

We respect the seriousness of mental health, but we want to make it as cool as going to the gym to work on your physical body.

We're not just another mental health startup, company or directory.

Still with us? Keep reading : )

What's important to us?

We care deeply about the people who are lost and looking for answers. The people who can't afford therapy, but need a little guidance.

We care about our partners; the licensed mental health professionals on our platform and the future members.

We're looking for someone that is passionate about using technology for good. You like going in the opposite direction. You don't follow the crowd or what's "in." You start trends and create new lanes. You have ideas and more importantly, you execute on those ideas.

And of course, you are passionate about mental health and wellness.

Your Mission

In this mission, you will be an important part of the engineering team. You will be responsible for everything frontend working alongside the CTO.

At Glacier, we are taking on one of the world’s most pressing problems: trash. Did you know that in the US, we send over half of our recyclables to the landfill? We're hoping to fix that. In doing so, we’ll also be reducing carbon emissions, energy consumption, and depletion of natural resources.

Glacier’s first product is an industrial robot that sorts recyclables from trash more quickly, accurately and cheaply. This robot will divert tons of recyclables (literally!) from landfills every day.

About us:

  • This is a paid, part-time (20 hrs/wk) internship lasting 8-12 weeks. This internship can be conducted remotely or in-person at Glacier HQ in San Francisco.
  • We’re a small team based in SF: two founders (former Facebook engineering and Bain consulting) and three full-time engineers.
  • We’re backed by top-tier VCs and angels with extensive technical and industry expertise.
  • We started Glacier to have a major positive environmental impact, and we are searching for teammates who share in that mission.
  • Our prototype is already installed in a recycling facility. We’ve seen strong results so far, but we know there’s plenty of room for optimization. We’re excited for you to help us get there!

Your responsibilities:

  • Analyze the efficacy of Glacier’s new product features and experiments by collecting and interpreting large, complex data sets
  • Communicate insights to Glacier leadership to drive follow-on product decisions
  • Establish new dashboards and processes for future data collection and analysis

About you:
(If you don't think you meet all of the criteria but are excited about us, please reach out anyway!)

  • Enrolled in or recent graduate of an undergraduate or graduate college program in the US
  • Majoring in a quantitative discipline, or has significant prior quantitative coursework (relevant fields include Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or related)
  • Experience with Excel or other spreadsheet / data analysis tools
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Passion for sustainability

Who we are

EllisX is the first platform that connects early-stage startups with media and event organizers based on mutual interest. We believe that all talented people - no matter what their background is - should have access to powerful networks that enable them to succeed faster. We believe that something magical happens every time the right people are brought together, and are on a mission to foster relationships that empower innovators to succeed. We're starting by helping high-impact startups share their stories with the world more efficiently and affordably, because innovative technologies make the world better and more exciting.

Who you are

You love creating delightful web application experiences by bringing art and technology together in a unique way. You are an independent thinker who openly shares their opinions on creating a better user experience, even if they are novel and diverge from industry norms. You thrive in uncertainty and enjoy working in a really fast-paced environment. And of course, you're incredibly driven to learn new things and make a positive impact in the world.

What you’ll do

  • Collaborate with product and engineering to create a better experience for our customers
  • Build reusable frontend and backend code and libraries
  • Optimize the platform for speed and high scalability
  • Develop exciting features for our customers
  • Create and maintain automated tests to ensure and maintain the quality of the entire application

You have:

  • Built multiple high quality web applications and used the Angular and Node JS for most of them
  • Know how to design and implement efficient software architectures
  • Obtained unique insights on skillfully using basic web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
  • An understanding and ability to use version control tools, such as Git
  • Developed an appreciation for responsive design and have implemented it very well in a number of front-end applications
  • Devised creative solution(s) to a problem you are passionate about

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
