Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About You:

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

Love getting to meet new people? Want to find mentoring? What about mentoring others? Imagine being able to do all that, on your phone - anytime, anywhere.

Restvo is a mobile app that lets people connect with mentors so you can grow and develop in your work, life, and relationships. We are almost finished building out our MVP.

We are founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and we are looking for more Front-End, Back-End, and Full-Stack Developers to join us at our coworking space in Oakland.

💪Your mission (if you choose to accept it)

  • Partner closely with our CEO and dev team to build our MVP
  • Work on a mentoring software focusing on mobile-first development
  • Build Prototype, QA, and Test new features across all our platforms
  • Solve a unique problem with helping people find the right mentor
  • Come up with creative solutions and work with a great team

📐Requirements (to showcase your talent)

  • Portfolio showcasing advanced proficiency in coding
  • Experience on Android and/or iOS mobile apps a huge plus (for example Apache, Cordova, Ionic, Xamarin).
  • Typescript and Javascript experience is required. Familiarity with web frontend techniques (HTML, CSS/SASS) is required.
  • You have 1+ years of coding experience
  • Working on hybrid mobile app or native mobile apps (preferred).
  • Experience with Ionic Framework (preferred)

👍 Bonus points (show us what you got)

  • You have experience in group video chat or social networking applications
  • Have a passion for always growing, learning, and being mentored
  • You have experience with agile software development practices, and have participated in product roadmaps and development sprints before
  • You want to help churches, non-profits, schools, and local communities to grow closer thru mentoring

🚀 Working at Restvo (here are the perks)

  • Non-paid internship currently with possible stock options 💰
  • Casual dress code 👖
  • Flexible vacation 🏝
  • Opportunities for travel for conferences and professional development 🛫
  • Bi-weekly one-on-ones focused on mentorship ➕
  • Lunch-and-Learns 🤯
  • Coffee and snacks on snacks on snacks 🥕

🏙Job location

Our coworking space is located in downtown Oakland right next to Lake Merrit. We also have a healthy culture of remote syncs as well and are very flexible.

position: Junior Mobile Developer (Flutter/dart) @ Early Stage startup
description:
We’re looking for a full-time mobile developer to join the core team in an early stage mobile application. You’ll be placed in a 100% remote position. You’ll set your hours, drive your schedule, and help build out the mobile while working a little with the backend. If you’re looking for an opportunity to expand your experience in mobile development, backend, customer insights, ux or ui then this is a great time to come aboard. We’re not looking for dev shops or freelancers. Just solid developers looking to join an early stage startup.

You’ll get to build most features almost from scratch
You’ll get to help plan and describe user studies, UX & UI
You’ll get to test code
You’ll get to work with a variety of platforms like firebase, google cloud, AWS as well as a variety of languages but primarily Flutter/Dart.
Work closely with our technical co-founder and CEO

100% work from home
Set your schedule
Personal growth culture
Startup environment where 1 year is like 15 years of experience crammed into 1 year
Equity stake with vesting
Profit-sharing
Salary hike on achieveing funding or sales milestones

*About For When I *

For When I helps you give the right message at the right moment. We’re a bootstrapped pre-funding startup focused on letting you leave messages based on what others need.

If you're a self-starter who isn’t afraid to offer suggestions, interested in getting your hands dirty, and getting a ton of experience then join our team and start building something to help others be there for the ones they love.

GymHop is a startup that’s poised to change the fitness industry. By offering a way for users to get unlimited access to an entire network of gyms and fitness facilities, GymHop is bringing an offering that has never been seen before.

We are looking for a developer who is willing to join our growing team as a React Native/ReactJS front-end development intern.This role will assist in development of a Native mobile app and a ReactJS web-app. You will be working under our CTO who will handle our current Django backend development, PR and QA. This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a promising startup with a tangible offering and an app that is already built out but needs significant improvements and continual work to improve the tech.

Current app overview: GymHop is an app that offers a map of gyms to the user along with gym information, allows the user to check in & work out based on proximity to gym location, includes user profiles/editing, and subscription payments with Stripe API/ApplePay/GooglePay. Please note the app is already built but could use considerable upgrades both in UX/UI and additional features. We are largely considering an effective reboot of the app as it was coded using class-based components and redux as opposed to functional components and context.

Any ReactJS or React Native experience welcome. Someone “right out of the bootcamp” would be a viable candidate as we have another React developer who will assist in all complicated matters.

Feature examples:

  • UI updates/layout changes
  • Add Stripe Checkout (Allow users to type in credit card info instead of only using Apple Pay)
  • Optimize sign-up process
  • If this something that interests you, reach out to us and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.

  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.

  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.

  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

We're makers of Clocky, the alarm clock that runs away beeping. We have developed a tool to search for counterfeits of our product on various platforms like Amazon, Ebay and other E-commerce retailers. We have our code stored on GitHub. The language used is Python/Django, and we host the tool on the Heroku platform.
Currently we have several "search terms" to find counterfeits of our product, but for each search term, we have to download a report of the counterfeit listings. We need you to consolidate the search terms so that there is only one download per E-commerce platform.
In addition, sometimes Heroku doesn't load or is down. We are wondering if anything can be done about that, or if we should consider moving the tool to another platform.

b) How many hours would you like to work per week?

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

position: Market Research & Data Analytics Intern or Contractor
description:
Who we are: EmTech Care Labs is an early-stage healthtech startup focused on developing affordable daily care management technologies for elders and their families to support independent living and aging-in-place.

Who you are: Excited about driving health and financial wellness especially for elders and their family caregivers, and working with a fast-paced startup in its early stages.

General role expectations: Assist the Founder in conducting market research, data gathering & analysis for supplementing product development. This role entails:

  • Helping define our data strategies to inform and drive product development:

    • Identifying data sources and conduct relevant data evaluation & validation
    • Collecting relevant datasets, evaluate/parse/validate/analyze data and develop models for appropriate use of data
    • Structuring large data sets to find usable information
    • Gathering information about relevant APIs for data extraction
    • Using graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data

  • Conducting detailed consumer research for target market validation and go-to-market partnership and channel identification

  • Supporting surveys and focus groups for product testing and user feedback

Other expectations:

  • Academic and/or real-world exposure to market & product research, data collection, modeling and dataset creation will be beneficial
  • Be curious and creative about navigating new tasks
  • Be flexible; we are a young startup! You will work directly with the Founder and have the opportunity to contribute to the future of this venture
  • Position would be ideal for undergraduate (juniors or seniors) and graduate students majoring in social services, geriatric care, healthcare, business, finance and/or technology, and could also be eligible for academic credit
  • Also considering contractors for a 3-6month timeframe
  • Candidate should either be knowledgeable or curious to learn more about eldercare, with an eye towards eldercare in multi-generational families and underserved communities. Please include your expression of interest regarding this in your application

Canopy Analytics is hiring a software engineering intern. As part of the early team, you will be a strong individual contributor. You will delivering high-quality code quickly, and also be mentored by the rest of the team.

Canopy Analytics is a small but mighty team. With just three founders, we bootstrapped an enterprise SaaS platform, grew +500% in the last year, raised a strong round from top-tier investors, and our customers depend on our software everyday. The key to our success has been a strong team obsessed with customer experience and great product engineering.

What you'll work on

We're a web based cloud platform. We build analytics, workflows and alerts that let our customer navigate their data. We update our system nightly through our ETL processes, translating customer data into a common format that's easy to query and visualize. Managing a common format requires deep understanding of our integrations. To manage the complexity, we focus on a strong writing/documentation culture, high test coverage, and keeping low technical debt.

You'll work closely with Sameer Siruguri, CTO. He will help you navigate the codebase, coach you through problems we have encountered before, and set overall goals.

When building features, you'll collaborate closely with Jessica Willis, head of design. You'll influence features at every step. You'll start with ETL, analyze the data, ensure the design reflects the data, and translate mockups into code. You'll also help Jessica understand technical nuance and negotiate scope.

Recent projects

  • Feature: Track revenue changes in real time based on changes in the market and their strategy. This is an industry first and was done entirely manually previously.
  • Performance: Introduce Redis for SQL caching
  • Operations: Production data verification in our ETL pipeline

Tech stack

We use Ruby on Rails with server-rendered HTML. On the front end, Typescript is our primary language. We "sprinkle" interactivity using Stimulus and Chartist for visualizations. Our data is backed by Postgres and Redis. We make extensive use of window functions, rollup tables and caching to keep our application fast. We use RSpec and fixtures for testing (and our coverage is pretty good). The application is hosted on Heroku and we deploy multiple times a day.

Our priorities are shipping velocity and correctness. We're thinking through:

  • What's the best way to catch bugs before they happen? Will gradual typing through Sorbet or RBI help?
  • How can we build more interactive visualizations and product? Should we use StimulusReflex or Hotwire?
  • How can we dynamically show the KPIs we think our customers should worry about throughout the data? What is the role of predictive analytics in this scenario?

Mission

We started Canopy Analytics because we want more housing to be built so cities can be more affordable. We embedded ourselves in the commercial real estate industry to understand their business problems. We found that they didn't have the tools to adequately deal with their scale. This drives up costs and makes it hard to deploy capital. Our early customers have seen over $1M of impact annually and we've barely scratched the surface. Our vision is to be the software that operates and finances the next generation of cities.

Requirements

  • We’re looking for someone with Ruby experience. Front-end programming experience, especially with Typescript and modern browser APIs, is a plus but not a requirement.
  • Excellent project management skills is a must. Your ability to break down a complex task into smaller steps helps you anticipate what edge cases might have been ignored. You thoughtfully communicate potential solutions and delegate the decision.
  • Written and verbal communication skills are highly valued. You proactively document and explain project status and technical details to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • You have the forensic skills to start with a bug report, track down the area of code that is causing the problem, and quickly identify a solution that can both address the bug and also improve the state of the codebase.
  • You can proactively suggest ways to make our QA processes better, and ways in which the engineering team can create tooling that supports the QA team.
  • No industry (real estate) experience is necessary but you have to be excited to empower a customer base of non-technical users. We want to hear your ideas about how to make this intuitive and fun.

Culture

  • Our customer base is nearly 60% women and we're committed to building a diverse workforce which reflects our industry segment.
  • We're a team first. No one should feel under appreciated or feel they can't do their best work because of someone else on the team.
  • Invest in our people. It's critical we learn from each other as well as bring outside resources for training and mentorship.
  • Performance matters. We are proud of our results and reward those who contribute to them.

Compensation

  • $25 / hr pay. Opportunity to continue work after summer is available. Part time through school year and full time after graduation.
  • Onsite 3 days in Oakland office, 2 WFH. Flexible schedule and PTO.

Apply now!

Email sunny.juneja@canopyanalytics.com with the subject line "Future Engineer Intern - {Your Name}." Replace {Your Name} with your name. In the body, mention where you saw this job posting and attach a resume. We would love to hear about what excites you about this position.

We foster a transparent, positive and smart working environment. We believe in listening more to diverse viewpoints and have a flat team structure. Gratitude is a much appreciated attitude in our team as much as respect for every individual within and outside our organization.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

JOB DESCRIPTION
RoboDel is looking for a Robot Engineer Intern. The primary focus will be on the navigation software of ground-based mobile robots. This include building software for planning, controls, etc. The incumbent should be capable of building and delivering functioning robotics systems software that will be deployed on a global scale. The position will start as soon as possible.

PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in ROS
  • Highly skilled in motion planning and control theory (e.g., model predictive control, vehicle dynamic modeling)
  • Understanding of variety of planning techniques (D*, RRTs, PRMs, etc.)
  • Extensive software development experience (C/C++, Python)

BONUS QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in autonomous robot Industry
  • Familiarity with ROS and/or other message networking middleware
  • SLAM / Probabilistic Filtering experience
  • Reinforcement learning experience
  • Experience with real-time sensor fusion (e.g. IMU, lidar, camera, odometry, radar)

TERM
About 20 hours per week. The best candidate later will be offered a full-time position.**

APPLICATION PROCEDURES:
Interested candidates are welcome to apply for this position by sending resume
and a cover letter to: careers@robo-del.com indicating the position title
("Robot Engineer Intern - Motion Planning") in the subject line of the email.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We are an Autonomous Delivery Vehicle start-up having teams from several countries like the USA, India, Armenia, etc. We’re looking for a strong mechanical engineer intern to join our organization. Our ideal candidate will have experience with the entire product lifecycle, ushering mechanical solutions from research and design through implementation.

OBJECTIVE OF THE ROLE

  • Analyze mechanical problems and produce innovative solutions using multiple fabrications and material methods, including injection molding, aluminum castings, machined parts, and sheet metal
  • Oversee and engage in product development from design and development through implementation, monitoring progress and status of all assignments and report progress and problems to management
  • Evaluate mechanical designs for potential flaws and offer modifications to eliminate potential problems
  • Comply with all federal regulations and maintain organizational values and standards

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work on product-sustaining projects, which involve replacement or redesign for obsolete components, product improvement features, cost reduction, manufacturing support, and field complaints
  • Prepare assembly or product layout and detailed drawings, and participate in the manufacture or building of prototype product or system
  • Provide tolerances studies, apply GD&T, conduct stress-analysis studies, develop reliability testing procedures, and generates appropriate design verification reports
  • Design testing methods to analyze product capabilities and troubleshoot any mechanical or structural flaws
  • Ensure that design implementation, test, and maintenance methods/processes are developed and executed in a manner that supports company quality standards
  • Participate in scheduled department meetings to report the progress of the overall project or portion of the project, and prepare and give design presentations, and mentor junior engineers

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering and relevant professional experience
  • Working knowledge of analytic tools, such as ANSYS and ProMechanica
  • Working knowledge of core engineering concepts, including, but not limited to, mechanics, materials science, and thermodynamics
  • Proven experience with product development and the entirety of the product life cycle
  • Strong ability with computer-aided design systems, including CAM and CAE

BONUS QUALIFICATIONS

  • Master’s degree or a Ph.D in mechanical engineering
  • Experience developing innovative solutions to a range of mechanical problems
  • Experience designing ground vehicle body parts.

TERM
This is an unpaid internship with about 20 hours weekly commitment. The best candidate later will be offered a full-time position.**

APPLICATION PROCEDURES
Interested candidates are welcome to apply for this position by submiting resume and a cover letter using this link.

Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for someone to build a project managment software for our company. We already have one iteration and can provide you the source code. This would be a great portfolio item for all applicants.

The Developer must be able and willing to work with an iOS app already built with Swift and/or an Android app already built with Java.

position: Software Development Engineer Intern (React / NodeJS) - Gaming Startup
description:
JOB DETAILS:

We are hiring an experienced React/NodeJS developer and DevOps engineer. In this part-time role, you will be part of a strong development team and will be involved in building and enhancing our application. Your team will be based worldwide and is critical in supporting our products and services, as well as integrating security features in the workflow. You will be working under our CTO alongside other developers. This is a fast moving startup in the United States working on an interesting problem in the burgeoning esports and gaming space.

~60 hours per month

Expected Start Date: Flexible, but as soon as available

Job Type: Part-time, internship

DESIRED SKILLS:

1+ years of industry experience with (or in pursuit of) a Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

1+ years of React development experience

1+ years of NodeJS development experience

1+ years of DevOps Experience with Google Cloud

Experience with testing React & NodeJS

Experience with Github

Problem solving and troubleshooting design and development issues and provide appropriate solutions

Ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal, with technical and non-technical cross-functional teams

Experience in Agile methodologies

Interesting in gaming and/or esports

COMPANY SUMMARY:

Spark Esports is an early gaming startup. Spark is an all in one team management web application for coaches and players of Esports teams at educational institutions, pro organizations, and amateur teams.

The Tactician

We deliver data-driven sports journalism to provide an unmatched perspective on the world of sports. We have a commitment to innovation that lies at the heart of everything we do, not just for our platform but also for our teammates. As a new organization, you’ll be given a hands-on, self-driven project that makes a real business impact. Throughout you’ll work one-on-one with a mentor and have access to learning experiences, such as data science sessions with our analysts. With our focus on cross-functional collaboration and global mindset, as a Rookie, you get to see how your work goes way beyond yourself.

What you will do:

• Collaborate with our sports analysts team to write impactful, data-driven content that is specific and nuanced for a highly-diversified audience.

• Partner with other analysts, web designers, invent new ways to bring your stories to life through graphics, videos, presentations, engaging web pages, interactive maps, and more.

• Pitch and report original visual stories.

You Have:

• Prior experience using Tableau (R/Python preferred but not required), and a good understanding of sports and sports analytics.
• An interest in data journalism and associated tools, such as Tableau, Excel, R, and Python.
• Can work quickly and efficiently under tight deadlines.

To apply, please submit a resume and 1-2 work samples that show your skills.
