position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

*Job Description *

We are looking for a backend engineer / developer who can join us at an early stage. We are a startup company and you will be one of the first backend engineers / developers to join us. You will work directly with CTO where you can discuss and build the entire app's infrastructure together with our CTO.
You will be responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the mobile app. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.

Responsibilities

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic
  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Effectively collaborate with product teams and engineering professionals (especially Front End engineers)
  • Optimize the platform for faster execution and solve scalability issues
  • Implement security & data protection practices
  • Experiment, architect, design and build APIs, data storage solutions, services & other engineering projects

Skills And Qualifications

  • Typescript and NodeJS in developing web apps
  • Rest APIs and web services and websocket.
  • AWS Lambda, SQS, and Gateway
  • Data Modeling and writing optimal queries for either Aurora, MySQL or PostgreSQL
  • Designing and building scalable and highly available software architectures
  • Experience working with a lot of data
  • Fluency in backend technologies like Node.js, Python, PHP, Java, Ruby, etc.
  • Proficient knowledge of REST API design methodologies, session management, and operating high throughput systems
  • Experience with automated testing platforms and code versioning tools such as Git
  • Basic familiarity with front-end technologies (JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3)
  • Understanding of database administration, scripting, data migration & backup, authentication, authorization, and security compliance standards
  • Excellent command of algorithms and data structures, time and space complexity, distributed systems, and multithreaded architectures
  • Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
  • Good spoken and written English skills
  • English language is a requirement, and the ability to collaborate effortlessly over daily video calls with CTO.

Nice-to-Haves:

  • Education: Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent with 2+ years of experience as a backend engineer/developer (we make rare exceptions if you are highly skilled)
  • Ability to think critically
  • Willingness to help design the architecture and future direction of the project
  • React - for pages of low complexity
  • AWS Cloudwatch - Logging, metrics and alarms
  • NoSQL databases
  • CI/CD workflows

We know the Skills And Qualifications list is too long but you do not have to master everything. If you master enough to be able to build backend infrastructure, send your application.

Work on building our core application in flutter.
Analyze and maintain existing software applications.
Design highly scalable, testable code.
Discover and fix programming bugs.

You will be responsible for creating daily content for the major social platforms. We don't expect you to have any knowledge of artificial intelligence, but we expect you to learn the basics of hal9.ai and help us build visualizations, examples, tutorials, reports and share them in social media platforms like Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitch and even TikTok.

You should be excited to learn a little bit of data analysis, visualization and artificial intelligence and be able to share that excitement with others.

We will work with you to figure out the content that fits your style. Can be anything from art, infographics, blog posts, videos, to visualizations, data analysis or even small artificial intelligence projects.

The ideal candidate is passionate for content creation, data science and/or web development.

HAPPY MOBILITY is an autonomous vehicle startup with an artificial intelligence technology solution to make drivers better and our communities safer and more efficient. Our ideal candidate is a problem solver, quick learner, and hard worker. We are excited to expand our team with innovative and creative talents in our Bethesda office.

Job Description

• Building complex Android/iOS mobile applications.
• Applying computer science and object-oriented design principles to creating an elegant mobile user experience and sophisticated functionality.
• Developing unit tests and integration tests to ensure quality and efficiency of the application.
• Participating in architecture, design and code reviews.

Required qualifications

• Able to work independently with minimal direction
• Self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
• Earned or will earn an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field required
• Development experience of C#, .Net, and Xamarin.Forms
• Knowledge of iOS or Android development
• Experience deploying apps through PlayStore, Appstore and other channels
• Experience taking projects from concept to launch
• Ability to debug and fix complex issues
• Experience building custom UIs
• Experience developing mobile to cloud and mobile to embedded device communications
• Proven abilities to work closely and effectively with engineering and non-engineering teams

Preferred qualifications

• Experience working with sensors (e.g. accelerometer, gyrometer, etc.), GPS, cameras, videos etc. a plus
• Experience working with deep learning algorithms a plus
• Native development experience for the either Android (Kotlin) or iOS (Swift).

We are looking for a front-end web developer to work with us on short and long-term Shopify projects, as well as help us build and grow our own agency site. The ideal candidate has a passion and talent for learning new things quickly and easily, has a strong eye for detail and design, and has a strong foundation in modern front-end languages. This role works efficiently, values honesty and integrity, and is highly dedicated to delivering excellent work.

Responsibilities:
Develop front-end code for Shopify-based websites on behalf of clients
Help our marketing team set up tracking and troubleshooting
Help maintain and build for our agency site
Collaborate with our in-house and client teams as needed

Requirements:
Must have at least 1 year of relevant work experience or relevant degree
Solid grasp of translating comps and wireframes into semantically correct web templates (HTML5, CSS, vanilla JS)
Solid understanding of jQuery and RESTful APIs
Experience with Github and version control is a must
Experience with Shopify API, Slate/ThemeKit preferred
Knowledge of responsive and adaptive design principles
Ability to write and structure maintainable, efficient, clean code
Great communication skills and responsiveness
Good eye for design details
Ability to work independently
Must be fluent (written and spoken) in English
Loves logic, problem-solving, and learning new things

  • This is an unpaid internship that you can receive school credit for

For more about Cazo, check out our website at cazowellness.com We look forward to getting to know you (and to helping you get glowing skin!)

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

description:
Machine Learning Intern:

We’d love you to bring:

  • Currently enrolled in a Master’s or Ph.D. program in a relevant field
  • Candidates about to complete a Bachelor’s degree will be considered with demonstrated ML experience
  • Programming experience in Python and Tensorflow/PyTorchExperience building ML solutions and experimenting to improve ML system performance
  • A desire to build cool cutting edge ML tech
  • Strong understanding of probability and machine learning
  • Self-motivation, and ability to work independently as well as with a remote team
  • Belief in creating diverse, equitable, and inclusive practices and programs that will further Knock’s commitment to making an impact, learning, putting people first, being open, and courageous
  • We encourage you to apply even if you don’t have every listed requirement
  • Knock is a 100% remote, work from home culture and has been since our inception in 2015 As a Machine Learning Intern, your journey will look like this: Week 1: you will begin learning about our machine learning models. Week 2: you will have a reasonably scoped machine learning project to dive into, enabling you to demonstrate your skills and have an impact immediately. During your internship, you’ll have an opportunity to engage with not only other machine learning engineers and data scientists, but also members of the engineering and product teams. In the process, you’ll gain a better understanding of how our pricing models impact Knock’s operations and ultimately the customer. You will have access to all our data and AWS computing resources to query, explore, and train models using the data using any programming language and packages you feel you prefer. But most importantly, you’ll have the time and space to experiment, read academic literature, develop new skills, and learn about existing methodologies that may contribute to advancing Knock’s machine learning technology!

What is Pathrise?Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we’d like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our MissionWe seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we’re driven to do this in our manifesto.

The RoleWe’re looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

Responsibilities

  • Handling 1-on-1 admissions sessions, technical interview prep and occasional behavioral prep
  • Investing in students’ personal stories and advising them on their career trajectory in the admissions calls and giving proactive feedback
  • Building up and improving on the admissions process for data fellows
  • Conduct data analysis for Pathrise and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the data track

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience working on data-related projects whether that be in academic projects, internships or other related work experience
  • A passion for mentorship!
  • Be available for 10+ hours a week
  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Growing employees: we value giving and receiving feedback (constructively) and we value continuous improvement. We want you to grow professionally and we include a professional development stipend to help you achieve that.
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‘DEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.’ We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We cannot sponsor visas for this role at the time. Thank you for your interest.

Pathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are also interested in the fellowship, please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.

Who we are

Lilt is a language translation services and technology company. We're building the next generation of localization, making it possible for every organization to communicate with their customers in the language of their choice through Lilt's high-quality, scalable, and affordable translation services.

We recruit the world's best human translators and equip them with our software, allowing them to translate better and faster than ever. By combining human expertise and machine efficiency in a complete enterprise localization solution, we can deliver technology-enabled translation services to our customers.

Lilt is backed by some of the world's leading investors including Intel Capital, Sequoia, and Redpoint. Our customers include some of the largest Fortune 500 companies in the world who rely on Lilt every day to provide more personal customer experiences in 300+ languages.

Our team is headquartered in San Francisco with additional offices in Berlin, Indianapolis, and Dublin.

Who we want

Come join our managed services operations! As a Localization Intern, you will have the opportunity to support our services management team in managing and running localization projects end-to-end. You will learn to work with and communicate effectively with clients, translators, and other stakeholders involved.

Learn first-hand how a fast-growing technology startup functions. As a member of Lilt’s Services team, you will learn about product development, sales, customer success, marketing, and localization. You will be exposed to all cross-functional teams and walk away with a robust knowledge and understanding of all functions of the business.

This is an entry-level paid internship.

This position will be based out of our San Francisco or Indianapolis office. This role will work remotely from SF or IN during the pandemic, but will be expected to work in the office once it is safe to do so.

Localization Management

  • Working with Translation Services Managers, Project Managers and our Linguist community on localization projects and tasks.
  • Coordinating project schedules, resources, status reports and deliverables within time, quality and cost parameters.
  • Receive training on our Lilt platform for translator and project management tasks.
  • Learn more about adaptive technology and how AI is enabling us to be the worlds #1 language service provider.

Skills and Experience

  • No work experience necessary
  • Open to recent graduates and current university students
  • Strong email communication skills
  • Ability to build relationships and collaborate cross-functionally
  • Resourcefulness, initiative and drive!

We are committed to equality and diversity within our company. Lilt does not discriminate on gender, gender identity, skin color, national origin, sexual orientation, religion, age or disability.

Our team builds new technologies that protect millions of people from phishing attacks. We aspire and succeed to reach far beyond today’s security market.

We are seeking a talented Security Engineer to identify, track, and defeat sophisticated targeted cyber attackers as part of our new PhishGuard team. In this position, you will examine and mitigate phishing attacks in realtime.

As a Security Engineer, your experience, thinking, and action will be the key to our success. You will develop software and algorithms to help. identify Cyber Attacks in the real world. You will collaborate with our team to develop new ways to present and interact with our insights. You will stop the adversary. You will show the world how the adversary works.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Incoming 2nd or 3rd Year Undergraduate enrollment at US College Degree Program in one of the following majors: Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, or Computer Security. Sorry, graduates of these programs will not be considered for this opportunity. Graduate students are also ineligible for this position.
  • Current GPA of 3.1 or higher. GPA proof will be required.
  • Ability to synthesize technical information and document it in a non-technical manner including through graphical and verbal depictions
  • Excellent english writing skills
  • Experience with Domain Names, IP Addresses, Emails (Subject, From, To, Addresses), Hyperlinks, DNS, IPv4, IPv6

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience writing Go, Python, React
  • Experience with Postgres, BigQuery
  • Experience with REDIS
  • Experience with Kafka

DUTIES

  • Drive the next wave of security technology through prototyping concepts into solutions
  • Define, design and implement software to address tactical and strategic purposes
  • Collaborate with researchers to apply research techniques at scale
  • Work with large scale data systems

TIMING

  • This is a summer 2021 position.

About Alchemy Worx:
Alchemy Worx is an audience management agency specializing in email marketing, SMS marketing, and paid social. The agency offers businesses advanced marketing services, utilizing time-tested methods, and procedures to secure a higher rate of customer retention.

Over the last two years, we’ve seen our company grow quickly in all directions. The technical foundation supporting our company is expanding and requires more attention and support from our technical team.

We’re looking for someone who would like to grow along with us. Develop your skills, learn new ones, and watch the company mature along the way. We have projects ranging from adhoc automation to stand-alone microservice development, from SQL query optimization to providing custom CRM support to our team. This will be an hourly role at $15/hr.

What You'll Do:

  • Work with a small technical team spread across three different countries
  • You will be working alongside them to accomplish long-term goals by taking them head-on in manageable chunks
  • Team meetings twice per week for a 30-minute stand-up to identify pain points and next steps. You’ll join in shortly as projects are provisioned in your direction
  • Support the rest of the company, mostly communicating with Marketing Strategists and Analysts
  • Ability to effectively communicate with team members who have a different lexicon to their role is extremely important

Requirements:

  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Experience coding in Python, Shell-Script, and SQL
  • Working knowledge of Pandas, NumPy, Flask, and Requests
  • Available to work 8 hours per day on the US Eastern time zone
  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Nice to have: cloud-development experience, as we are wholly cloud-deployed

How You’ll Be Working With Us
We are (mostly) a fully remote team. Like many other companies, COVID forced us to figure out how we best communicate with one another. We collaborate over Slack and email to get the job done from home and, for some, from the office once in a while.

We don’t expect you to be anywhere you’re not comfortable; remote candidates are the expectation. The only requirements are you should be able to work standard US Eastern hours, you’re comfortable to work where you are, and you have a strong internet connection.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

At Overjet, we are building applications that improve healthcare, dentistry in particular, by leaps and

bounds. We are solving the most challenging problems in dentistry to improve care for millions of

patients. Come join us as a senior software/full-stack/backend engineer and be an integral part of an

exceptional team.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop Java Spring Boot based enterprise applications for an SaaS product
  • Architect, implement, and optimize scalable databases
  • Enhance quality, usability, performance, security, and reliability of systems
  • Design, develop, test, maintain, monitor, debug, etc.
  • Collaborate with other teams to prioritize tasks and deliver results on time

Required skills:

  • 2+ years' experience building backend applications
  • Experience in at least one cloud stack - GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Expertise in Java and Java Spring frameworks
  • Proficiency in both SQL as well as NoSQL databases, especially Postgres
  • Knowledge of REST APIs
  • Knowledge of Pub sub mechanisms
  • Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Preferred skills:

  • Developer certificate from either AWS or GCP or Azure
  • Grasp of GraphQL frameworks, especially SPQR
  • Implementation experience on Near Real time systems
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, i.e. storage, compute, cloud sql, app engine and k8s
  • Work experience in healthcare domain a plus
  • Knowledge of automation testing frameworks, TDD, and integration testing

Aquabyte is enhancing its underwater camera system. This is a significant mechanical design challenge. We are seeking a person with a background in Mechanical Engineering. In this position, you will be responsible for working with one of Aquabyte’s senior system architects to develop a prototype mechanism that will make underwater movement of the camera system easier.

Watch our TV episode with Amazon's CTO at a Norwegian fish farm here! https://youtu.be/YZ_qJ5JFD3I

Our mission

Aquabyte is on a mission to revolutionize the sustainability and efficiency of aquaculture. It is an audacious, and incredibly rewarding mission. By making fish farming cheaper and more viable than livestock production, we aim to mitigate one of the biggest causes of climate change and help prepare our planet for impending population growth. Aquaculture is the single fastest growing food-production sector in the world, and now is the time to define how technology is used to harvest the sea and preserve for generations to come.

We are a diverse, mission-driven team that is eager to work alongside kindred spirits. If this vision makes you smile, gives you goosebumps, or otherwise inspires you please get in touch.

Responsibilities

  • Collaboration with the Product Team to interpret product requirements into mechanical design
  • Materials analysis to determine the best materials for the system
  • Component design and fabrication - Using CAD, provide detailed specification for the major system components.
  • Work with manufacturing vendors to make prototype units
  • Embedded programming of a motor controller

Qualifications

  • Completion of Bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Robotics Engineering
  • Familiarity with CAD tools: Inventor or Solidworks or equivalent
  • Experience with motors
  • Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
  • GPA of 3.2 or higher

Bonus Qualifications

  • Experience with gears and/or bearings
  • Experience with tech startups
  • Demonstrated interest in learning new technologies outside of academic discipline
  • Robotics experience or coursework

Aquabyte is a private company headquartered in San Francisco, and is supported by NEA, Costanoa Ventures, and many other respected investors.

At Aquabyte, we admire interesting people with a unique background. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you don’t satisfy all the requirements, and we will get back to you as soon as possible!

💘 Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

👀 The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society’s relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We’re on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal — we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Test Engineering Intern (Season Flexible)

We are looking for self-starting interns with a passion for learning and growth mindsets. Candidates must be highly motivated and willing to intern with SOE for three to six months. Interns will gain a range of hands-on test engineering experience going through a range of test campaigns for engineering hardware.

SOE’s interns have the opportunity to gain significant on the job learning and will directly apply engineering fundamentals to produce impactful results.

Responsibilities:

  • Interns will report to a mentor who will be responsible for candidate feedback and learning— mentors will also assign tasks and projects to work closely with the teams
  • Using electrical test equipment to make measurements and troubleshoot components
  • Working with data acquisition systems and control systems to continually improve in-test data recording and usability of the systems
  • Gaining exposure to designing, assembling, and testing custom hardware/electrical systems for our customers
  • Generating and use test systems and procedures while operating hardware under environmental tests
  • Writing automation and interface software in Python for testing, troubleshooting, and production checkouts

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in or graduate of an accredited four-year university or college for relevant degree programs (Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Industrial Engineering, Math, or related field)
  • Programming skills with an object-oriented programming language (e.g., Python, C++, Java) and experience generating maintainable code for applications that interface with test equipment
  • Basic knowledge of physics with respect to electricity, magnetism, and electronic circuits
  • Curious and passionate about electrical engineering and technology with the ability to learn and take instruction
  • Strong attention to detail, with care and consideration when handling test equipment or hardware

Preferred Skills Experience:

  • Experience in a team-based design and build project (e.g., Formula SAE, Solar Car, CubeSat, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Python and/or MATLAB for data parsing and data visualization
  • Exposure to automated test systems and test equipment; experience with datalogging, and data processing software
  • Experience with control system logic and interfacing with test equipment and hardware
  • Familiarity with aerospace environmental testing such as thermal cycling, vibration, shock, thermal vacuum, and EMI/EMC
  • Experience with continuous testing or related high-reliability software development strategies
  • Experience with Linux operating systems

position: Perception Software Engineering Intern (Summer or Fall 2021)
description:
ABOUT ZIPLINE

Do you want to change the world? Zipline uses drones to deliver critical and lifesaving medicine to thousands of hospitals serving millions of people in multiple countries. Our mission is to provide every human on Earth with instant access to vital medical supplies. Join Zipline and help us make this a reality for billions of people.

ABOUT YOU AND THE ROLE

Note: This is a paid opportunity, and if needed we will accommodate a student visa.

Zipline is at the forefront of a logistics revolution, using autonomous aircraft to deliver just-in-time, lifesaving medical supplies on multiple continents, 7 days a week. We believe access to medical care should not depend on your GPS coordinates. In service of our mission to operate at global scale, we’re growing our perception capabilities, to expand quickly and safely into new products and locations, with the ultimate goal of delivering essential packages right to your doorstep. Our perception software team is looking for an intern who is passionate about developing perception systems for the real world.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Work with a multidisciplinary team to evaluate, select and calibrate next-generation sensor configurations for our vehicles
  • Leverage state estimation, object tracking, and mapping techniques to design integrated solutions that enable our highly maneuverable aircraft to perceive general aviation aircraft, power lines, radio towers and other challenging obstacles, so that we can steer clear of, dodge, or otherwise avoid them
  • Design perception systems that can understand and communicate when they are not working well
  • Enable algorithmic improvement by leveraging our large-scale fleet data
  • Understand the inner workings of the perception stack, sometimes all the way down to the signal processing at our sensors, to uncover edge cases and make safety determinations
  • Identify and mitigate bottlenecks in our evaluation tools and processes
  • Work closely with the behaviors team to help inform path planning and real-time decision-making in response to perception outputs

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

Strong applicants will be able to demonstrate strength in the following:

  • Strong software engineering skills, with mastery of relevant languages like C++ or Python that makes use of advanced features, and demonstrates good software engineering practices
  • Automated software testing within a continuous integration environment
  • Analytical approach to evaluating the performance of perception algorithms
  • Generalist mindset, with the willingness and ability to work cross platform, from spooling up cloud compute services to optimizing for embedded systems

Additionally strong applicants will be able to demonstrate strength in one or more of the following areas:

  • Understanding of the theory and practice of modern machine learning techniques
  • Experience building reproducible data and machine learning pipelines
  • Experience deploying machine learning solutions on real robots
  • Training off-the-shelf neural networks for a problem and benchmarking against other solutions
  • Camera calibration, multi-view geometry, and stereo disparity estimation
  • State estimation techniques used in visual SfM, SLAM, and 3D Object Tracking

At Umba, we are building a digital bank for emerging markets, offering intelligent, affordable financial products. One third of the worlds 2 billion unbanked people live in Sub-Saharan Africa, and we are here to bring these customers free banking services and bring them into the formal financial system. It's an exciting mission and one that we are excited to deliver on.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone has access to liquid capital, free money transfers, and saving & investment opportunities. If you're curious about Fintech or emerging markets and have a passionate, hardworking spirit, work with us and let's put opportunity in everyone's pocket.

Building a software platform that is reliable, scales, and achieves excellent uptime while serving emerging markets with immature tech stacks is a serious technical challenge.

You're fun to work with! We are a very diverse and friendly team that prioritizes building relationships and unlocking everyone's full potential
You're willing to work onsite in our office in North Beach, San Francisco!

Valid work authorization for US

Want to make an impact this year? At Assured, you'll work with a 7 person team of extraordinarily passionate engineers working to reimagine the insurance industry.

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.🏡 If you choose to join us in person in Palo Alto, housing is included!💸 Highly competitive pay. If we love you, we'll pay whatever it takes.🛫 Ever wanted to be a pilot? One free flying lesson from our co-founder.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry.

There's so much to do. We can't wait for you to join us.

You'd love this role if...

🔥 You're passionate about reimagining archaic industries🖖 You want to work on a small, close knit team of brilliant engineers consumed by a consequential and yet-unsolved problem🐾 Being a trailblazer—in our architecture, in our approach, and in our team—is an inspiration, not a burden

You will...

🌱 Grow as an engineer with our help, working across the stack as you own features from ideation to production🗣️ Interact with stakeholders ranging from end-users to insurance adjusters💎 Use modern frontend frameworks like React and GraphQL to build single-page applications🔎 Collaborate with the CEO and CTO to identify and prioritize the most impactful improvements to our product😍 Implement delightful, functional user experiences

You may be a fit if you...

🔧 Build software to solve problems💪 Have substantial, self-initiated projects that you're proud of🚀 Want to dive into the world of startups

Bonus points...✨ We're currently using Typescript, Node.js, React, and GraphQL, however that will evolve. The most important thing is that you're nimble, intelligent, and hard working.
