Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail and time management skills in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and manage deadlines
  • All majors are accepted! Passion for customer success and curiosity about new and exciting technologies a must!
  • Are you passionate about Gaming? Love to exceed customer expectations?

Helpshift embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Interested in working on hard problems at scale?

We are looking for current and graduating MSc/PhD students who would like to work with us on a research project. You should have some prior practical industry experience, strong coding and software engineering skills, as well as a publications in relevant CV/ML conferences or journals.

IMI builds ML products and services used by some of the largest companies in the world. Come learn from our veteran team of machine learning and distributed systems experts, hailing from Stanford, MIT, Apple, and Cloudera.

We are now opening applications for our 2020 ML Fellows/Interns program. You will be expected to work remotely: we have a large distributed workforce working alongside the teams in our San Francisco, Berlin, or Helsinki centers, and we are highly comfortable with remote collaboration.

We conduct original research in areas like unsupervised and active learning, motivated by the unique problems and datasets we have access to as one of the larger users of cloud resources for ML.

You will have the opportunity to publish with our scientists if your work yields results, and we have a strong commitment to open source code and (when possible) datasets.

Research interests:
A background in representation learning, theoretical computer vision, or statistical physics will be helpful, as well as applied applications of Deep Learning to Computer Vision problems.

Current areas of interest include Active Learning, Self- and Semi-supervised learning, Uncertainty Estimation (Bayesian Neural Networks), Anomaly detection, Deep Hashing for Image Retrieval, Weak Supervision, Zero-shot learning, Domain Adaptation, Meta-Learning.

Functional skills:
We work primarily in Python for research, with pyTorch and Tensorflow being our preferred tools. You will have access to our in-house distributed training and inference infrastructure, which has been designed for ease of use but still benefits from basic knowledge of distributed systems.
Experience with cloud-based training and dealing with preprocessing huge datasets is beneficial.

We also strive for a high degree of programming competence within our research group, as we have found that good discipline in implementing ideas makes your task easier and collaboration more pleasant. If you are one of the many excellent researchers who have never written a unit test this will likely change.

Please send your CV, github, and a brief description of what most interests you, along with your dates of availability and preferred location.

IMI does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, or marital status.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 3-6 Months software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced, startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission-driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well-tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high-performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well-tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage
  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2017 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

About Lunchclub

At Lunchclub we're helping people relevantly grow their professional network. We use AI to scale data-driven matches to thousands of people weekly, small groups of like-minded individuals, and panels with some of the world's best. We've introduced people who have started companies together, received/given mentorship, received funding, made their next hire, or friend. We're a small, tight-knit, but distributed team, powering connections in and between 57 cities across 6 continents.

About engineering at Lunchclub

We're a small team of generalist software engineers driving big outcomes with a lot of shared responsibility. We often work outside the traditional Fullstack/Backend/Frontend mould to create, fix, and improve Lunchclub for our users and fellow engineers. Our engineers also actively take part in discussions on product, design, user interviews, and more. The fastest way to learn technology is to build things at an early stage startup — we expect you to grow a lot as an engineer during your time here.

About the role

As a software engineer intern at Lunchclub you'll...

Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish.Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback.Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community.Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.

This role could be for you if...

You love problem solving — especially with code.You're looking to grow quickly as an engineer and do not fear ownership, even at an early stage of your career.You know how to balance building quickly with building well.

Bonus: You're adept with Javascript/React, Python/Flask, MySQL, Docker.

Benefits

Flexible vacation time.Hybrid remote/office work culture.

Lunchclub is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Learn more about us here: https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/18/lunchclub-raises-4m-from-a16z-for-its-ai-warm-intro-service.

For more information on what we do, here is the link to our overview deck: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lcaJmWVD6OuVpXUUmfRUWq08daPrEzs3/view?usp=sharing

We are looking for a skilled Mechanical Engineer to join our team who will be responsible for working on all stages of our production cycles, from research and design to manufacturing, installation, and evaluation. The Mechanical Engineers will be most focused on working in tandem with the Electrical Engineers to fabricate and integrate all the energy and utility components with one another. The goal is to design and fabricate mechanical components of innovation and excellence.

Responsibilities

• Designing, manufacturing, and installing components that fulfils requirements.
• Analysing problems or deficiencies and developing solutions to resolve them.
• Conducting experiments and evaluations to improve and innovate product designs.
• Creating plans and designs using CAD technology.
• Estimating budgets and time scopes for each project.
• Writing technical documentation for machine operators.
• Ensuring that products meet compliance regulations.
• Collaborating with project managers and other engineers in our team.
• Run simulations and analyze test data.
• Write clear and comprehensive technical documentation.
• Problem-solve to an exceptional level with high attention to detail.
• Communicate technical ideas in a clear manner, both visually and verbally.

  • Ability to run simulations and analyze test data.
  • Ability to write clear and comprehensive technical documentation.
  • Highly analytical mind, with exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

We are looking for an Electrical Engineer to map out the key milestones that need to be met and source the existing technologies required for MiniGrid to meet the needs of our consumers. The Electrical Engineer will also be charged with designing and building the electrical systems required to integrate all the utilities together with one another.

Electrical Engineer Responsibilities:

  • Designing, maintaining, implementing, or improving electrical instruments, facilities, components, equipment products, or systems for industrial, commercial or domestic purposes.
  • Performing a wide range of engineering tasks by operating computer-assisted design or engineering software and equipment.
  • Conferring with customers, engineers, and others to discuss existing or potential engineering products or projects.
  • Ensuring that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements by preparing electrical systems specifications, technical drawings or topographical maps.
  • Establishing construction, manufacturing or installation standards or specifications by performing a wide range of detailed calculations.
  • Ensuring compliance with specifications, codes, or customer requirements by directing or coordinating installation, manufacturing, construction, maintenance, documentation, support or testing activities.
  • Writing reports and compiling data regarding existing and potential electrical engineering projects and studies.
  • Preparing specifications for purchases of electrical equipment and materials.
  • Supervising or training project team members.
  • Estimating material, labor, or construction costs for budget preparation.
  • Maintaining electrical equipment.
  • Working with a variety of technicians.

Electrical Engineer Requirements:

  • Enrolled in a Bachelor degree in electrical engineering or other associated majors from an accredited school.
  • Experience in using or a desire to learn required software.
  • Knowledge of applicable codes related to electronic engineering.
  • Proficient in design and calculation software.

COVID-19 precautions

  • Remote interview process
  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Virtual meetings
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
  • All employees are contacted traced in the offices. This is monitored by seeing who checks in and out. All surfaces are regularly wiped down. Everyone is required to wear a mask.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

White Fox Scooters is the first docked electric scooter solution for walkable cities and micro-communities. Our docks have been initially deployed and hosted through partnerships with local governments as well as local businesses such as hotels, parking garages, and apartment buildings. We’re taking the electric scooter sharing model to the streets of New Jersey, hopefully New York soon, (as well as all other walkable cities) since we truly believe it is the most fun and efficient way to get around. We disrupt the electric scooter sharing industry in a key way: we place a strong emphasis on public safety. Our docks keep the scooters out of the path of pedestrians and allow us to share helmets with our riders. The company is led by our founder, Sidd Saxena, who has had prior experience in technology investment banking, ran multiple profitable businesses, and leads the YPO YNG Initiative in New York City.

Interns at White Fox Scooters will have the opportunity to make an impact in a way they never have before. Because of our small team, you will be able to interact and share ideas with all members, ask for feedback, and develop yourself as much as you develop the organization.

White Fox Scooters is looking for someone with experience in backend development. We are looking for a candidate who can create and manage databases for our users and/or scooters. You will be working with Electrical and Computer Engineering Interns who are currently designing the hardware and software running within our docks and scooters to build smart docking station with automated locking and charging features. Docking station and scooters, both will have unique id and several methods defined in computer of docking station. When the scooters are docked or undocked, the database must be updated to reflect who is using which scooter and at which docking station a scooter is located. Interns must be available a minimum of 20 hours/week. Course credit available.

Requirements:

> Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field, or graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in a related field within the last 6 months (Master’s level preferred)
> Strong background in computer programming
> Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Suite
> Strong attention to detail
> Creative problem-solving skills
> Competence in research skills
> Strong written and oral communication skills in English
> Demonstrated experience with database creation or management
> Has knowledge of a web framework or a mobile development framework
> Project experinece with Django,Flask webdevelopment framework required.
> Other Experience: Postman, JWT, JSON, HTTPS Required.
> Has experience integrating different API's, REST API preferred.

Experience with these is a plus, but not required:

>Basic knowledge of hardware and embedded software systems
>Testing and certification of electrical systems
>Python
>Raspberry Pi

Sisu network is a Ethereum compatible network that allows people deploy smart contract with very low transaction cost. In addition, Sisu leverages Threshold Signature Scheme (TSS) that enables decentralized coin swapping between 2 different chains without going through the hassle of KYC process.

This internship is for someone who is hard working and really wants to learn how to build a blockchain from bottom up.

This position allows you to dig deep into Ethereum source code or explore Cosmos's core or how to implement a TSS signing. There are many jobs out there that requires you to write simple smart contracts but they will not be near the level of challenges that this position offers.

If you are a great engineer and want to get into blockchain space, this position is a perfect step for you.

90% of the code is written in Go. Some experience with Go is preferrable. However, I am looking for someone with strong CS background, quick learner and the ability to work hard.

In you application, show me the your AMAZING projects or achievement you have got (e.g. competitive programming prizes or complicated open source Github project you have built).

You will work with me complete the project and launch the testnet. Blockchain is a fast moving space. You will work really hard but also learn a lot.

description:
QA Software Engineer

YokD is looking for talented QA engineers to join our growing team. As a QA engineer you understand the importance of ensuring production level code is bug free for a great user experience.

We will achieve this by automating the testing of key features, as well as with manual UI testing. QA is perhaps one of the most important elements in the software development lifecycle and we are looking for passionate individuals who understand this.

We are looking for someone who has the brains to architect our CI/CD pipeline as well as implement it. Your role will involve designing and implementing unit and integration tests at various levels of the stack. You will see the fruits of your work as we grow our user base and become a staple in the fitness industry.

Company Overview

YokD is going to revolutionize the fitness industry. If you have a goal of getting fit or healthy, you’ve surely faced the dilemma of a lack of reliable options to turn to. Personal trainers are too expensive with no quality assurance, with manipulative contracts. Workout buddies drop out after a while, as they’re unmotivated also.

YoKD plans to offer the widest selection of fitness experts ready to help our users with a variety of services. Our team is really looking to change the outdated fitness game, so we are looking for passionate, energetic and fun individuals.

....

About the Role

This is a 6 month (unpaid) internship role which is designed to give you rich experience working in the fitness startup space. You will work at all levels of the stack and with diverse technologies and be actively involved in the design as well as implementation. At the end of the 6 month period, interns may be brought on paid positions with equity, depending on competence and culture fit.

You are a great candidate if:
You have one year of experience and software testing and automation.
You understand the principles of building CI\CD
You have experience testing android native applications.
You have experience building web applications or android applications.
You have experience building CI/CD pipelines for smooth development And deployment.

  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

Responsibilites

  • Our unique 10 to 12 weeks summer internship program provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the ad tech industry while being fully integrated into a team
  • You will have full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the entire engineering organization
  • We will pair you with a dedicated mentor on your team to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and educational feedback

When you think about your last doctor’s appointment, how much do you actually recall? If you’re like most people, you’ll likely forget over 40% of the conversation. Details fall through the cracks, generic printouts you receive end up in the trash, and important information never makes it to other doctors. Ultimately, you’re left needing to connect the dots in your care. That’s why we started Abridge with a simple thesis: if we can shift agency to consumers, we can help them stay on top of their health. When you use Abridge to record your health conversations, the conversations themselves become your medical record. It’s as easy as that.

We are looking for research interns to working on exciting NLP challenges using our large annotated proprietary healthcare datasets. You will be able to create/customize your internship research statement and collaborate with our in-house Machine Learning research team. At the end of the internship, you will also have the opportunity to publish your work at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, NAACL, and ACL.

The goal of the internship is to advance the state-of-the-art in one or many of the following research areas:- Dialog Understanding - Sequence-to-Sequence Modeling- Clinical Natural Language Processing- Information Extraction- Machine Learning using Ontologies or Knowledge graphs

Required Qualification:- Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in an MS or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or a related field- Must have at least one NLP machine learning paper submitted or published - Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems- Ability to communicate complex research ideas in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

*Research internships are offered year-round with flexible durations

Compensation

  • $80,000-$100,000 per year

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate. Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and believe that "you need to taste good things to have good taste." Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

description:
Bodo can be translated into “Run” or “Accelerate”, and our technology does just that. Python is the de facto language for data applications but has limited performance and scalability. Bodo is the first Python Supercomputing Analytics platform that empowers data scientists to run Python workloads with the extreme performance and scalability of High Performance Computing (HPC) without code rewrites. The exponential growth of data in the enterprise presents an immense opportunity for transforming industries through advanced analytics and AI/ML, and we aim to enable this transformation.

Bodo’s technology provides automatic parallelization and acceleration for analytics workloads for the first time. This allows data scientists to focus on solving business problems instead of scalability and performance of their codes. Bodo is already deployed at Fortune 500 enterprises with great success.

Description

Bodo is looking for a software engineering intern interested in distributed systems to develop Bodo’s revolutionary cloud analytics platform. This requires a strong entrepreneurship spirit and the ability to turn challenging technical ideas into reality. As a software engineer you will be building the cloud platform that hosts the fastest, most scalable and accessible analytics platform for data scientists and data engineers, with significant impact in large-scale enterprise cluster and cloud compute environments.

Responsibilities

  • Help develop, deploy and maintain Bodo’s cloud analytics platform
  • Help enhance simplicity, robustness, efficiency and scalability of the Bodo Cloud Platform
  • Contribute to various efforts in platform development
  • Design and implement automated CI/CD pipelines to build, test, and release infrastructures
  • Debug complex distributed system issues

Qualifications and Skills

  • BS/MS/PhD student in Computer Science or a related field
  • Strong programming experience (Java, C++, JavaScript, Python, etc.)
  • Experience in distributed systems
  • Experience working with cloud technologies: Kubernetes (K8s), Docker, Terraform, microservices, AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
  • Team work, strong communication skills, and attention to detail
