Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Rendezvous, Proximity Operations, and Docking (RPOD) is an essential phase of any satellite servicing mission. Starfish Space is developing CEPHALOPOD, RPOD software that is capable of docking with efficient electric propulsion. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on astrodynamics and guidance navigation and control skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from developing GNC algorithms, to refining concepts of operation, to running simulation analysis.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Software and/or computer programming capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of Astrodynamics
  • Working knowledge of rendezvous, proximity operations, and docking techniques
  • Working knowledge of numerical techniques such as optimization and/or machine learning

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Satellite servicing missions require autonomous, robotic actions in orbit. To fulfill our mission Starfish is developing the Otter space tug and the Nautilus capture mechanism to interact with and maximize the operational value of satellites. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on mechanical engineering, electromechanical prototyping, and system design skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from designing in CAD, to manufacturing prototypes, to designing and executing a test plan.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Mechanical and/or electrical prototyping capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Previous experience designing and/or prototyping space systems
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of mechanical engineering
  • Working knowledge of electrical engineering

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Since 2008, Simulmedia’s mission has been to make TV and video work better for advertisers. Our demand-side TV buying platform generates more wins for advertisers across linear TV, streaming, and gaming. We leverage TV’s unparalleled reach and the power of data to help brands, networks, and agencies find audiences most likely to take notice, tune in, and transact. Our goal is to empower both performance and brand marketers to take direct control of their TV buying and drive greater business impact with every ad dollar spent. We’re already helping hundreds of brands like Experian, 1-800-Flowers, Dollar Shave Club, HBO Max, Michaels, and MassMutual grow their reach, awareness, and conversions.

As an Analytics Intern at Simulmedia, you will face complex technical challenges that relate to the television advertising industry. You will be mining complex datasets to provide useful insights to various stakeholders such as account managers and the product team. You will be engaged in supporting ad-hoc client requests related to the launch, management, and optimization of advertising campaigns. Some of these requests will eventually turn into larger, productionable projects in which you will work with the rest of the Science and Engineering teams.

The Analytics Intern will, at times, be engaged in the information discovery phase to gather requirements and client requests. The ideal candidate is eager to work with Data Scientists and Account Managers and has data mining and data analysis capabilities focusing on SQL and Python, business acumen and strong analytical skills. Additionally, you will write complex queries delivering insights and reports to clients and deliver ad hoc data analyses that provide strategic insights to clients.

Skills & Experience

  • Proficiency in both Python and SQL and can transform data into an appropriate shape to use for modeling
  • Experience with quantitative challenges involving real world data and are comfortable building efficient code to share while learning new technologies
  • A keen analytical mind with the ability to understand business problems communicated by an Account Manager and distill complex information into understandable insights with actionable recommendations

The Simulmedia Experience
We take tremendous pride in maintaining a high bar for employees and fostering a strong team environment. While we work hard every day, we also believe in relaxing together with lots of team activities. We have an unlimited vacation policy, tuition reimbursement, and no employee financial contribution for medical, dental, and vision benefits. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, and an annual bonus based on performance. And last but not least, we provide a free Citibike membership to all employees!

Company Vision
To be the first place advertisers go to find and scale their high-value audiences and elevate the accountability and performance of their TV and video advertising.

Our Core Values
Help Others Win
Focus on the Right Things
Show, Don’t Tell
Be Inclusive
Make an Impact
Strive to Be Greater

As a software engineering intern at LATTE, you will be an essential member of the team responsible for helping rebuild a web and mobile platform and change the way businesses onboard, train and engage their employees.

Responsibilities

• Help design and rebuild a web and mobile platform from the ground up
• Work closely with key stakeholders to develop features for our web and mobile products
• Be an essential member of the engineering team to proactively identify and address opportunities to improve our culture and technology

Requirements

• Strong understanding of JavaScript
• Experience with ReactJS (or other frontend frameworks)
• Familiarity with NodeJS
• Experience with SQL (Postgres, MySQL)
• Experience working with APIs
• Experience working with Git version control
• Ability to learn new languages and technologies

Nice to have

• Experience with TypeScript
• Experience with GraphQL
• Currently enrolled in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or similar fields

If you think you have what it takes, email your resume to hello@grabalatte.io with “Software Engineering Intern” in the subject line.

About Us

Professionals and Entrepreneurs often need quick answers to solve questions they have while on their career or business journey. This is needed now more than ever during Covid. LATTE provides on-demand mentorship and community-based resources for advice, guidance and feedback. Unlike traditional methods of finding help, LATTE provides an approachable way to get help from vetted top-notch mentors and resources that were once never accessible.

LATTE's vision is two fold: To dismantle the belief there are not enough underrepresented professionals in the pipeline for work at top companies and to eliminate the three most prominent barriers to personal development:
1- Fear of Connecting
2- Access
3- Cost

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

During the 16-week internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from within the United States. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

Basic Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
  • Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
  • Self-motivated, hands-on, focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

Borrow is looking for an automotive connected car Intern to help with the telematics and data collections on our vehicles. Ideal candidates have a passion for the automotive industry and a general understanding of how the industry functions.

We're seeking a curious and intelligent engineering intern to join our team. Your work will have a big impact on the new features we are rolling out.

This position will provide hands-on experience. The ideal candidate will bring energy and passion to everything they do and be comfortable in a fast paced start-up environment. You will report to the founders.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Scoping, planning, analysis and generating articulate recommendations that are grounded in Borrow's needs.
  • Work closely with the founding team to create new products and features.
  • As an intern, you will be working with the founders and you will assist with our IoT/Connected car devices and backend systems.
  • Work with our partners on data collection and vechiee asset trackers

Qualifications:

  • The ideal team member will embrace simplicity of design while maintaining cutting edge sophistication.
  • Experience with electrical / mechanical gizmos for DIY/Maker and professional projects.
  • Familiar and comfortable with IoT tools, the connected car and telematic devices.

If interested, please submit a resume, a portfolio of work and a short note (300 words) explaining why we might be a good fit for each other.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About the Role

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

  • Partner with other engineers, product managers, and designers
  • Design & deliver innovative solutions to improve the Sigma user experience by implementing new features.
  • Find innovative ways to optimize the performance of one or more components of the product.
  • Develop automated unit tests to get the relevant code coverage and work with product owners and techpubs to document your work.

These will help you to be successful

  • You must be pursuing at least a Bachelor’s or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Have a solid grasp of Operating Systems, Data structures, algorithms and at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.
  • Eager to learn and build complex user interfaces, data visualizations, or backend systems.
  • Have a drive and desire to navigate unknowns, after all, that’s what unlocks realizations.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a team environment.
  • Able to commit 40 hrs a week for 12 weeks OR 30 hrs a week for 16 weeks.
  • Ready to start work full-time by late 2022 to early 2023.

Benefits for our Interns:

  • Competitive pay: $40/hour.
  • Flexible schedule, do the work you need to get done in the time you have to get it done
  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.
  • Fun team events throughout your internship!

What’s next:

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this:

  • Take-Home Challenge
  • Interview to debrief on the take-home challenge
  • Technical Interview with an engineering team member

Please note, this role will be virtual for Summer 2021. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply!
We're looking for an engineering intern with a computer vision and/or graphics focus. You will be working on a video-first social network utilizing AI and addressing problems such image manipulation/synthesis and using generative models (e.g. GANs) to generate synthetic images. What we are looking for:

-Current student working towards an undergraduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline
-Java, Swift, or C/C++
-Android or iOS frameworks
-Foundation in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented software design
-Graphical Engineering including photorealistic Face Rendering
-Video Processing and ML: Real time filters, motion extraction, face tracking
-Ability to work well within a small, dynamic and fast-paced team
-Knowledge of agile development cycle

Aspyre is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds.

Applications for The Youvize Summer internship are now open! Learn more at https://youvize.com/intern

Are you ready to roll up your sleeves, challenge yourself, and learn real-world digital marketing and business development skills? Are you passionate about knowledge-sharing, education and the socially-responsible startup world? If you’re willing to do what it takes to find creative solutions to grow a next-generation platform in the future of work and information search -our summer BD program could be a fantastic opportunity.

Selected candidates will join a cohort of 12 others individuals from around the country. You will be mentored by professional growth, business development and senior management members with experience leading programs at organizations such as Google and The Wall Street Journal. Participants will be mentored and have direct access to Youvize C-level executives while they join teams and compete to earn significant performance based compensation.

The 3-month program begins with a 10-day training program introducing participants to the unique economics of multi-sided platforms and the real-world tools to automate and execute various business development campaigns.

As a Community Liaison, you will be responsible for rolling up your sleeves to do what it takes to build innovative marketing programs that will build our brand, increase awareness, drive growth, all while contributing to the improvement of our user experience. The ideal candidate has the experience to quickly evaluate potential programs, the quantitative analytical skills to discover and leverage our top-performing traction channels, and most importantly the humility to acknowledge their strengths and weaknesses, dealing well with constructive feedback and regular reviews.

We value interesting well-rounded candidates with a breadth of real-world common-sense, unique world-view and independent insight. We're looking for candidates with a demonstrated understanding of digital marketing programs across the spectrum of today’s marketing channels. Moreover, if you have a passion for meaningful social change, then Youvize might be the perfect fit for you!

Requirements

  • Current or Recent graduate in an accredited University
  • US Citizen currently living in United States
  • You’re an interesting, independent, proactive team-player
  • You’re participating in or graduating from an accredited Bachelors program or Masters program.
  • You have some knowledge of digital marketing programs and social media promotion
  • Former work or internship experience helpful but not required
  • A strong hands-on collaborative work ethic! You'll wear many hats and get your hands dirty.
  • Understanding of and experience in building brand awareness

Responsibilities

  • Identify market opportunities and mobilize resources to reach them
  • Plan, develop and launch real digital marketing campaigns
  • Assist with selecting and planning US Event marketing
  • Develop your own marketing budget and report on accomplishments
  • Develop knowledge of competitive products and companies
  • Complete Reading and Educational tasks as assigned

Using Swift to re-connect millions hearing impaired people

Ava has seen its biggest product and design growth yet and is looking for a new teammate to help improve and enhance our iOS application. If you want to make the world more accessible through great iOS & iPadOS UX then this is the opportunity to leave a mark and make a difference, to use design and technology in order to help those in need of accessibility.

We are looking to hire a talented iOS developer to design, build, and maintain the next generation of our iOS app. Your primary focus will be developing high-end features for the latest Apple mobile devices. Your duties includes collaborating with the design team for new application features, identifying and fixing application bottlenecks, maintaining the core code, and updating the application published on the App Store.

You'd be perfect for this role if:

  • You have a BS in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent
  • You have experience in Swift and Objective-C
  • You're diligent and patient, have an eye for detail, and passion for a high-quality finish.
  • You have a good sense of UX and care about users
  • You are passionate about Apple's eco-system and technologies (CocoaTouch, Cocoa etc.)
  • You have a good understanding of basic frameworks such as Foundation, UIKit.

Bonus ✨

  • Experience with AWS, Firebase etc.
  • Experience with Node.js, Typescript
  • Experience with CoreAudio & CoreData
  • MS in Computer Science

So... what will you do as an iOS developer at Ava?

  • You will help transition from a hybrid code base (Objective-C + Swift) to a 100% Swift code base.
  • You will help create a standalone iPadOS application
  • You will help scale Ava as a key communication service millions of deaf/hard-of-hearing users & their peers can rely on.
  • You will implement new designs for existing and new features

What the first 3 months may look like: 🏃‍♀️

  • You will work on a Calendar integration to provide users with meaningful notifications when their meetings or events are about to start.
  • You will help on re-designing the onboarding experience
  • You will be assigned bug reports and fix issues

What's special about this role?

  • Actually change lives at an unprecedented scale: How often do you hear about apps that make people cry of joy? It is really for us a unique opportunity and privilege to be able to meaningfully improve the lives of 100,000s of people - and yet to still be at the very beginning of our mission!
  • Join us at an incredible time: We're well-funded and hit product-market fit, which gives us a huge green field to work with. You'd join at the perfect time to shape what we build and how we grow, so we can create a more inclusive world.
  • Work with some of the best people in the world: We have an incredibly talented and passionate team that is a lot of fun to work with. We're still super small and have accomplished some things that were thought impossible!
  • Tackle our most interesting and impactful problems: Our team is still small, and people wear many hats. You'd jump between product, marketing, internal tools, process — participating in every phase from inception to implementation. Absolutely no boredom.
Responsible for IoT design and development on Raspberry Pi 3 platform.

We are looking for an enthusiastic software engineer to build robust server software. You should have experience with Java, JDBC, and MySql and RESTFUL API design principles.

As a web designer, you will work with our CEO and the engineering team to design and implement the server API and related functions. Because this is a startup you will have enormous responsibility for developing and implementing the backend including ideation, brainstorming, design, and user analysis.

This internship will help you acquire a broad range of web design skills and experience as well as building your confidence and preparing you a future career in web design.

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Together, we can make a profound impact on mental healthcare, and if you're ready to create smarter infra for healthcare delivery, we invite you to apply for our SWE Intern role where you'll get to build a world-class set of machine learning applications to scale access to care.

Kintsugi is developing smarter mental healthcare with voice biomarkers. Our team has been awarded multiple National Science Foundation SBIR awards for developing new AI technologies. In our latest technical milestone, we’re now able to score clinical depression and anxiety from less than a minute of free form speech.

We have an API endpoint we are integrating across call centers, telehealth platforms, and remote patient monitoring apps. As a Techstars UnitedHealthcare portfolio company, we have the unique opportunity to impact millions of lives. Our team has exceptionally talented engineers who enjoy building on each other’s work, and despite being a startup, we all take pride in maintaining a high quality codebase.

Minimum qualifications:

  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent in developing mobile and web apps.

  • Prolific programming skills (e.g. Olympiads), links to libraries you’ve written or public repos you’ve contributed to are great. Python, Node.js, and gradual typing preferred.

  • Experience with DevOps and Security for GCP/Firebase and GitLab a plus.

  • Knowledge of backend API development, networking communication, authentication, and protocols is preferred.

  • Team player with good communication skills (oral and written).

Internship | Berkeley, CA (remote)

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Healthcare AI, we invite you to apply for our Data Science Intern role based in Berkeley where you'll get to build a world-class set of applications to scale the future of primary care to our homes.

Kintsugi is developing smarter mental healthcare with voice biomarkers. Our team has been awarded multiple National Science Foundation SBIR awards for developing new AI technologies. In our latest technical milestone, we’re now able to detect depression and anxiety from less than 20 seconds of free form speech.

About The Role
In this role, you will be a member of a team that develops and applies cutting edge techniques to detect depression and anxiety. You will work with the R&D team and be responsible for data exploration, visualization, and error analysis. As you become more familiar with our datasets, you will develop checks and triggers to highlight potential data quality issues, develop and enhance existing methods to quantitatively profile and assess the level of quality of data for both structured and unstructured data, and provide consultation and guidance for data quality issues across data pipelines, products and projects. You will contribute to the design and implementation of pipelines that deliver data with measurable quality under SLAs.

You will:

  • Work collaboratively to build a platform for scientific discovery in this exciting new domain of speech for healthcare
  • Have access to a wealth of unique data and best-in-class algorithms, providing a solid foundation to build and iterate on
  • Advance the state of the art by developing novel algorithms to quantify mental health severity
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop meaningful insights

Minimum qualifications:

  • An advanced degree in Statistics, Computer Science or other quantitative field
  • Performing quantitative analysis
  • Strong programming skills with working knowledge of Python
  • Data querying languages (e.g. SQL)
  • Familiarity with data exploration/visualization tools and techniques (e.g. T-SNE, PCA)
  • Experience working in a Linux environment
  • Team player with good communication skills (oral and written)

Preferred Qualification

  • Signal/Speech Processing experience
  • Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow)

Internship | Berkeley, CA (remote)

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Healthcare AI, we invite you to apply for our Machine Learning Intern role based in Berkeley where you'll get to build a world-class set of applications to scale the future of primary care to our homes.

Kintsugi is developing smarter mental healthcare with voice biomarkers. Our team has been awarded multiple National Science Foundation SBIR awards for developing new AI technologies. In our latest technical milestone, we’re now able to detect depression and anxiety from less than 20 seconds of free form speech.

About The Role
In this role, you will be a member of a team that develops and applies cutting edge techniques to detect depression and anxiety. You will be part of the R&D team and contribute to creating state of the art models.

What you'll do:

  • Work collaboratively to build a platform for scientific discovery in this exciting new domain of speech for healthcare.
  • Have access to a wealth of unique data and best-in-class algorithms, providing a solid foundation to build and iterate on.
  • Advance the state of the art by developing novel algorithms to quantify mental health severity

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

We’re looking for collaborative and committed volunteer developers to join our remote tech team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on our flagship product: the AsylumConnect Catalog (the world's first tech resource platform designed for those fleeing persecution due to sexual orientation or gender identity). This is an essential position and a fantastic volunteer opportunity for anyone looking to use their strong knowledge of web and mobile application development for social good.

Time Commitment: This is an unpaid (volunteer) and remote position. We are looking for volunteers who are able to devote 10-15 hours per week to AsylumConnect.

Responsibilities

  • Report directly to our Tech Lead.
  • Contribute to our Catalog web and mobile application development.
  • Collaborate with our volunteer UX designers to develop and deploy new features, and ensure a positive user experience.
  • Write code to maintain server-side logic, manage the application database, and add new features.
  • Ensure the Catalog is mobile-friendly and cross-browser compatible.
  • Plan for future changes to our Catalog website, web application and mobile applications (iOS and Android).
  • Work to efficiently fix any technical bugs as they arise.

AsylumConnect’s Tech Stack:

  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku
  • MongoDB
  • Express.js / Node

  • Strong understanding of tech stack:
  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku
  • MongoDB
  • Express.js / Node
  • You are comfortable using online communication tools (e.g. Slack, Asana, G Suite, Zoom).

Minimum Qualifications

  • Strong analytical and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and willing to take the initiative to get things done
  • Ability to readily learn new technologies from the get-go
  • Willing to work with a diverse set of people with different backgrounds and experiences

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Docker/Kubernetes
  • Experience with Python data science libraries, such as Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Numpy, and Ray/Modin
  • Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases

What You Will Do

  • Gain insight into CPG industry business models and the pain points that our customers face
  • Use your skills and insights to help plan, develop, and own new tasks and projects
  • Work on a wide variety of projects, ranging from building machine learning models to improving user-facing analytics and interfaces

Benefits

Overview:

Potato TV is looking for a software engineer intern to help develop the foundation of our social streaming product. The ideal applicant will have a passion for social media, streaming, and connecting people through the TV & movies they love. We are looking for people who want to work on a fun product & who want to make an immediate impact. Successful interns will have an ability to understand our technical approaches, provide innovative solutions, and build efficiently for the future.

Opportunities:

  • Agile development of high-quality native iOS apps with beautiful custom UI.
  • Develop backend functionality & frontend experience for an interactive messaging, video, and audio mobile application
  • Contribute to product design processes (ideation, user journeys, roadmapping, etc…) & learn how they are implemented into product development.
  • Troubleshooting and debugging issues that arise using industry standards
  • Develop, maintain, & update technical documentation for team members
  • Build a social platform experience across mobile & web app surfaces
  • Learn and apply software design and development concepts to our mobile application

About you:

  • Experience with Swift, various iOS frameworks, and modern iOS APIs.
  • Experience with react native app development
  • Experience working in cloud computing environments like GCP & firebase & building backend models with noSQL DBs & node JS.
  • Familiarity with using APIs for payments, chat, video, & websockets.
  • Preferred Education: Currently enrolled in or have previously completed a Masters in computer science. Minimum is graduated with BS in CS.
  • Great communication: ability to breakdown technical concepts effectively to non-technical founders
  • Mindset: Human-centered design - Put the user at the center of development
  • Collaborative: With other engineers on projects to seamlessly build a cohesive product using industry standard tools and processes
  • Ability to break down requirements and implement whole features

Commitment:

  • Time: ~20 hours/week
  • Duration: 10-12 weeks
  • Role: Unpaid internship
  • Location: Remote
