description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

KlearNow is a technology start-up offering very first Customs Business Network and disrupting the customs clearance industry by providing an innovative, state of the art solutions that brings the global supply chain into the digital age!

KlearNow is an Operational and Certified Customs Business provider in US, Canada and UK with plans to grow in many more markets in near future. Over and above the core customs clearance solution, KlearNow is also providing consolidated freight visibility, data and document management and intra-port activity for efficient Drayage.

Our mission is to transform global commerce with an AI-driven, shared-economy platform that makes logistics more simple, cost-effective and provides end-to-end visibility.

Design, develop, and operate resilient distributed services that run on ECS or Kubernetes to serve hundreds of millions of users around the worldCollaborate with various functional teams on expansion of our recommendation systemsInfluence the roadmap and product development of KlearNow App and services

Be a part of a rapidly growing, series A funded company where you will have the opportunity to extend our leadership position and fast-track innovation behind AI-powered intelligent supply chain solutions. KlearNow has a flexibility of a small start up with the security of a well-funded organization with strong backers and advisors. We are headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley, Santa Clara, California with an offshore development and support office in Gurgaon, India and locations in Canada and UK

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?

  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.

  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: React Native Developer Intern (Unpaid) OPT Available
description:
Job Description

Resolve is a social media app (in development) where users can put up monetary incentives called "bounties" to get things done online. On Resolve you will be able to turn your dollars directly into the actions of others. Resolve supports free market competitive forces for efficiency, but is run with the intent of improving the world and the people in it. Our company culture is one that celebrates productivity for the sake of positivity. If you would like to work for Resolve you will need to see the value in both!

As an intern, you will have a significant and meaningful role in the development of the prototype Resolve Web application. You will be working side-by-side with the Founders of the company, contractors, and interns to help build the beta version of the app. There is an opportunity for full-time employment (with equity compensation) if you prove to be a valuable team member.

What will you be doing?

1. Working closely within your team of interns while taking guidance from the Co-Founders.

2. Turning mock-ups and text descriptions of pages/features into functioning code on a web app.

3. Developing an algorithm to rank posts in a user's feed based on which users they are following and which topics they are interested in.

4. Learning on-the-job to do tasks you may not have experience with. The app will be made from the ground up and while working at a startup, you must wear many hats.

You don't have to be skilled in all of the above, since we will be recruiting team members with complementary skills. If you believe in Resolve and are willing to work hard we encourage you to apply. If you are interested in working for Resolve you may fill out the online application form here: goo.gl/forms/D1jRsgiFxPPYMLGm2

We are a future of work start-up, building a growing team of innovators passionate about working at an impact-driven company. Our vision it to create a world that provides equal opportunity for work to all.

At Werkit we curate remote self-managed teams from Africa for high growth software companies (targeting the growing AI market) so that they can focus on their core offering or service. And we do this, at scale.

We are a portfolio company of a prestigious global VC, Antler and were selected to be a part of Bowery Capital’s B2B SaaS Sales Accelerator Programme. We are currently focusing on an aggressive sales cycle so we can grow.

We value people who are entrepreneurial, ambitious, collaborative and customer-centric.

3-6 month internship with a view to becoming permanent.

Responsibilities:

  • Operational and customer success manager
  • Empathize with every aspect of the customer experience, putting customers’ needs first.
  • Guide and coach customers with a proactive customer success processes.
  • Identify common customer challenges to suggest better solutions
  • Partner closely with other cross-functional team members to translate business needs and product requirements into new solutions for customers.
  • Adapt existing customer onboarding assets and work with product marketing to refine them over time.
  • Help drive customer references and case studies.
  • Develop fresh engagement tactics, with an emphasis on growth, strategy, and engagement.

Qualifications:

  • MBA a major plus
  • Minimum of 1 year experience in a CSM or Account Management role - preferably in a SaaS environment
  • Upselling experience preferred
  • General understanding of the digital marketing space
  • A desire to wow your customers
  • A proven record of retaining and growing multiple client relationships
  • Positive attitude and remarkable ability to build rapport from initial conversation and throughout the client lifecycle.
  • Ability to work in hyper-fast paced and changing environment
  • Superior organization and prioritization skills, along with focused attention to detail
  • Good foundation in Excel/Google Sheets
  • Extra kudos for having technical know-how in areas including: web design and development projects, analytics and tracking, coding bootcamp, HTML/CSS and API calls

Job Type: Internship, 3-6 months, with aim to become permanent
Schedule: Monday to Friday (Flexible)

Please include a brief cover note letting us know why you're interested in Werkit Africa and please include a link to relevant work/your portfolio and LinkedIn profile.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

We envision a future powered by robots that work seamlessly with human teams. We build the artificial intelligence that enables service robots to collaborate with people and adapt to dynamic human environments. Join our mission-driven, venture-backed team as we build out our mechanical engineering team.

As Diligent Robotics’ mechanical engineering intern, you will hold a part-time role (10-15 hours/week) in our downtown office close to the UT campus during the 2021 summer (now through August).

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting with CAD for robotic systems
  • Assisting with assembly of robotic systems
  • Assisting in designing and building prototypes of new components
  • Developing testbeds for robotic systems

A good candidate would be, at minimum:

  • Currently pursuing a BS in ME (or related field)
  • Proficient at designing in SolidWorks (or Fusion360)
  • Experienced in 3D printing, laser cutting, general woodworking, and/or electronics
  • Eager to learn new things

The ideal candidate would be:

  • Familiar with SolidWorks Simulation and Fusion360 Simulation
  • Knowledgeable about circuits/soldering electronics
  • Experienced in design-for-manufacturing
  • Experienced with machine shop tools

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Frontend UI / UX / DX Engineering Intern
description:
Location: At the moment, we are all working remotely. However, our headquarters are in New York, and this position will be based in NYC once we are back to working in-person.

About OpenFin

OpenFin is a fast-growing financial technology company backed by the world’s largest banks and most respected Fintech VCs, including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, HSBC, Wells Fargo, SC Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, DRW, Nyca Partners, and Pivot Investment Partners. OpenFin modernizes and democratizes app development and distribution in the finance space. We provide a secure OS that brings a fast and intuitive app experience to the financial desktop. Built on Google’s Chromium and GitHub’s Electron open source projects, OpenFin combines native experience, data sharing, lightning-fast distribution, and robust security with an agile web development and deployment model to accelerate digital transformation and innovation. OpenFin is used by thousands of developers to deploy and run more than 1200 apps at more than 1500 financial institutions.

About the Role

We are looking for a frontend engineer to join our Product Engineering team who is excited about learning new languages, frameworks and technologies.

Responsibilities

Work covers a range of interests and areas of expertise that can scale to what you would like to learn! The following are three area

  • Contribute to the OpenFin UI Library—architect and build accessible, extensible, and well-tested React components used in several OpenFin products shipping this year.
  • Help shape the OpenFin Developer Experience—build out automation and testing, documentation, prototypes, and give tech talks. Help optimize and build engineering processes and community knowledge product engineering teams working with the UI Library.
  • Contribute to building new features—deliver a best-in-class user experience in OpenFin products.

What We’re Looking For

  • A user-focused, empathetic person who wants to collaborate, write, talk, and dream about code that people will love to use.
  • Comfortable building React components and a passion for making them pixel perfect.
  • Awareness of accessibility best practices, progressive enhancement, the DOM / Shadow DOM and how React “works” under the hood.
  • Familiarity and an interest in using Typescript, Styled Components, and Framer Motion.
  • An interest in learning cross-platform development for Mac and Windows using Electron and modern tools and frameworks like Webpack and NextJS.
  • It would be very cool if you’re opinionated / excited about well-tested frontend code (Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library), automation, or other aspects of frontend ops—the force multipliers that make other engineers love working together.

A few of our Product Engineering values

  • Code with Empathy—write your code thinking about the person who might use it next, that person might be you ;)
  • Don’t follow the GPS into the lake—be intuitive and critical, be human when you work, especially when taking an empirical point of view.
  • Don’t take all of the blame—when software breaks, we’re all on the hook. Another way to say this is there are no gatekeepers. We share knowledge, responsibility, and an excitement for fixing things when they inevitably go sideways.

Life at OpenFin

At OpenFin, our mission is to stay on the cutting edge of web technologies and to enable our customers to do the same. While we are currently remote, we pride ourselves on our friendly, diverse, understanding office culture. Our goal is to create a space where employees can learn and innovate, and overall, have a good time doing it. Our employees have a diverse set of interests and experiences, and we encourage you to explore those interests and share with us! We have regular happy hours and social events. Our office and our employees are conducive to a productive learning experience -- all the while creating innovative and compelling solutions for our clients.

Bitome is a four-year-old, Boston-based life science instrument company commercializing compact and portable chemical analysis tools used in magnetic resonance spectroscopy. Bitome’s first product is a continuous metabolic monitoring solution for synthetic biology and biomanufacturing. Using microsystem technology compatible with scaled manufacturing processes, Bitome delivers a game-changing life science research tool for a fraction of the cost of existing products.

Bitome is hiring an intern to help with designing, building, testing, and fabricating of mechanical parts for fluidic handling and automation of our bioreactors.

You will be responsible for:
• Designing and building of mechanical components for peristaltic pumps, valves, fluidic automation
• Mechanical design of bioreactors, motors, stirrers
• Mechanical design of fluidic and gas ports and connectors
• Communicate results with team members

Requirements for the position are:
• CAD modeling using Autodesk Fusion 360 / Solidworks
• Experience with rapid prototyping and mechanical assembly
• Experience with peristaltic pumps, valves and fluidic handling automation

Come join our team’s quest to democratize molecular spectroscopy and along the way we may just change the world.

Bitome is a four-year-old, Boston-based life science instrument company commercializing compact and portable chemical analysis tools used in magnetic resonance spectroscopy. Bitome’s first product is a continuous metabolic monitoring solution for synthetic biology and biomanufacturing. Bitome is hiring an intern to help with designing, building, testing, and fabricating of electronic boards for fluidic handling and automation.

You will be responsible for:
• Designing and building of electronic circuits from schematic design to soldering the board and testing it
• Developing electronic submodules to interface with peristaltic pumps, valves, sensors and communication with automation software
• Programming microcontrollers for STM32 platform
• Communicate results with team members

Requirements for the position are:
• Basic CAD modeling using Autodesk Fusion 360 / Solidworks
• Experience of working with STM32 microcontrollers
• Experience of PCB layout and design with KiCAD / Altium
• Experience soldering and testing of PCB boards

Come join our team’s quest to democratize molecular spectroscopy and along the way we may just change the world.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

We are looking for a computer vision engineer for the summer (maybe more) that has experience validating deep learning (ML/CV) data sets (eg, calculating mAP (mean Average Precision) score from several boxing experiments).

Type: Depending on work experience. Anything from summer internship (intern), part-time employee, temp, co-founder, contractor (at least 150 hours)

Company Description:
Alpha Fiber is a biotech startup in San Diego that utilizes computer vision and deep learning technologies in order to detect potential concussions in athletes using only cameras. We are a small team with plans for rapid growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop software in Python / C++
  • Prepare and deliver informative presentations
  • Artificial Intelligence/Deep Learning/Machine Learning experience preferred
  • Excellent public speaking and communication skills
  • Highly detail oriented

If you are interested, please contact me and hopefully we can chat soon. Thank you.
UI/UX mobile app tied to back end cloud

We are looking to connect multiple open-source sensors to a heirarchical multi-tenant cloud db.

2 sensors are "transmit" only and produced by mfg #1.

Another sensor is produced by mfg #2, is "transmit/receive" and has an LED that is controlled by the gateway. The gateway is also produced by mfg #2.

There is an NFC reader that will also transmit data to the gateway so that it too can be sent to the cloud.

All sensors/readers must be integrated into a single gateway.

If this challenge seems interesting and you feel you have the qualifications to execute, kindly contact me directly at nadine@tygabox.com.

Please include a copy of your most recent credentials. Looking forward to learning more about you! Cheers! Nadine

Crelytics is a Silicon Valley fintech startup, backed by funds in San Francisco and angels from Stanford. We are hiring rockstar developers.

About the Opportunity:
You are expected to have built atleast 1 app in past and ideally deployed on Play/AppStore and be comfortable with integrating APIs in app. Your responsibilities:

  1. Architecture, design and development of mobile apps
  2. Integrating and publishing APIs
  3. Devops
Expirenced API Devloper who knows how to work with resturant codes as well as create the places API themselves.

Front End and Backend IOS and Andriod Software Engineer,
Expirenced Devloper who understands how to code backend of the app to the front end as well as get app uploaded onto testflight for IOS.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.

INTERNATIONAL VOLUNTEERING INTERNSHIP IN AN INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION

Human Connection Economy 4.0 (HCE 4)

Description: Virtual Internship

Length: Three to six months

Location: New York (USA). Remote working.

HCE 4 Headquarters: Villeurbanne, Lyon, France, European Union

HCE 4: HCE 4 is a professional, international and innovative federation that accompanies organisations and businesses that wish to migrate towards the 4th Industrial Revolution (also known as Economy 4.0). HCE 4 services integrate new concepts for management and marketing through putting the human, human connection and the planet at the heart of companies; and all around them through their clients. This is the Human Connection Economy 4.0. We are a Social Business that have just launched, seeking to become a part of the Fourth Sector. And we are in our start-up phase. Our outlook is global and we are specifically focussed on North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia. You can find more information about us at www.hce4.com.

Technology 4.0 Strategy Internship (Engineering)

Internship Objectives (to be finalised during the on-boarding process):

  • Participate with the conception and construction of New Technology 4.0 (Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Humanoid Robots) training sessions.
  • Integrate new types of training and conception inspired by neuroscience (e.g. connected creativity). There will be training sessions to prepare the student.
  • Analyse competition and client needs.
  • Lead training sessions.
  • Development towards the co-management of the team.
  • Create and organise HCE 4’s professional seminars and conferences.
  • Create links with the world of New Technology 4.0 and HCE 4 services.
  • Very motivating, diverse and innovative missions.

Student Profile:

  • Undergraduate/Masters student studying Engineering. Also open to students who are very motivated by new technologies who are enrolled in a Masters course.
  • Additional languages than English are appreciated but not compulsory.
  • Good command of Office (Word/Excel/Power Point) and have access to this on their own laptop.
  • Very autonomous and independent – a fast learner.
  • It is not necessary to have existing knowledge of new technology, human management, or human marketing as this knowledge will be developed through training with HCE 4.
  • Ability to work full-time during the period of your missions.

Frontend Web Developer Internship

Who are we:
GrowSquares designs outdoor gardens that are fun, productive and easy to use. Our system leverages an app that captures remote microclimate data to ensure our users not only grow the best herbs, and vegetables for their space but are able to do so using the exact mixture of nutrients, minerals, and bacteria their plants need to thrive. We form our proprietary mixture (seeds included) into modular square-foot blocks, wrapping them in a nutrient-rich organic casing that continues to feed a users’ plants as it biodegrades. Once a user’s garden has been delivered, the app is able to provide tailored watering, servicing and harvesting recommendations as well as help users identify and address any problems their plants might be experiencing.

To watch a video of how our system works, visit: http://bit.ly/howgrowsquaresworks

We're looking for someone with:

  • Knowledge and hands-on experience in Front-End Development w/ ReactJS & Redux
  • Experience with HTML, ReactJS, CSS/SASS, JavaScript, Redux, Git, and strong understanding of web technologies (webpack, babel, routing, database, git, responsive design) necessary
  • Advanced understanding CSS/SASS in order to faithfully reflect in queue designs
  • Ability to write neat, organized, and efficient code w/ code base maintenance & scaling in mind
  • Ability to implement high fidelity prototypes as laid out in Figma into code
  • Ability to search, read, and implement code documentations as deemed necessary
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent development habits, knowledge of best practices and documentation
  • Able to multitask and solve problems in an efficient and timely manner
  • The ability to work well with a team and thrive in a fast-paced environment

Bonus points if you have:

  • Experience with Firebase, React Hooks, Bootstrap, 3rd party API integrations, Heroku
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Experience with testing development (Jest, etc.)
  • Experience with 1+ years experience as a developer
  • Experience with Git

Education:

  • 3 years of college completed (equivalent to an Associate’s Degree) or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field

Who you are:
You ideally have an interest in Smart Cities, urban agriculture, GIS mapping and networked systems. Additionally, you’re interested in deep learning, ImageNet development, and multivariate testing methodologies. You’re quick to consider the best approach for difficult development problems and are always looking to improve your craft. You’re ready to dive in and help build a mobile application in an agile, sprint-driven method of product iteration.

What you will be doing:
GrowSquares is searching for a software engineer to contribute to the development of our mobile application platform. This person will be a key member of the team that’s creating a best-in-class native mobile experience. You will work on our feature set and deliver clean, testable code.

Requirements:
3+ year towards a computer science (or equivalent) degree (grad students and recent grads STRONGLY preferred)
Comfort with developing iOS applications, including knowledge of Swift and third-party API integration, with multiple submitted apps to the App Store a requisite for consideration
Full-stack mobile development, familiar with Node.js and one or more data management system (MongoDB, PostGres, MySQL)
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, or other cloud based services

Additional responsibilities:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, familiar with tools like Slack and Asana
Provide internal team support: specifications and scoping, and coordination to roadmap milestones, LAUNCH!
Support partner, team and community members

About AppliedAutonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you’ll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.

As the foremost enabler of autonomous vehicle development, Applied Intuition equips engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomy to market. Applied’s suite of products, focused on simulation and analytics, delivers sophisticated infrastructure built for scale. Companies of all sizes use Applied to comprehensively test and rapidly accelerate their autonomous vehicle development. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Tokyo, Munich, and Seoul, Applied is composed of software and automotive experts from the top companies in the world (such as Google, Amazon, Apple, Waymo, Tesla, Delphi, GM, and Bosch).

About the Role(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

At Applied, you will:

  • Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows
  • Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
  • Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
  • Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
  • Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
  • Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)
  • Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middlewares (such as ROS)

About Us

Our team strives to create the first truly human-first fintech platform that guides you throughout your life. We hope to empower people to actively engage in their financial lives and provide them with the resources they need to succeed financially.

We believe there is a fundamental problem in fintech world today around educating customers on financial services and practices and connecting them to resources that will actually serve them.

Our initial product pairs influencers with industry professionals to provide an interactive and fun way of learning finance for college students.

If you've ever felt lost or overwhelmed about your finances and are excited to join a team whom is actively trying to reduce that anxiety, read on.

With Us You Will:

  • Gain valuable, real-world experience building consumer education product for Gen Z.
  • Work closely with mentors from top tech companies such as Google, Bytedance (TikTok), and Citizen
  • Work across the stack on a variety of different projects, where you will learn mobile, backend, and frontend technologies
  • Opportunity to work hand-in-hand with design and product team with autonomy on what gets built and how
  • Opportunity to work on a video-first based product with influencers such as Chris Paul, Vernon Davis, etc.

What We Look For:

  • Possess excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability.
  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals. You do not need to have a degree in Computer Science.
  • You can be a good coder in any language (C++, C, Java, Scala, Rust, Haskell, OCaml, Erlang, Python, Ruby, PHP, Node.JS, C# etc.), but willing to work on Dart, Golang, and TypeScript.

Tech Stack:

  • Mobile development is on Flutter framework and utilizes programming language Dart.
  • Our backend is written in Golang.
  • Our web applications is on React framework and utilizes programming language TypeScript.
  • All of our infrastructure is on AWS.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
