location.city: Los Angeles • New York City • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote

description:
Coefficient Ventures is an assets management firm that invests in disruptive frontier technologies. We are focusing on blockchain technology enabled new economy, network effects, and other frontier technology opportunities in US tech equity at late stage and in public markets . Founded in 2017, the fund has invested in over 30 blockchain companies worldwide. The firm’s strategy includes venture capital and hedge fund strategy. We are looking for talents that are hungry and passionate about cryptocurrencies, and technology investments. (The official website needs to be updated, you can research our portfolio on crunchbase and news to better understand who we are).

Requirements:
1, Finance or tech background, either in education background or work experience. Ideally has both a tech and finance education background. Having a computer science and engineering education background or working as a developer at a top tier tech company or startup is a plus. You can have top tier financial institutions or tech companies work experience and looking to transition into cryptocurrency and venture capital investemnts. Or you can be a fresh graduate with good internship experience in top tier financial institutions or tech companies

2, In this three month investment training program of non paid internship you will gain the knowledge of investments in venture capital, activist investor, hedge fund strategy and using those strategies to apply for the world’s most interesting technology investments in blockchain, cryptocurrency and other frontier tech opportunities. It’s cool and fun, also you can improve your personal financial and investment skills for your lifetime.

3, This program is designed for helping our firm selecting potential full-time team members, so we will consider candidates that can be a potential full-time role after the training. We will select team members based on the performance during the internship.

4, The firm is a startup fund, you will gain all the experience in investments across all the perspectives, so will need candidates who love startup culture and eager to learn new things everyday. Compared with working for a big company or firm, you will most likely focus on one thing in there , which you won’t get the whole pic of investments. In Coefficient Ventures, we will train all the team members to be a good entrepreneur and investor. This program will be directly trained by our founding partner in the firm, the interns will work closely with partners daily.

Responsibilities:

  1. Finish all assigned research projects and write research reports. 2, Online or attending developer events in different cities , networking to deal sourcing. 3, Communicate with the team of potential investment opportunities and help the firm to identify and close the promising projects. 4, Summary of the weekly industry updates and important information. 5, Communicate with the existing portfolio companies and track the projects’ progress and updates. Assistant portfolio companies’ needs. 6, Some operational work for the firm.

position: (Unpaid Internship) KOS Technologies Ai – iOS Developer
description:
At KOS Technologies Ai, our mission is to improve healthcare experiences for patients of all socioeconomic background, through advancements in medical technologies and artificial intelligence. We are designing, developing, and patenting technology that delivers efficiencies, improves quality outcomes, and reduces economic and social burden in the global healthcare market. Our team members are technically skilled, while being hungry to learn in an environment heavily dependent on teamwork, dependability, and accountability to each other—we’re looking for the same background in our newest team member.

As an iOS developer, you will work with current KOS developers on app integration of iPhone image and video capture, image processing, 3D image representation, manual app data entry, UI and UX design, and wireless data transfer. As a KOS applicant, your desire to build iOS apps, utilizing the latest Apple iPhone hardware, with an emphasis on teamwork and learning in a fast-paced environment, will set you apart.

Minimum Requirements:
• Created multiple iOS apps, including functionalities as screen animations and animated scene transitions
• UI and UX design experience
• Programming experience in Swift, Metal, C#, Python
• Usage of Apple image capture and depth sensors within an iOS app
• Experience working with 2D and 3D images, with associated 3D data and metadata
• Experience working with creating, saving, and exporting point cloud data in an XCode environment, using iOS SDKs such as ARKit
• Experience working with JSON files to transfer of information across multiple platforms
• Experience managing remote data via REST APIs

• Fluent in Git and general version control protocols
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines with attention to detail and follow-through
• Willingness to participate in multiple weekly meetings and design reviews

Nice to have:
• Experience with Core Image, Core Video and AVFoundation
• Project experience in Unity engine (preferably mobile development)
o Experience with Unity UI and scripting
• App development experience in Android SDK
• Javascript, C++, React
• Knowledge of Apple's HealthKit,
• UIKit, AppleWatch and other core Apple framework

description:

We are looking to hire an Electrical Engineering intern. Someone who is currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, either a bachelors or masters.

We are currently building out our content piece of our website & youtube channel. Which includes articles and videos related to the Electrical Engineering. We are looking for someone who has some technical experince and also enjoys electrical engineering.

P.S - If you are good at video editing that also is a plus but not a requirement

Fyusion is a machine learning & computer vision company that enables anyone to capture and display interactive 3D 360 images using their smartphone. Our unique 3D format allows for significant additional functionality that 2D images can’t offer, including: background image effects & automatic damage detection for cars, and an understanding of the human skeleton for tagging products & features in fashion E-commerce. Our investors and customers include large international conglomerates and industry leaders, which puts us in a unique and advantageous position. We have ambitious goals and are looking for new energetic team members to help us reach them together.

The Computer Vision team at Fyusion develops and applies state of the art algorithms in visualization, 3D reconstruction, SLAM, bundle adjustment, state estimation, and sensor fusion. We combine this with the efforts from our Machine Learning team to deliver an intelligent product which is loved by our customers. We are looking for candidates who are excited about solving complex problems at the intersection of classical 3D geometry and Deep Learning. You will have the resources and opportunities to publish your work at major conferences.

Here are our requirements:

  • Experience with 3D geometry, SLAM, Structure from Motion, bundle adjustment, view synthesis
  • Proficient in C++, OpenCV

Bonus if you have experience with Computer Graphics:

  • NeRF (Representing Scenes as Neural Radiance Fields for View Synthesis)
  • Rendering photorealistic data
  • image based rendering
  • computational geometry

Here's what we can offer you:

Paid company holidays, commuter benefits, company catered lunches, a fully stocked snack pantry, team and company off-sites, but the most exciting: the chance to work on an incredible pioneering technology team that impacts user-facing services.

If you read this and think this is what you want to do, apply! If you read this, and think that you might need some help hitting all of the points, please apply! We have an entire team that is happy to mentor and share their knowledge with you.

ABOUT US
At ZaiNar, we’re leveraging patented innovations using software-defined radios and advanced signal processing to build revolutionary new products in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing. Our imaginative team has developed the world’s most precise network time synchronization and distribution capabilities – wirelessly syncing to sub-nanosecond accuracy. We’re solving leading edge problems in RF location tracking and network communications. Our initial target market is asset tracking in dynamic industrial environments ($10B+), and the opportunities beyond that are endless. ZaiNar already complies with release 16 of 3GPP standards for 5G, to enable ZaiNar location tracking for any 5G-NR device without hardware changes. ZaiNar is VC-backed by tier 1 funds including Softbank, and has graduated from multiple accelerator programs including StartX, Alchemist, and Plug and Play.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace, where the best idea wins, is important to us. So, come join a curious, collaborative, and forward-thinking team, where everyone has the freedom to shape their own future, our company‘s, and the world’s – one nanosecond at a time.

THE ROLE
Join a team of brilliant engineers developing the next generation of networked software-defined radio systems to support ZaiNar’s super-precise network time distribution capabilities. We are seeking an Engineering Intern for Summer 2021. ZaiNar is looking for highly motivated software interns to be a part of a star team. Our company is seeking self-starters who are interested in owning real engineering projects during their internship. ZaiNar Engineering is in an important phase of product development, and there are many interesting projects. A well-matched intern will bring excitement, curiosity, and flexibility to the role.

We are prepared for, and flexible with, working from home. Due to the pandemic, the role will be partially or fully remote, but we do have an office in downtown Redwood City, CA that is open with strict safety guidelines in place and in compliance with all the current local, state, and CDC regulations.

COMPELLING ATTRIBUTES
● Studying computer science, EE, or related fields towards a post-graduate degree (PhD preferred)
● Strong data analytics, signal processing and/or wireless communication background
● Familiarity with super-resolution algorithms for angle of arrival estimation
● Background in estimation theory and statistical signal processing
● Solid knowledge of convex and non-convex optimization techniques
● Experience with Python, C++, and comparable programming languages
● Experience with Linux development environment
● Experience with radio hardware (hobby or professional)
● Ability to be a self-starter and solve problems proactively
● Excited about working in an agile, startup work environment
● Ability to work independently and provide creative solutions
● Excited about deploying tech in multiple test environments and locations
● Fluency in English (written and spoken)

ALSO INTERESTING
● Web development and data visualization
● Embedded firmware experience
● Hardware build skills
● Knowledge of RF lab equipment

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: R&D Technician - Product Engineering, Temporary Cell Assembly Technician (Compressed Nights)
description:

We are seeking a motivated and detailed technician to join our Cell Engineering team. You will be a part of team that assembles devices and correlates observations with performance in order to inform process improvement.

Responsibilities:

Consistently executing SOP's and product/process specifications to precisely assemble cell devices in a prototype facility, fixture assemblies and perform mechanical tests. Understanding changes to process and applying them effectivelyMonitoring and recording key parameters during assembly. Communicating discrepancies found in prototype assembly lines to the team lead and managerClearly and concisely communicating task completion status to team members and manager through verbal and written pass-downs using MS Office applications (Excel, Outlook and OneNote)Maintaining a clean work-space and safe work environment

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

A high-school diploma

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Thorough, adaptive and capable of completing tasks with minimal errorsAble to deliver on throughput and quality expectations under tight schedules. You are flexible and can adapt to a fast-changing environment and work prioritiesComfortable working with computers: quality systems, databases and MS Office productsEager to learn new techniques and have demonstrated the ability to learn and apply new skillsFriendly, positive and a good team memberOrganized, detailed and have clear written and verbal communication skillsAble and willing work overnight and weekends with rand flexible to work overtime on short notice.

Ability to perform work in a glovebox, dry room or fume hood that requires the use of fine motor skills for extended periods of time, standing, reaching and twisting motions with hands and lifting up to 15 lbs.

A two-year technical degreeExperience working within a Li ion Battery lab or in gloveboxes, fume hoods or dryroom Ultrasonic welding, sealing equipment, weigh balance, toggle presses Using JMP software

Blink Health Pharmacy is a new tech-powered pharmacy revolutionizing the way people access prescription medicine. Our pharmacy is affiliated with Blink Health, which leverages its proprietary technology to provide users with access to low negotiated prices on over 15,000 medications.

Our core mission is to delight our customers and turn them into fans. We understand that in order to do this, we must work closely with pharmacies to ensure prescriptions can be processed quickly and effectively so our customers receive the best experience. You are Blink's champion with the pharmacy. You will field calls to and from pharmacies and prescribers, obtaining prescriptions for Blink’s patients.

We are looking to you to create positive relationships with our pharmacies by assisting them in filling our customers’ medications. This is your opportunity to join a health-tech enterprise. Apply your expertise outside of the retail space in a new and exciting way that offers innovative new services to patients nationwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Field calls from patients, providers and pharmacies across the country
  • Receive, enter, process and fill prescriptions as per Blink protocols.
  • Obtain a fundamental understanding of the Blink Health product for quick pharmacy assistance
  • Resolve open orders through communication with pharmacists and the Blink Health Customer Experience team
  • Perform all tasks in a safe and compliant manner that is consistent with corporate policies as well as State and Federal laws
  • Work collaboratively with the management team and pharmacists
  • Under the direct supervision of a pharmacist, perform tasks such as external pharmacy transfers, internal pharmacy transfers, and internal verbal orders from providers.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by Pharmacist in Charge

Requirements:

  • Must at least be in Professional Year 2 in an accredited Pharmacy School
  • PA Intern License
  • Strong phone presence in a support/service capacity
  • Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy

  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn complex new software

  • On-site in Pittsburgh

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity of all kinds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Looking for a techie for an exciting project
description:
Looking for a friendly, competent, reliable, patient and polite techie who can do the following things flawlessly:

  1. Migrate a small Wordpress site to free hosting. Currently my hosting is not free, and they try to start charging me for php issues. Currently the site is on dated php and when they tried to update it, it doesn’t work. So they left the old php but they want to charge for “support”, and I had enough of it. I asked them to leave the site up as is, with the old php, and I want to move it to a different hosting and close this account. I created the site around 2016.

  2. Knowledge and ability in creating e-book on Kindle. All the written material is finished, need help with the entire process of posting it as a book with free hosting on Kindle. I read some of the Amazon manuals but it’s over my head. Will need help with the entire process, creating the pdf’s, posting them, etc. will have to coordinate this project, work well together. If you have previous experience in creating a professional e-book, it’s an advantage. Will need ISBN number.

If you can do all this, and you are a perfectionist who works for optimal results, please reply by email, tell me about yourself and your experience, and why/how you think that you can accomplish this project. Please don’t send tech terminology as I will not understand it. Just describe your experience, interest and pay expectations in plain English. Please send links to work samples, especially for Kindle projects. Don’t forget to send your name and contact info.

Looking forward to discuss,

Thank you

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

Amply Power is a clean energy technology company going after an emerging $100B market opportunity. AMPLY deploys and operates EV chargers the way data centers operate server blades - lots of them at a time, with high efficiency, low cost, and 99.99% uptime. We serve public sector and commercial businesses with fleet vehicles - electric buses, trucks, and passenger fleets. Amply Power is focused on transforming the commercial transportation sector by removing the challenges, surprises, and learning curve that fleet operators often face when switching to electricity as a fuel.

We’re looking for product-oriented engineers who are passionate about building great backend services in a fast-paced, high-growth, early-stage start-up environment. Our engineers are encouraged to be autonomous, solving open-ended problems and maximizing their own growth. The Backend Software Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the software that runs on our electric vehicle charging stations and for the interfaces between stations and cloud-based services.

While this posting is listed for SF Bay Area, CA, we are open to hiring throughout the US.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Designing and building backend solutions from the ground up.
• Assist in test setups (physical charging station setups), test plans, documentation of monitoring error codes, and product features.
• You will work across teams to build and collaborate on product requirements for the next generation of world-class EV technology products.
• Building large-scale Node.JS applications in real-time, event-driven, distributed/transactional cloud/IoT platforms.
• Collaborate with leads, developers, and designers to create new features and maintain back-end architectures for highly trafficked applications.
• Fix software defects/bugs, measure and analyze code for quality and test coverage.
• Ensure proper technical design and documentation.
• Writing high-quality code for production and master the art of code quality.

QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
• 2+ years of professional experience with backend development (preferably in node.js).
• Experience with micro-services architectures and building scalable backend APIs.
• Demonstrated experience maintaining continuous delivery pipelines.
• Experience with Docker containerization and container orchestration
• Self-starter has worked highly independently.
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills

Additional Awesomeness
• Experience with Java, AWS and/or distributed systems is a plus.
• Prior experience working at startups and/or on consumer-facing products.
• IoT / control system domain experience is an asset, ideally in the Electric Vehicle / charging platform space

About Compa

Compa is a new way to create offers with software. Our data science engine scales compensation analysis so that every decision is data-driven. Data-driven decisions help us make better human decisions. Our tools are designed to make compensation easy to understand and communicate so offer decisions are consistently fast and accountable.

Creating offers should be simple, unbiased, and designed to win. Compa makes this possible, and opens up incredible new ways to understand and manage compensation outcomes at scale.

About the role

Compa is looking for interns to join our team. As an intern, you will join Compa for 10 weeks and work on our core product and systems.
We’re looking for interns that want to code, grow, and have an impact on the world:

Code

  • Work with Compa’s engineers and CTO to build a core product feature end-to-end.
  • Work on Compa’s React frontend and Django backend.
  • Coding is a team sport at Compa - we work together to build the best features and scalable systems.

Grow

  • As intern, you will be giving meaningful work and contribute directly to Compa’s core product and systems under the guidance of experienced engineers.
  • Our founding engineering team is passionate about helping engineers grow to their full potential - and has a track record of doing so at Facebook and Oculus.
  • Compa is a safe place to learn and to grow - we have a no blame culture. Human error is a consequence of complex systems, not bad people. When mistakes happen, we work together to make our systems more resilient, not hunt for blame.

Impact

  • We’re applying technology to build scalable solutions to one of society’s toughest challenges - making compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • Pay is deeply personal and affects everyone who works for a living. At Compa you’ll be part of a small team on the frontier of making compensation better for everyone.
  • We’re a VC-backed early-stage startup, you’ll have the opportunity to influence matters of company culture, strategy, go-to-market, and fundraising.

About you

  • You want to make compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • You want to learn in highly ambiguous and constantly changing situations.
  • You have a bias for action - transform ambiguity and uncertainty into concrete next steps.
  • You are able to overcome obstacles to ship - done is better than perfect!
  • You are a collaborative problem solver.
  • You are looking to realize your potential by engaging with challenging problems, both technical and societal.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with React and/or Django

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About us

Intrepid Market is a marketplace community to list, buy, and sell technology and creative services from remote companies and professionals from around the world.

We believe that remote companies who sell services deserve the same kind of tools as the businesses that sell goods.

We provide technology creatives with a shopping cart for services, and UI templates for service productization.

Showcase your work clearly with hi-res product images, using youtube videos, and instagram photos.

Describe your unique process, service delivery, price, meetings, and revisions—all in one unique profile.

Now startups can buy your services with confidence through our specially designed shopping cart and service catalogue-- made for specifically for creative technology businesses.

Startups and global brands from all around the world come to our site to search and shop for the technology or creative services they need, and our platform returns them a service that best matches their profile, needs, and requirements.

Our platform is designed to verify, sort, and match technology creatives and startups on over 100 metrics that makes the purchasing decision easy for customers, and makes it easy for remote software engineers, designers, and digital marketers to sell without the endless back and forth of requirements gathering.

Beyond simply matching customers and technology creatives, we provide our members with access to financial tools like: Subscription management Escrow, B2B card payments, POS business Loans, Invoice Factoring, and Lines of Credit.—Growing your business, customer trust, mutual cooperation, and loyalty.

Our mission is to change the way businesses connect, work, and grow--while making global trade universally accessible and inclusive through financial technology.

We believe that anyone should be able to start and grow a global business from anywhere in the world.

You will collaborate, but take ownership over everything you ship. You never call code "released" until you’re confident it’s correct.

A background in computer science or a related field, coupled with a deep immersion in front end code and frameworks.

What we value

Continuous learning. We're looking for software engineers who thrive on learning new technologies and don't believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our massive growth and rapidly evolving business environment.

Boldness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive on proving that speed and quality are not conflicting; that you can achieve both at the same time. You apply creativity to problem solving and can respond to feedback without bias.

Versatility. In addition to having an intimate knowledge of the API and service layers, you understand how all the pieces fit together (frontend, database, network layer, etc.) and how they impact the performance of your application.

Team player. You believe that you can achieve more on a team-that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Design and business acumen. You understand that to become a better engineer you need to have a diversity of thoughts and perspectives that can drive results. You take a human-centred and data-driven approach to making decisions that impact the business for positive and sustainable growth.

How to stand out
if you want to join our team, submit the following to 'jobs [at] intrepid.technology'

  • LinkedIn profile
  • Github profile,or CV
  • A few words about why Intrepid is interesting to you, and what you would do to help us improve
  • Fun facts about yourself, like what you like to read, you hobbies

**We're open to 4th year university students from top CS programs who are interested in a 3 month internship with the possibility to move into a full-time role

About us

Intrepid Market is a marketplace community to list, buy, and sell technology and creative services from remote companies and professionals from around the world.

We believe that remote companies who sell services deserve the same kind of tools as the businesses that sell goods.

We provide technology creatives with a shopping cart for services, and UI templates for service productization, and subsciption mamagement for their products, services, course, and podcasts.

Showcase your work clearly with hi-res product images, using youtube videos, and instagram photos.
Describe your unique process, service delivery, price, meetings, and revisions—all in one unique profile.

Now startups can buy your services with confidence through our specially designed shopping cart and service catalogue-- made for specifically for creative technology businesses.

Startups and global brands from all around the world come to our site to search and shop for the technology or creative services they need, and our platform returns them a service that best matches their profile, needs, and requirements.

Our platform is designed to verify, sort, and match technology creatives and startups on over 100 metrics that makes the purchasing decision easy for customers, and makes it easy for remote software engineers, designers, and digital marketers to sell without the endless back and forth of requirements gathering.

Beyond simply matching customers and technology creatives, we provide our members with access to financial tools like: Subscription management, Escrow, B2B card payments, POS business Loans, Invoice Factoring, and Lines of Credit.—Growing your business, customer trust, mutual cooperation, and loyalty.

Our mission is to change the way businesses connect, work, and grow--while making global trade universally accessible and inclusive through financial technology.

We believe that anyone should be able to start and grow a global business from anywhere in the world.

If you would like to join our mission of helping more founders start, build, and grow companies, let’s talk!

Why Join intrepid?

We are looking for a backend engineer(s) to join our team. More than anything, we seek engineers with strong coding fundamentals. We work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is still small, and people wear many hats. You will have the opportunity to jump between engineering, product, customer support, design - participating in every part of the business from idea to production.

Our stack
* Backend. Javascript, Node.js
* Cloud: Google cloud platform
* Database: PostgresSql
* Frontend. Plasmic.app
* Javascript Frameworks: React, Next.js,

Key Responsibilities
* Design, build, and deploy features end to end - We ship daily. You are responsible for breaking down high level features into tasks that can ship to prod.
* Code quickly and test thoroughly - Maintain the balance between velocity and code health.
* Work on a team - Collaborate with other engineers to design and architect features. Know when to ask for help when you are stuck.
* Build improvements to performance and reliability
Define and create APIs and backend logic

Intrepid may be a good fit if you have / are
a strong knowledge of:
Javascript
Node.js.
APIs
Cloud Architecture
Micro-services
Service oriented Architectures

* Strong understanding of PostgresSQL and API development and management - You build to make platforms scalable and extensible.
Strong work ethic - You have a willingness to do what it takes to deliver results
* Entrepreneurial - You want to start a company one day and have a high tolerance for ambiguity

Our team
We are a small startup based out of Singapore and San Francisco, with a remote first mentality. We are a team of five, with deep experience across design, marketing, content, and finance from companies like Google, Oracle, IFC, and more.

There are two high level athletes on the team and a previous paramedic and firefighter.

We started Intrepid because most of us have worked at early stage startups and have found that building and scaling talent, teams, and technology innovation very difficult. We want to help builders and creators grow and own more of their company over the long term.

How to stand out
if you want to join our team, submit the following to 'jobs [at] intrepid.technology'

  • LinkedIn profile
  • Github profile,or CV
  • A few words about why Intrepid is interesting to you, and what you would do to help us improve
  • Fun facts about yourself, like what you like to read, your hobbies
Seeking passionate and self-driven interns that are eager to dig into some code, work on innovative projects and be part of the early stages of a revolutionary agency.

location.city: Austin • New York City • San Francisco • Remote

description:
Fresh Sip is currently looking for a driven Shopify/Marketplace Developer Intern who has an interest in working with brands in the Food & Beverage industry.

About A Fresh Sip:
We are trailblazers setting the stage for the growing new trend in the beverage industry -- making drinking culture inclusive. We are building a marketplace for the "low" and "no" alcohol beverage vertical as thousands of new beverages continue to enter the market. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground level of emerging wave and demand of niche marketplaces and the quickly expanding nonalcohlic beverage vertical.

We are a team of ex-tech entrepreneurs, consultants, TEDx and global speakers, and brand experts who had to cut back on drinking alcohol for health reasons over the last decade. As former startup founders and tech entrepreneurs we saw the trends highlighting an uptick in zero-proof and low ABV beverages and decided to build a platform & community highlighting this growing space.

You will be working very closely with and be mentored by the founding team.

Internship Objectives:

  • Support the build of our beverage data filteration system
  • Support the expansion and maintenance of our shopify store
  • Support the planning and development of our new marketplace
  • Work with our team to develop new strategic initiatives
  • Support product efforts

Requirements:

  • Current student or recent graduate with a background in a related subject area (engineering, data science, business, computer science, STEM)
  • Ability to write high quality code
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • An ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time
  • Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team
  • Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view
  • Experience in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript/ECMA
  • A strong knowledge of Shopify platform
  • Knowledge of shopify liquid templating language
  • Experience working with / building e-commerce stores and marketplaces
  • Basic knowledge with Shopify theme development and customization
  • The ability to always seek the simplest and most elegant solution to often complex problems
  • Drive to continously build on shopify knowledge and stay up to date on trends
  • A strong understanding of responsive web design techniques

Bonus

  • Specific knowledge of Java, Python, Ember.js and/or JavaScript are a plus
  • Specific experience in or knowledge of data systems is a plus
  • Deep knowledge of Liquid and previous shopify development is a plus
  • A practical understanding of out of the box marketplace solutions like marketcube.io, sharetribe, multi-vendor marketplace on shopify is a BIG plus
  • Experience working with different Shopify JS APIs (storefront, AJAX Cart, Sections etc) is a plus

A Fresh Sip is currently looking for a driven Front End Developer Intern who has an interest in working with brands in the Food & Beverage industry.

About A Fresh Sip:
Our mission is to make drinking culture more inclusive. We aim to make navigating the "low" and "no" alcohol beverage space easy without compromising fun, sophistication or experience. We are an early staged startup but we already have deep relationships with dozens of reknown beverage brands, restaurants, bars and mixologists.

We are a team of ex-tech entrepreneurs, consultants, TEDx & global speakers, and brand experts who had to cut back on drinking alcohol for health reasons over the last decade. As former startup founders and tech entrepreneurs we saw the trends highlighting an uptick in zero-proof and low ABV beverages and decided to build a platform & community highlighting this growing space.

You will be working very closely with and be mentored by the founding team.

Internship Objectives:

  • Support the build of our beverage data filteration system
  • Support the development of our new custom platform
  • Work with our team to develop new strategic initiatives
  • Support product efforts

Requirements:

  • Current student or recent graduate with a background in a related subject area (engineering, data science, business, computer science, STEM)
  • Ability to write high quality code
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team
  • Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view
  • General familiarity with some of the following: HTTP, REST and web API best practices Modern JavaScript and/or Ember.js SQL, relational databases and key-value stores

Bonus

  • Specific knowledge of Java, Python, Ember.js and/or JavaScript are a plus
  • Specific experience in or knowledge of data systems is a plus
  • Familiarity with Shopify and Wix integrations is a plus

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry!
