Go Off is an emerging social platform that hosts small live-chat discussions which are moderated to help break echo chambers and enhance engagement. Our mission is to design a user centered social platform through shared media interests with a focus on transparency and trust. We've noticed that genuine and honest engagement with consumers is getting harder and harder on current social media platforms, so we created a channel through which brands and companies can host conversations which offers transparent marketing and replaces focus groups. On top of this we provide analytics of the conversations they host on our platform and share it with the companies after.

With over 150 active users within our first month of our Beta Launch, we are a growing company and have recently met with interested corporations and companies such as IBM and Edelman. We have also secured a B2B pilot for this upcoming spring to test our monetization strategy. We are in need of a skilled Database Administrator to help us continue building our product.

We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about learning and is willing to commit to a rapidly growing student- run company.

Requirements:

  • Skilled in MySQL, MongoDB, and relational databases (schemas etc.)
  • Knowledge of AWS and Docker

Nice to have, but not required:

  • Proficiency in Flask, Mongoose

Responsibilities:

  • Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.
  • Create, review and optimize relational database operations in our applications.
  • Design, create, and deliver new system solutions by collaborating with our tech and marketing teams
  • Write code that will perform efficiently and accurately in an asynchronous architecture
  • Work on internal web tools that are crucial to our Operations Team
  • Collaborate with UX and engineering team to implement user flows

Hours:

  • 1 hour weekly All Team Meeting
  • 1 hour weekly Tech Team Meeting
  • 8-10 hours of work per week (flexible schedule)
  • Team Bonding events to happen 1-2 times a month

This is a highly valued position and will play a significant role in the future success of the venture. Accordingly, we are willing to discuss an initial equity arrangement that would be followed by cash compensation once the venture is in a position to support this.
To apply, please send your resume to:

Jessica Zheng
Director of HR
go.offmedia@gmail.com

The Manual QA Tester is responsible for manual end-to-end testing of new features and functionality prior to release to production and works closely with our product and development teams to resolve bugs.
You strive to make your code modular, reusable, and clear for all who come after you. You want to be a part of a growing team that cares about code quality, emphasizes code ownership, and supports those practices through clear acommunication, regular application reviews and comprehensive automated testing.

Role:
• Analyze user stories and other requirements and participate in product backlog grooming sessions to ask questions and gain thorough understanding.
• Develop functional and integration test cases for user stories that ensure the functionality developed meets the requirements and acceptance criteria defined by stakeholders
• Record test plans and test results into airtable
• Conduct browser and mobile browser testing
• Open defects, track and confirm their resolution before closing
• Participate in all Agile-related team meetings, including planning events, daily Scrum/Kanban check-ins, product demonstrations, and retrospectives
• Effectively communicate issues with the user interface or usability of the site to stakeholders
• Develop documentation for manual tester procedures and best practices

You
• At least 3 years of experience as a manual tester of software applications, including front-end and back-end application testing
• Demonstrated understanding of the end-to-end QA process, especially within an Agile framework, from user story/requirements analysis, through test case development and execution
• Experience with cross-browser and cross-platform testing
• Excellent attention to detail, with an ability to multitask and meet deadlines
• Capable of working collaboratively in an agile, cross-functional team environment and effectively communicate ideas and opinions to the team
• Working knowledge of testing methodologies, industry tools and best practices, with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

Vien Health is an inspired team with a mission to transform the health of everyone, everywhere through the best possible medicine. We are building a new operating system in healthcare - one that combats the biggest challenges in healthcare across Africa. Our work is inspired by our members’ journey and our actions are focused on impact and results. We excel in a dynamic, while appreciating what it means to be healthy and well.

We are looking for a full-time Backend Engineer to build elegant APIs and evolve our data models and systems architecture in a secure, HIPAA compliant environment. We are a revenue-generating, health-tech startup reinventing the primary care model.

You will develop and evolve the systems which power our business model. Making our billing, medical charting, scheduling, audio and video conferencing and other systems talk to each other. Our unique user data has to be kept secure and available at all times — the patient portal and our business insights depend upon it. We have a fully containerized and distributed infrastructure using MongoDB, Azure app services, deploys happen via Git and CI, and our larger stack that includes React / Redux.

Role

  • Develop and evolve third-party integrations and systems synchronization
  • Maintain and add to a service-oriented architecture
  • Ensure code-quality and availability of our backend infrastructure
  • Creating new API features to support consumer-facing products

description:
About the Company:

Hobo Video is a vernacular fun video based localized community driven marketplace for billions of generation Z and millennials where everybody can earn.

We are on a mission to make online shopping real via video streaming in a language the audience is most comfortable with and to provide revenue streams to influencers and small sellers by making an ecosystem of video commerce.

About the Internship:

We are looking for a talented intern as Digital Presence and SEO Executive to work along with the founders and leadership team!

We are looking for a member to add to our team of entrepreneurs. This could be a HUGE opportunity for someone passionate about learning and working in a high potential growth industry, flexible hours and schedule, and working alongside founders and leadership team to learn the in’s and out’s of getting a hyper-growth business built, launched, and growing! We are extremely passionate about what we’re doing and want someone that is going to share in that belief and attitude.

We value our interns as team members. As a Digital Presence and SEO Executive, you get to be a part of the revolution! We are building delightful experiences for some of the best platform teams out there, and an internship at Hobo only means you envision, build, and ship for them. At Hobo, you can take on big responsibilities to solve some of today's greatest problems.
If you want to learn how organizations around the world work with data and solve problems, apply now!

Responsibilities of Digital Presence and SEO Executive

  • Work with the Marketing and SEO leaders to research people and websites
  • Import and organize people and websites within sheet to build backlinks
  • Use web-based tools to submit multiple business listings
  • Perform and track outreach through social, email and telephone
  • Report to SEO Manager with successes, progress and opportunities
  • Work on offpage SEO
  • Listing about Hobo.Video on business listing website
  • Adopt new forums to write about Hobo.Video
  • Produce content and post on forums and business websites to build strong online presence
  • Have online presence where your audience is to resolve their issue or to engage with them
  • Measure and report performance of all digital campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
  • Identify trends and insights, and optimize time and efforts based on the insights
  • Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies
  • Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests
  • Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points
  • Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels
  • Collaborate with agencies and other vendor partners
  • Evaluate emerging platforms and technologies. Provide thoughts to leadership team and perspective for adoption where appropriate

Preferred Qualifications

  1. BS/MS/MBA students in marketing or a related field

  3. Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database

  5. Solid knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Firebase)

COMPANY BENEFITS:

  3. We keep transparency and equality as the first thing for employees and learning as the utmost priority.

  8. Here you will get to work with a top notch modern leadership team and talk to them directly without any hierarchy in between!

Please note: We are not interested in hearing from recruitment agencies.

description:

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

About Us:
At Sybill, we are building a video call mind-reading partner for salespeople. Sybill joins your calls with you and provides insights on your participants’ reactions during various call segments/topics. Imagine demoing the product to your clients and knowing exactly what excited them, what confuses them, and who might be interested in buying. We’re a venture-backed, early-stage enterprise SaaS startup, and our entire team comes out of Stanford, MIT, IITs, and various enterprise SaaS companies.

Role
We are building the world’s pioneering emotional intelligence platform for video calls, and the role involves learning and working with semi-structured, and multi-modal data of video, audio and text.
We bring out rare and highly useful insights about video call participants using our proprietary Machine Learning technology models, which you would be contributing towards.

Requirements

  • Passion for building robust end-to-end data engineering pipelines for real-time systems at scale.
  • Ability to think analytically about data-driven problems and reason among various solutions
  • Proficiency in data science and machine learning using Python

Benefits

  • Join a fast-growing startup and help create your personal J.A.R.V.I.S. assistant
  • Work on some of the most challenging and rewarding AI problems of our generation
  • Get out of the home and enjoy the in-person work environment
  • High-end Apple equipment for work as well food on the house

The Global Predictions economic forecasting platform is complex. Very complex. We use over 50,000 data series from extremely diverse areas like politics, public health, macroeconomics, financial markets, demographics, and more. Your role will be to help transform that data into actionable insights by helping scale up the data pipelines, solve issues throughout the backend, set up tests, and help develop front-end features. It’ll be a dynamic position that has you helping out across the entire software stack, on a small team that’s iterating quickly.

Note: this is a paid internship

Responsibilities

  • Build access and analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights for the Quantitative Economics, Software, and ML/AI teams
  • Construct automated quality checks across the data store to ensure quality control
  • Collaborate to build ML tools to increase automated insight generation and integration to core GP Knowledge Graph and macroeconomic models
  • Build out elegant and functional UIs
  • Contribute cross stack, with a focus on back end technologies, and learn wide variety of skills and technologies

Desired Qualifications

  • Be completing or have completed an undergraduate degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science
  • Have experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, etc
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
  • Be educated on financial/economic models, and interested in answering some of the biggest questions in the quantitative economics space

Responsibilities
You will be designing a ecommerce web applicaiton to present data of purchases, products. You will be working on the backend as well as the front end of the application.

Requirements
Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role
Familiarity with common stacks
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. Java Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design
Looking for full stack web developer to build the web pages and the admin console using Node.JS, HTML, CSS and Javasript.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

position: Super Smart Data Engineering Intern for a FinTech (Remote within US and Canada for now only please)
description:
At MacroXStudio, our mission is to become the best alternative data (“Big Data”) and AI based macro asset manager by measuring the world macroeconomy faster and better using thousands of new data sources like twitter, search, credit card, satellite data etc., rather than the incomplete, months delayed, slow, and frequently revised Government data.

For example, even many advanced countries are struggling to quantify the impact of COVID-19 on unemployment rate (“Next US Jobs Report Set to Be Even More Confusing, Bloomberg) and countries like India are using private think tanks to measure unemployment since there is no government data. You can help MacroX change this!

Unique commercial and social mission: In addition to providing superior returns to institutional clients, we will provide free access to our cleaned data to relevant supra-national bodies like the UN to help make better social decisions.

Work with world class experts: We have led teams at MSFT, Wall Street, and have had a Unicorn exit. We are in stealth mode but are super excited about this project. You will also get exposed to other top experts such as faculty at HBS, World Bank leaders etc. Here is a talk on applying AI to Asset mgmt.

Your role: Come help make our proprietary and unique platform that will blend these datasets with the depth of domain expertise and the scaling power of artificial intelligence (AI).
● Create the cutting-edge technology that moves and translates many new data used to inform our most critical strategic and real-time decisions.
● Create state of art visualizations for our proprietary investment platform.
● Help develop best practices, including streamlining of data sources and related programmatic initiatives.
● Work in white space and create impact from the ground up in a fast-paced, collegial environment.
● This position can be based in downtown Toronto or remote.

Responsibilities:
● Design, build and launch efficient & reliable data pipelines to move and transform data (both large and small amounts)
● Create visualizations and advance the features on our proprietary investment platform.
● Intelligently design data models for optimal storage and retrieval
● Deploy inclusive data quality checks to ensure high quality of data
● Optimize existing pipelines and maintain domain-related data pipelines
● Ownership of the end-to-end data engineering component of the solution
● Support on-call shift as needed to support the team
● Design and develop new systems in partnership with strategists to enable quick and easy consumption of data
● Apply proven expertise and build high-performance scalable data warehouses

Desired Qualifications:
● Team player and communicator
● BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field
● Experience with statistical programming languages: R, Python.
● Experience with UX, react, javascript, html and css.
● Experience in data engineering, experience in applying DWH/ETL best practices
● Experience in the Big Data stack environments (Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Google BigQuery, Snowflake, Amazon RedShift)
● Experience working with enterprise DE tools (Apache Airflow, Panda)
● Experience in public cloud technologies (Google Cloud or AWS)

To apply
Please send your resume and cover letter to candidates@macroxstudio.com. We love seeing what you are passionate about so feel free to include a project especially any with a UX component or a public dashboard (short summary + link to code/Github page if possible). Please also indicate if you can come to downtown Toronto or can only work remotely.

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Yup is a system for determining the agreed-upon social value of anything on the Internet, from Tweets and YouTube videos to blogs and news articles. It provides stronger incentives for giving meaningful opinions online by allowing users to earn money and influence if their opinion is supported by other influential members of the community. When users rate content, people, or products they have both their reputation and potential income at stake, which results in better incentives for judging content meaningfully. Our goal is to create a universal, disintermediated layer of social consensus, where the agreed-upon social value of anything online can be determined without reliance on centralized platforms like YouTube or Twitter

We’re a group of technologists and product enthusiasts passionate about leveraging emerging technologies to solve hard problems in novel ways. Our team comes from diverse backgrounds with experiences at companies and institutions like Google, Microsoft, Chanel, and West Point. We believe that innovative technology combined with a strong product mindset can help us invent creative solutions that were never thought to be possible.

What you'll be doing:

  • Developing products for interacting with the Yup protocol and representing social influence and identity
  • Improving the performance, reliability, and quality of existing products and services (including our chrome extension, web app, and supporting services)
  • Building, testing, and deploying easy-to-use features with tools like React, Vue, ES6, styled components, and webpac

What we look for in you:

  • Experience with modern JavaScript/Node.js
  • Experience building user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks like React or Vue
  • Passion for building high quality, easy-to-use products
  • Solid communication skills and structured thinking
  • Attention to code quality, maintainability, and scalability
  • Self-starter who would thrive in fast-paced working environment

Nice to haves:

  • You've worked directly with production React or Vue apps, with significant usage
  • You have general knowledge / experience with blockchain and cryptocurrencies

Internship position in a startup, with candidates eligible for academic credit and stock options.

Position is a NON-PAID internship to learn skills of designing and building flying cars, while eligible for receiving academic credit and possibility of receiving stock options.

Armada is a 4-year old startup funded by a major Silicon Valley VC.

Unique opportunity to have a real hands-on experience in an upcoming trillion dollar industry - flying cars. Personal Aerial Vehicle (flying cars) is a combination of a VTOL aircraft, drones, and airplanes.

ABOUT ARMADA:

Armada is a startup funded by major Silicon Valley VCs. Office, where you will be working, is in Santa Clara, CA. There are about 20 people on the team. Armada has a small but experienced senior leadership with multiple PhDs on-board and experienced employees from 15 to 30 years of experience. This is a good place to learn, get hands-on, and gain experience through internship.

SKILLS NEEDED:

Soldering
Ability to interpret and create electrical schematics.
Basic understanding of analog and digital circuit design.
Experience and missile/aerospace related education/background.
System performance monitoring and evaluation experience.
Electrical troubleshooting skills.
About Position:

Assists engineers in the research, design, development and test of a variety of electronic equipment and systems, including communications equipment and systems; circuitry components; analog and digital computers; and control and test equipment.
Work with expert engineers as they provide technical/engineering support to Electronics teams for issues related to the performance of the various electronics hardware.
Assist more senior engineers with the design, development, and test for electrical support equipment.
The scope of these tasks ranges from conceptual development and initial design to production and deployment support.
This position will also require the ability to understand, design and fix custom electronic circuitry and assemblies.

position: BardoVR Internship: BardoVR - An Interactive & Immersive Platform For Change
description:
BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques- calm focus, equanimity, compassion - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their meditation practice.

Who are we looking for? We are looking for smart, motivated, and creative people who are passionate about TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGY to join the BARDOVR. We are looking for people who want to change the world! Do you have an interest in Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking? We are looking for you.

Projects Include:
*Virtual Reality (Vr) Design And Development
*Game Design And Development
*Procedural Generation In Game Design/Procedural Generation In Vr
*Fractal Technology
*Business Development/Partnership Outreach.
*Growth Hacking & Community Development
*Games For Change
*Serious Games

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity - we offer real world experience working in a startup that is improving people’s lives. You will work directly with our management team, technology partners, and wellbeing community .
  • Access - to a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Mentoring - works with you to expand your skillset, add to your domain expertise, and grow your network.
  • Training - project management, software tools, and access to Wellbeing products and services.

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVRavailable.
  • Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

We believe that BardoVR can become a radical platform for change: an awe-inspiring gamified tool, grounded in ancient wisdom, that not only benefits meditators but specifically targets gamers and VR experience-seekers who otherwise might never come in contact with these profound teachings. It is a BIG vision! Are you interested?

  • Berkeley/LA-based. Virtual internship - Ok.**

We are looking for candidates that are interested in web development, A/B testing, Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

*This is currently how it works: *

  • Enter Bardo (immersive/psychedelic world) where the practice of mindfulness is employed as a game mechanic.
  • If the gamer has 5X three-minute meditation/mindfulness streaks, they progress thru the Bardo Gates.
  • Ultimately, the meditation/mindfulness needed to progress gets harder in the form of longer streaks and more distractions (just like real meditation!).
  • At the last gate of the Bardo, the player chooses (thru eye gaze) their character rebirth in one of the 6 realms (God, DemiGod, Human, Animal, Ghost, Hell).
  • Each of the 6 realms has psychological qualities (see attachment) that become the foundation for prosocial (tend and befriend) game mechanics.
  • Like life... you die at some point and begin again - "entering the Bardo".
  • Every time you play the game, you have the chance for a new experience.
  • We are exploring ways to measure the mental state/wellbeing of players, pre and post gaming experience to show that exposure to gamified meditation/mindfulness practice and prosocial game mechanics makes us happier and healthier (this is our thesis).

*This Summer we are launching our Build In The Open (inspired by John Saddington at Yen.fm). I am super excited. *

  • We have a team engaing with our communities, having conversations about BardoVR.
  • We are asking for community for input on the development of BardoVR levels, characters, game mechanics, etc
  • We have a team that takes the community inputs and turns them into micro game experiences.
  • At the end of the Summer, we will have received great feedback from our community, built relationships with future customers, and learned a lot!

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: BardoVR is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

*A few things to know about this position: *

  • Position is unpaid (we are actively raising money). We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Requires a minimum ~15 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

Please include your resume, and** tell us what you like about we are doing at BardoVR**! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://www.bardovr.com/. Contact bst@bardovr.com for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder/Executive Producer BardoVR

BardoVR team:

  • Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir. Independent filmmaker. Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.
  • Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the Wellbeing/Digital Therapeutics, 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
  • Grant Anderson - VR Producer. Former Executive Director at Sony’s 3D Center working with filmmakers including Baz Luhrmann, Ridley Scott, Ang Lee. CGI work on Academy Award-winning teams for Titanic, Spider-Man. Former Studio Head, Jaunt VR. Recently produced location-based VR experience of the Marvel Universe for Disney.

position: Internship for 3D Avatar and Costume Creation - NO prior experience is required
description:
Anifie, a virtual concert app, is looking for an unpaid intern to create 3D avatars and costumes. In this role, you will be mentored and trained to learn how to create beautiful avatars rapidly -- over 10X faster than the industry standard while maintaining quality. While it is an unpaid internship, you will directly interact with seasoned business executives and some of the top creators, including a Grammy Award winning producer, in the world. You might also interact with AI engineers. Your avatars will be likely used in shows of some of the top artists. You will learn new 3D technologies. You will learn how it feels to work in a rapidly growing VC-backed startup.

No prior experience is required.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

The Role
You will be a crucial member of the core team, from building back-end infrastructure to user-facing applications — and everything in between. You will build features across the platform from user-facing web applications, workflow systems, data modeling engines, and integrations with disparate third party systems. You will help establish technical strategy and direction and will also support growing and developing a world-class engineering team. There are so many important problems to solve that directly impact the lives of the 10,000 Americans entering retirement every day.

We're looking for a software engineer intern to support our core team. As an early team member, you will have broad impact over the technology, the product, and our company's culture.

What you'll need to be successful

  • Passion and excitement for the cause: to re-define how Americans age and transition into their third chapter.
  • Deep software engineering background and proven ability to ship world-class software products.
  • Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, and front-end frameworks. Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, React, JavaScript, TypeScript or similar languages.
  • Proven ability to drive product and engineering strategy.
  • Comfort with ambiguity. While starting from a blank slate is challenging, you find it exciting, rewarding, and empowering. You are able to build products from the ground up.
  • Obsession with end-user experience.
  • Low ego.
  • First-principles thinker: we don't care how others have done things.
  • Ability to define projects and execute. Excited to set goals and be held accountable for hitting those goals.
  • Superlative positional empathy with a strong understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
  • Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.

Company Overview:
Arcturus' flagship product, Orion, is a risk management platform designed to deliver real-time threat intelligence to security teams and corporate personnel in high risk areas. Our founders understand that reliable and up-to-date threat intelligence in the field is difficult to come by in the field, and Orion solves this problem with a network of professionals, curated open sources, and proprietary analytics. We are backed by a consortium of VC's and angels, including CRE Venture Capital and LatCap.

Prior Arcturus interns have been invited back as full-time employees, founded a Y Combinator-backed startup, and gone on to work as engineers at Facebook and Amazon. Those invited back for full-time positions will have the opportunity to receive meaningful equity in the company.

What you will do:

  • Create and manage microservices around our data aggregation pipeline
  • Create extensible tools to monitor user activity and application performance
  • Design and implement data models for new features and microservices
  • Work directly with front end product teams to implement data models and API endpoints for new features
  • Work with senior developers to improve and add to our real-time push notification services

Requirements:

  • Strong working knowledge of Javascript
  • Familiarity with REST APIs
  • Familiarity with common server frameworks such as Express
  • Familiarity with SQL databases (specifically Postgres)
  • (Optional) Experience with mapping APIs such as Mapbox, Google Maps, or Open Street Maps preferred
  • (Optional) Experience with Websockets, REST APIs, and React.js networking middleware also welcomed

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.
