position: W3LL: A Wellbeing Exploration & Discovery Platform (FullStack Developer)
description:
W3LL’s wellbeing exploration and discovery platform is an APP with SMS messaging, engaging/encouraging nudges (our secret sauce!), peer-to-peer support thru AI matched affinity groups (more secret sauce), and wellbeing resources that are easy to access and use. Most importantly, W3LL makes our community healthier, happier, and more hopeful.

*We are looking for candidates that want to change the world, and improve access to wellbeing/mental health resources. People with interests in positive psychology, neuroscience,and in transformative technology. Mental Health/Wellbeing tech is a rapidly growing veritcal. See https://pitchbook.com/news/articles/mental-health-startups-venture-capital-outpace-2019. *

W3LL is building a wellbeing exploration and discovery platform for seniors (then teens!). Seniors share how they feel on the W3LL platform. Our sentiment algorithms create well-being profiles and recommend scored media, product/services and educational content. And then we measure the impact.

By making W3LL accessible to everyone, we help seniors, care-providers, and family members know:

  • What song to play,
  • What class to attend
  • What app to download In order to streamline care and improve downstream outcomes.

In the last 11 months, we have run 2 senior discovery cohorts, meet with seniors and B2B partners and we have learned a lot. seniors want easy to find, easy to access, easy to use low tech + no tech solutions. What they have is a fragmented - hard to navigate well-being experience. This is a massive opportunity and big market. We are looking for our 2021 team!

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear. W3LL is building an APP to support the W3LL platform. We are seeking a design/development intern to support the following:
*Full Stack Developer - Integrate existing algorithms including user profile functionality, recommendation engine, and content recommendation engine into web stack. Working alongside graphic designers for web design features. Developing front end website architecture. Designing user interactions on web pages. Creating servers and databases for functionality. Designing and developing APIs. Create databases that track and query events, calculate billing transactions and generate notification emails/nudges/reminders, and billing back end.

  • The applicant must be knowledgeable with the following languages: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, PHP, MySQL, & Linux. LA/Berkeley based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.

What will you get working with W3LL?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging Transformative Technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building a marketplace that changes lives.
  • Access: W3LL is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (AI/ML, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ http://www.w3ll.xyz/. Contact bst@w3ll.xyz for more info and/or with any questions!

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at W3LL available.
  • Requires a minimum ~10-20 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!). Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder - W3LL

W3ll team:
Brandon Howard: UI/UX Designer, Mindful Economist @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bcehoward/
Ben Simon-Thomas: Ecosystem & Marketplace Developer @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bensimonthomas/

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

description:
In this very hands-on role, you will be working with our growing engineering team with implementation and collaborating directly with senior technical leadership. We are looking for an energetic Healthcare Data Scientist or Researcher to help the development of the quality of care and cost models that drive Saina Health's products. This is an exciting opportunity to use your expertise in statistics or model development to create tools that will directly help patients receive high quality, low cost care. Come work in an awesome start up environment with a fun and talented team.
This is an unpaid internship, though by finishing a successful internship, there is an opportunity to become a key member within our group leading the data mining and AI development for our future release features. Are you ready to be part of something big?

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Experience with complex products/marketplaces with multiple user types OR experience understanding health outcomes or behavior change
  • Experience writing clean, well-tested code in SQL and Python
  • Comfortable reading and gaining insights from healthcare literature
  • Audit data integration efforts to ensure proper and complete collection
  • Sand practice collaboration and feedback. You question and seek feedback on your own work and opinions
  • Excellent documentation and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

Required Skill Sets:

  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • 2+ years experience applying data science & analytics to real business problems, working closely with product/engineering teams to analyze product experiments and understand primary drivers of outcomes
  • Lead and develop major projects from end-to-end encompassing planning, design, technical implementation, debugging, roll-out to Product & Engineering, testing, and iteration
  • Operate at level of sophistication in statistics, machine learning, or computer science that is publication-worthy
  • Experience building measures, models (including predictive models) using healthcare data, such as claims or provider databases
  • Expertise in statistical methods
  • Experienced with SQL, Excel, Python
  • B.S. in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience

Additional Qualifications:

  • Previous successful internships
  • Data analysis and Statistics coursework
  • Healthcare data processing experience

At Saina Health, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, national origin and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values!

description:
In this very hands-on role, you will be working with our growing engineering team with implementation and collaborating directly with senior technical leadership. We are looking for an energetic AWS DevOps Engineer with a passion to design and code modules for infrastructure, application and processes to helps us deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. We extensively leverage the AWS cloud and we are seeking a motivated responsible engineer for the implementation and maintenance of our applications in the AWS platform. Come work in an awesome start up environment with a fun and talented team.
This is an unpaid internship, though by finishing a successful internship, there is an opportunity to become a key member within our group leading the web and mobile development process to push up our new 2.0 web and app release. Are you ready to be part of something big?

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Experience with deploying front-end application and backend services in AWS
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect applications to back-end services in AWS
  • Experience in memory management, architecture, and S3 deployment
  • Experience with AWS networking/VPN as well as security and encryption methods
  • Experience with HIPAA eligible services
  • Support live production systems, including leveraging problem-solving skills to troubleshoot
  • Experience building, deploying and administering tools like Jenkins or Bitbucket Pipelines
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) systems and methodologies on the AWS platform
  • Experienced in containerized environments (Dockers, Kubernetes)
  • Ability to create and utilize AWS Cloud Formation templates to automate the creation of AWS images
  • Proficient in developing scripts and scripting languages; such as Python, Pearl, Ruby
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

Required Skill Sets:

  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • 2+ years of experience provisioning, operating, and managing AWS environments and services such as EC2, RDS, VPC, and ALB, Lambda and security services.
  • Hands-on experience with building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools
  • Experience working with and delivering using Agile practices
  • B.S. in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience

Additional Qualifications:

  • Previous successful internships
  • Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
  • Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall
  • Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools
  • Strong experience working around microservice architecture and API knowledge is a nice plus
  • Healthcare software development experience

We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values!

description:
To Apply:
Apply online at bluestamp.campmanagement.com/apply.
AngelList applications will not be considered, you will be sent to our online application.

Instructor:
BlueStamp, LLC is looking for independent, motivated, kind, and technical people to join our summer staff in all locations. The position requires staff to work together to assist students in creating their projects. This will include teaching engineering techniques and concepts, tools and safety, technical documentation, and troubleshooting methods. Staff will guide students to ideas, approaches, and sources of solutions without "just doing it for them." The position will involve the following responsibilities:
Help students troubleshoot their projects.
Help students create their own student page.
Motivate, inspire, and share the love of building with students

Education and practical experience in one or more of the following three areas:
(1) Electronics Hardware, (2) Firmware/Software, (3) Mechanical Design and Drafting.

Significant experience with building, designing, and troubleshooting devices or prototypes of similar scope to student projects shown here: bluestampengineering.com/the-students.
Applicants should be able to showcase and discuss, in depth, any of their projects.

Skilled in troubleshooting problems and using the engineering tools of their discipline.

Experience teaching/leading students (e.g. instructor roles, youth camps, tutoring, mentoring, etc).
Ability to think and act quickly on a project to identify solutions that can meet goals on a structured, fast-paced schedule in a busy environment.

Desire to share the excitement of designing and engineering with high school students, while motivating students through the challenging and frustrating stages of prototype construction.
Excellent communication skills, unfettered honesty and integrity, and the ability to work with minimal supervision are all a must.

Program Logistics
The student-to-staff ratio is approximately ~3:1. Typically we assign 4 staff members to each section. The skill set for each section consists: of an electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, computer scientist, and Junior TA (previous exemplary BSE student).
Class meets Monday-Friday for 6 weeks (excluding 4th of July). Program start dates are typically mid-June to late July or early August and vary slightly by city.
Compensation: The position is paid on a stipend, depending on experience.
Instructors are eligible for an additional merit based bonus of 25% of total compensation.

All staff must pass a background check.

description:
Description:
We are looking for a passionate security intern to join our Cybersecurity team. The responsibilities include to ensure to secure the client applications from potential breaches. Assist to create, leverage automation, continuously develop, maintain and mature Offensive Security Program. Be a resourceful part of the talented team responsible for application and infrastructure penetration testing, supporting external vulnerability reports and overall vulnerability management.

Perform penetration testing coverage across the global organization. Perform independent manual penetration tests of cloud and global IT infrastructure, web application, APIs, and IOT devices.

To be successful as a security analyst for a startup, you should be an inspired self-starter and have passion to learn and explore.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Plan scope and timing of static/dynamic application security testing.
  • Coordinate and execute testing plan.
  • Ensure security defects are documented and tracked for all releases, major technology and process changes.
  • Analyze testing results to validate, classify risk and rank findings.
  • Prepare and deliver reports with findings and recommendations.
  • Support remediation activities.
  • Perform penetration tests and validate cyber security controls.
  • Exposure to security research and publishing.
  • Experience of Application (Web or Mobile) Penetration Testing.
  • Familiarity with Security Standards and groups (OWASP, SANS).
  • Hands - on experience of Security Testing tools.
  • Basic Knowledge of Programming and scripting languages.

Job Requirements:

  • Experience in performing penetration testing on web and mobile applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical audiences at multiple organization levels.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to develop good relationships with current and potential clients.
  • Any Graduate or Post Graduate with passion in the security domain.
  • Certifications: CEH or any application security training from well recognized training institutes with at least 6 month training.

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, social orientation, nor on the basis of disability.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.*

description:
We are building www.balancenow.co a startup that is focused on highlighting diversity in leadership and decision-makers of our world.

Please review the platform and if it interests you, we'd like to chat.

The internship is unpaid, but gets you working one-on-one with the founders as well as a team of 10+ dedicated interns. This is a part-time remote internship spanning 3 months and requiring 10-15 hours weekly work with 1-3 weekly meetings with the team.

We're looking for candidates with the following language skills: HTML, CSS, Javascript, SQL, Ruby. Experience with Ruby on Rails is also required. Experience with Git is preferred.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.

  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

We are looking for interns to mentor for the summer. This position will allow you to apply your Deep Learning and Computer Vision theoretical knowledge (which you gained by doing online courses or at your university) to build state-of-the-art models and deploy them in real world applications

Interns should have the following skills

  1. Python
  2. Numpy, Scipy, matplotlib, jupyter, scikit-learn
  3. Any Deep Learning Frameworks - Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch (Keras and Tensorflow preferred)
  4. Supervised Learning - Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, KNN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Naive Bayes
  5. Unsupervised - K-Means, MoG/GMM, EM
  6. Fundamentals like - loss, cost, accuracy, Gradient Descent, Linear Algebra, Batching, variance, bias, regularization, Hyperparameter tuning, Dimension Reduction (PCA, NMF)
  7. Version Control (Git) and Linux/Unix
  8. Projects in Computer Vision, NLP or Speech
  9. Docker and Kubernetes experience is a plus
  10. Experience Deploying models on cloud and/or Edge Devices is a plus

This mentorship program will have two rounds of interviews.

  1. Preliminary Round
  2. Train a model from the list below and upload it on our platform www.aivis.ai along with it's code on Github.
  3. Inform us in the chat that you have uploaded a model.
  4. Once you pass the first round you will have a final video interview.

Project List for Preliminary Round.

  1. Face Recognition
  2. Gesture Recognition
  3. Pose Estimation
  4. Counting Number of people in a frame
  5. Pedestrian Detection
  6. Age and Gender Recognition
  7. Object Tracking
  8. Counting All Vehicles in a Video Stream
  9. Emotion Recognition through Facial Expressions
  10. Tumor Segmentation
  11. Object Detection in one of the follwoing a) Open World b) Indoor c) Road d) Aerial Images
  12. Action Recognition
  13. Group Activity Recognition
  14. You can also upload your own model but it should be related to Computer Vision and should be a little challenging,

Please note that this is an unpaid position.

🍔 Company: We build an AI platform that is based on state-of-the-art research in the fields of Automated Speech Recognition and NLP to give offline retailers full transparency into what is happening on their front-lines. Our team is passionate about research and innovation in the deep learning space. Founded by NLP practitioners and MIT graduates, outloud.ai is on the mission to bring conversational AI to offline retailers around the world.

🧑‍🏭 Responsibilities:
+Implementing and training state-of-the-art models in ASR and NLP areas
+Participating in data acquisition strategy
+Ideating and prototyping new data products build with AI techniques
+Working hands-on with engineers to turn ideas and prototypes into full fledged products and ship them to users

💅 Qualification:
+Currently enrolled in a Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
+Keen to train and test deep learning models on large datasets
+Experience with python, scientific packages, jupyter
+Eagerness to work with C++ codebase (c++ experience is not required but good to have)

Have an in-depth understanding of what our users need.

Represent the end user during internal discussions in all aspects of the business, not just software.

Write and maintain documentation.

Job: Venture Studio Intern
(great opportunity to work with startups!)
Costa Mesa, CA

About Operate
We are on a mission to partner with startup founders to build & scale software companies that change how the world works.

Operate is a new kind of early-stage venture studio that believes founders need more than capital and advice to be successful. In addition to investing capital, Operate embeds our team of top-tier operators into startups to give them a higher probability of success, and helps execute their vision to make an even bigger impact.

Intern Opportunity
We are seeking students for our 3 month internship program, which takes place out of Operate’s HQ in Costa Mesa, CA. Depending on the intern’s availability, this can be full-time or part-time, with an opportunity to work with one or multiple of our fast-growing startups, as well as the Operate studio team.

The intern traits we seek are curious, creative and entrepreneurial, with a history of self-starting, strong attention to detail and impeccable organization skills.

Some examples of what you’ll likely do

  • Research: potential customers, competitors, co-investors
  • Communicate:with founders, customers, colleagues, community members
  • Develop:new and improved approaches to various business activities in our companies and the studio operations
  • Learn: about how startups form, are funded, validate ideas and begin to grow
  • Contribute: new ideas, new perspective and new energy to the studio and our companies
  • Collaborate: with our studio team, startups, advisors, investors and broader Operate community
  • Maintain: a high level of discretion in handling confidential information

What you’ll need

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or graduate degree program
  • Strong desire to dive headfirst into a startup building environment
  • Minimum of one year experience in a similar role or office environment
  • The courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it.
  • See something broken? Fix it
  • Flexibility - things change around here - FAST
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects at once

The perks of working with our team

  • Work with experienced entrepreneurs that have built and scaled various startups
  • Learn all about entrepreneurship, building businesses, investing, strategic partnership and raising money
  • Exposure and introductions to Operate’s extensive network

To Apply:
Email kyleg@operatestudio.com with a brief cover letter describing why you’d like to work with Operate and our companies. Please include a resume or LinkedIn profile for additional background information.

Operate is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans are encouraged to apply.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Operate’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives!

Come do the best work of your life here at Operate!

Build Stuff That Matters

Are you sustainability evangelist? Do you believe that we can end the climate crisis in your lifetime? Think that businesses can do good? Recapture is currently seeking out Corporate Emissions Associates for the Summer 2021 term, to sculpt the next phase of corporate climate action. We are a passionate gang looking for someone passionate, hopeful, data driven, and hardworking to help us fulfill our mission of making Recapture the enterprise carbon removal standard.

About Recapture

Recapture is the first systems-designed approach to carbon removal that makes it profitable for companies to reach true net-zero emissions and scalable to the volumes required to solve climate change. By combining multiple negative emissions technologies working in unison, we’re able to sequester 10 times more CO₂ per acre than just planting trees on their own.

Recapture was created to give the world’s largest companies a way to clean up all their historic emissions and be at the forefront of corporate responsibility. Our end-to-end solution makes it profitable for businesses who want to be both accountable and proactive to remove massive amounts of carbon from the atmosphere. We believe that capitalism can do good.

Our vision is to harness the collective power of the Global Fortune 1000 to reach net-zero and halt the progression of global warming in our lifetime. We pioneered the first profitable carbon removal strategy, have the system-designed model and global partners in place, and the financial flywheel to enable direct air capture (DAC) to scale through finance, construction, and innovation through our actual sales, instead of investment or subsidization alone.

The Program Areas

Recapture invites you to come join us for an an 11-22 week unique remote experience, that involves professional development programming, mentoring, and network-building. This program is designed to provide exposure into climate risk mitigation, corporate sustainability, design, sales, and value driven content creation. You will be placed on key projects across the business and be exposed to a few of the program areas based on your background. Here are just a few areas that we will focus on during the program.

Global Net Zero Commitment Tracking
Corporate Emissions Benchmarking
Carbon Markets Research
Data Extrapolation
Project Operations & Development
Climate Smart Forestry Life Cycle Analysis (LCA)

The Role

The Corporate Emissions Associate program is an internship-for-credit experience. This is not a paid position. Our goal is to create a mutually beneficial experience related to your academic interest, that is creditworthy, and encourages academic, professional, and personal growth.

You will work with our Emissions Analyst and Founding Partners, gathering publically available and proprietary corporate emissions data, extracting insights, and packaging this information for helping the global community understand the risks of corporate climate strategies. This role will require a keen eye for details, as well as the ability to step-away and see the bigger picture. Organization is key.

Qualifications

  • You are energetic and self-motivated--a critical and design thinker with fantastic organizational skills.
  • You have a do it yourself attitude, and have built and analyzed data repositories from scratch in the past.
  • You enjoy strategic planning and can effectively recognize and plan around future consequences and trends that can maintain Recapture’s image as an innovator in the carbon removal space.
  • You are eager to learn or have background in the sustainability, energy, and/or environmental management fields and confident in your ability to navigate a corporate sustainability report.
  • You can differentiate between Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions and how as well as what go into the calculations.
  • You understand the difference between location based market based calculations for energy utilization.
  • You're a skilled communicator and have an act for foreseeing opportunities and challenges before they arise.
  • You pride yourself on your hustle and ability to consistently follow up and follow through
  • You don't fold under pressure, but instead, thrive on setting high expectations for yourself, managing multiple tasks simultaneously, and meeting goals
  • Most importantly, you are passionate about what we're doing at Recapture!

The Perks

  • A sense of purpose by working directly on a solution that will impact large scale climate action
  • Work life balance
  • Recommendations and college credit
  • Access to corporate sustainability directors
  • Collaboration with amazing entrepreneurs in the climate space

How to Apply

To apply please send your resume and brief cover letter outlining why you would be a good fit to careers@recapturecarbon.com. We will only respond to emailed applications. Include "Summer Corp Emissions Associate" exactly as it is written in the subject line.

Build Stuff That Matters

Are you sustainability evangelist? Do you believe that we can end the climate crisis in your lifetime? Think that businesses can do good? Recapture is currently seeking out a Corporate Emissions Associate to sculpt the next phase of corporate climate action. We are a passionate gang looking for someone passionate, hopeful, data driven and hardworking to help us fulfill our vision of making Recapture the enterprise carbon removal standard.

About Recapture

Recapture is a Washington, DC based company founded in 2018 by Philip-Michael Weiner and Trey Pringle’s search for solutions to close the carbon gap. This spurred a two year journey to design economically sensible ways for companies to eliminate their footprint. But now the notion of carbon neutral has changed. It used to be offset what you can’t reduce through projects that avoid emissions somewhere else on the planet; however, now companies need to mathematically remove 1 ton of carbon for each ton they emit.

Since that time, Recapture has evolved from an to a new model for carbon removal that makes it profitable for the largest companies to solve climate change.

At a minimum, 100 billion metric tons of CO2 needs to be removed from the atmosphere by mid-century in order to meet the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement. Unfortunately, the current natural and technological approaches that pull carbon from the air have feasibility or cost limitations when used on their own that prevent them from scaling to the size of the problem. And even though the U.S. might be back on track to reduce emissions, without legislation, the financial mechanism has been missing in the carbon removal space. So we created that missing link.

Our vision is to harness the collective power of the Global Fortune 1000 to reach net-zero and halt the progression of global warming in our lifetime. We pioneered the first profitable carbon removal strategy, have the system-designed model and global partners in place, and the financial flywheel to enable direct air capture (DAC) to scale through finance, construction, and innovation through our actual sales, instead of investment or subsidization alone.

The Program Areas

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.
