Beyond any technical requirements, we are looking for someone who wants to collaborate, who's adaptable and receptive to feedback, and who wants to invest their time to build an exciting product from the ground up.

Preferred candidates will have: app development & machine learning on big data sets experience.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don’t want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari’s open source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

At Kleos Live, we are looking for skilled, motivated individuals that are interested in working at the crossroads of of the burgeoning Esports industry and the monetization of fame. We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern with the following qualifications in order to help with our app development. Please reach out if you are interested!

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with the Flutter Framework
Experience with Firebase

The role
We are currently in beta phase - we’ve opened our platform to a limited number of paying merchants, and are giving them high-touch support to ensure their tests are well-designed and successful.

This associate will help drive the transition from our beta to our scaling phase. Here is a sample of projects this person might own:

  • Determining IntelliGem’s pricing strategy: there are several possibilities for how we might price this service in the long term - a flat fee per test; a subscription price that scales with company size; a shared success model where we take a % of any profit improvement. We need to determine our options, model out the possibilities, and test these hypotheses with real customers

  • Defining the target customer: There are hundreds of thousands of e-commerce stores, if not millions. The question is simple - which of them would be good candidates for the IntelliGems service? We need to segment the market, determine the sizes of various segments, and use this to inform our business development strategy

  • Build the go-to-market plan: Most of our customers have come through referrals and networking. As we scale, we will need to be more proactive in finding customers. We need to determine what channels are most effective for e-commerce enablement companies, and run some initial tests to gauge effectiveness

  • Product development/management: As we better understand our target customer and go-to-market plan, we will need to tailor the product to these segments. In particular, we want to build a feature that suggests which tests a customer should run. This person might talk to customers and work with our engineers to define this feature

  • Lots of other stuff - We’re a scrappy team and have far more to-do than our capacity. Depending on the candidate’s interests and skills, they could plug into content development, design, fundraising strategy, customer success, and data science

You should apply if:

  • You thrive in ambiguous environments where there’s not a single “right” answer - you have an intuition for what’s the most important thing, and a knack for finding 80/20 solutions

  • You are a flexible thinker who loves switching between creative work, data analysis, problem solving, and customer interviews

  • You love tough problems, and aren’t scared off if they can get ‘math-y’ in nature

  • You’re down-to-earth, have a good sense of humor, and like to be friendly with the people you work with

  • You want to get exposure to an early company and see how things work at a young, seed-stage company

You can drop your resume here, but also highly enoucrage you to send one of us a note with your resume and explain why you're interested!

Built by a team of University of Michigan Alum, Appleseeds (currently in Stealth) is tackling student debt by reimagining the gifting and investing experience. We are looking for a Fullstack Software Engineer to help develop the core features of our Nest.js + Svelte application. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to work with seasoned veterans in the Fintech, programming, and e-commerce industries and help build revolutionary frictionless technology from the ground up. We are looking for someone that is curious and full of ideas, a self-starter, and likes to work with cutting edge web technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Develop core features in the Appleseeds interface
  • Develop API endpoints in a Node.js backend for serving user data to the UI
  • Develop endpoints for integrating with a Squarespace store that is used to drive the Appleseeds Shop
  • Help design the Appleseeds experience by working with the team and giving candid feedback
  • Write both end-to-end and unit tests to ensure reliability of the app and API
  • Maintain, measure, and improve performance

Qualifications

  • Strong understanding of vanilla JavaScript (both Node.js and Web)
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented and functional programming
  • Experience with any modern frontend framework (we use Svelte)
  • Experience building REST APIs
  • Experience with TypeScript (we use across the stack)
  • Experience working with databases and writing SQL
  • Comfortable in a remote-work environment
  • A passion for programming!

  • You dig creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management, and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project’s ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests
  • Champion those pull requests to open-source contributors and maintainers to try to get them merged!
  • Help and advice on open-source governance practices, broad consensus, and other mechanisms
  • Contribute to our desire to use good, easy to understand, open-source compatible licenses wherever possible
  • You'll directly impact the culture of open source at Tari.

Requirements:

  • 7 years of software development experience or 5 years with an advanced degree.
  • Experience contributing to multiple open source projects.
  • Experience growing and building open-source communities.
  • Knowledge of open-source licenses and general open-source governance models.
  • Open source dependency management tools.
  • GitHub and open-source CI tooling (e.g. Travis CI, Coveralls, CircleCI).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an ability to map innovative and clear solutions to complex problems while managing multiple projects
  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll-up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Machine Perception is building a perception-as-a-service product providing obstacle detection and navigation for off-road autonomous vehicles (agriculture, mining, construction, and warehouses). We integrate with existing camera systems on the robot to provide robust anomaly/obstacle detection and navigability of the terrain in challenging environments. Check us out: machineperception.co.

We're hiring a Computer Vision engineer with experience combining deep learning and 3-D geometry techniques. You'll be improving our pipeline of taking in arbitrary video streams and infering depth, segmentation, and obstacle detection. Candidates will need to show proficiency in building 3-D scene understanding pipelines.

Additional requirements: ROS experience, robotics experience. Graduate students preferred, and references to any papers or publications highly recommended.

We are seeking an intern developer to help build out reusable UI components and high-quality interactions for a mobile-responsive web app. The app is directed toward music educators and students, so someone with a background in either field would find this to be a great opportunity. Halfnote is a very early-stage startup, so this first intern should expect to have a voice in the product roadmap and prioritization.

Our founding team has experience at Facebook, Twitter, and Plaid, and is a good source of mentorship and support. The ideal candidate should have at least 2 years of experience working on front-end web products. We use the following:

  • Hasura Graphql
  • NextJS
  • TailwindCSS
  • Typescript Serverless code

We welcome a candidate who is less experienced on the software engineering side, as long as they have experience with building webpages from mocks.

position: FULL-STACK Software Developer: Webpage Dev, marketing (PR), Design
description:
Intro to Bobly:

We are developers, Business strategists, Tech geeks, and savvy innovators who love what we do – helping change the world with a full-stack D2C sales channel. We are building a global team of brilliant engineers, developers, designers, sales, and marketers who are dedicated to delivering innovative end-to-end technologies for customers. Bobly is all about customer obsession, rapid iteration, and a great attitude with fun, respect, and helping the team win together. Bobly helps companies like Colgate, CVS, Coca-Cola, and Redbull with custom hardware solutions to help grow sales and brand awareness. We deploy hardware powered by AI with a gamified user experience.

Preferred qualifications/experience:

3 years minimum experience within FULL-STACK web development.
Have worked with techniques/projects like; Responsive web design, Marketing & PR, HTML, HTML5, WordPress, Content writing, Hardware detailing, React.js, CSS, SVG animation.
Experience creating sales content, partner content, PR, and/or technical product documentation.
Experience designing and scripting visual digital assets like infographics, wireframes, or video scripts.
Have been involved with managing global digital content or web experiences.
Value high quality well crafted visual design, and care about the details highly pixel oriented

Responsibilities:

Redesigning webpage with a more responsive design.
Coming with creative ideas for webpage and marketing online.
WordPress blog and lead gathering with the updated webpage.
Create animations, illustrations, vectors etc..
PR and content writing
Display interactive engaging design for people visiting the webpage
Front and backend development

At Bobly, we believe our values and love for our work have been key to our success and are core to our future. We are 100% committed to who we are and what we do. We value people that stand behind their work and team members!

More background:

Bobly is a Scandinavian started company with its base of operations in San Fransico (Bay Area, California). We are a savvy team of inventors and seasoned business strategists. Currently, we deploy a variety of hardware and software solutions for helping clients like CVS, Target, Glamsquad, Colgate-Palmolive, Coca-Cola, Pepsi Co, and others.

We bring a platform of tools for marketing and selling D2C with smart hardware solutions powered by AI & ML.

Intro:

The world’s most advanced platform for building direct contact with END-USERS through smart hardware solutions powered by Artificial intelligence software with a gamified experience.

Bobly is an end-to-end solution for all brand partners or retailers looking for a custom solution to gain new users and understand consumers through deep tech.

Bobly goes way beyond regular vendor partners to create a complete autonomous channel for your brand or retailer. We deliver operational excellence and a stable, scalable infrastructure to help you quickly grow your business.

Webpage: https://www.bobly.com/

Objectives of this Role

Manage and direct research and development (R&D) and processes to meet the needs of our AI strategy
Understand company and client challenges and how integrating AI capabilities can help create solutions
Lead cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize key areas of the partner’s business where AI solutions can drive significant business benefit
Analyze and explain AI and machine learning (ML) solutions while setting and maintaining high ethical standards\
Serve as liaison between stakeholders and project teams, delivering feedback and enabling them to make necessary changes to product performance or presentation
Required Skills and Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in computer science
2+ years of experience in applying AI to practical and comprehensive technology solutions
Proven experience with ML, Tensorflow, Python
Experience with program leadership, governance, and change enablement
Knowledge of basic algorithms, object-oriented and functional design principles, and best practice patterns
Experience with REST API development, NoSQL design, RDBMS design and optimizations

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with innovation accelerators
Experience with Cloud environments

We are looking to develop a website and app for our community of runners that utilizes personalization through AI/ML and also GPS tracking features. Here is a brief description of what we are looking for in a developer intern:

  • Passionate about working for a budding startup and serving a huge role in our growth

  • Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, or other relevant web design coding languages.

  • Basic knowledge of mobile UI/UX and application programming skills.

Software Engineer Intern - Gotham Oracle. We're almost set to launch! Next month in fact. But we need some extra help to make it the true UX we want. So we're looking for an intern this summer for immediate-start to help us cross the finish line! True end-to-end experience on an exciting product launch and beyond. Come join the team!

Technical expectations:
Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/JavaScript/TypeScript (ES6+)
Experience with React (using functional components and hooks) is a plus
Experience with cloud deployment (i.e. AWS, Digital Ocean) is a plus

Has a strong willingness to learn
Is passionate about the intersection of NYC life and cutting edge technology
Wants to add a solid project to their portfolio

Our tech stack:
Frontend: React, TypeScript, Styled Components

Datatelligent is seeking a Data Solutions Engineer to join our fast-growing company building custom data analytics solutions.

A successful Data Solutions Engineer will assist in the development, deployment, administration, and integration of data analytics solutions. You will work with our team and customers to build and implement solutions to meet our customer’s data analytics needs.

Hours are flexible and work can be done remotely. Start immediately on a part-time basis, with the option for more hours as we grow. Regardless of how much you work, you’ll make an impact on our growth!

What you’ll do
• Participate in solution design discussions with business users and cross-functional teams.
• Develop data analytics solutions including data engineering using a variety of database tools including Azure SQL and Snowflake.
• Obtain feedback from team members, reduce risks, and provide technical help.
• Debug and fix technical issues. Act as a focal point during critical situations.

What you’ll need
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Data Analytics, Computer Science or other data-oriented disciplines
• Experience with databases and SQL language.
• Comfort in meeting with customers and peers to explore requirements and new ideas
• Strong analytic and problem-solving experience

Who you are
• A growth-oriented professional who is eager to join a fast-paced and entrepreneurial team.
• Enjoy learning new technologies and are a forward thinker. Insatiably curious, coachable and committed to lifelong learning.
• Have a strong will to achieve - willing to push harder, have a competitive spirit, and willing to be challenged.
• Genuinely interested in helping other team members succeed in their roles, as you work to achieve your own goals.

This position is part-time (approximately 20 hours per week) and can be completed remotely.

Datatelligent is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

Job Description
Responsibilities:

You will help us create, maintain and research subjects related to current technologies for a variety of client-side platforms including web applications, printers, iOS and Android, etc.

Core Tech Skills:

· Software Development Fundamentals

· JavaScript - ES6 (1 year)

· React (1 year)

· Redux (1 year)

· REST (1 year)

· JQuery (1 year)

· CSS (1 year)

· HTML (1 year)

Qualifications:

  • Willingness to learn software and business processes

  • Self-Motivate and Self-starter

  • Excellent verbal, active listening in both English and Chinese

  • Time-management skills, interpersonal skills required, effective communication, and listen to others well

  • Deadline and detail-oriented

  • Computer science background, or related background

  • Be empathetic

  • Be polite, positive, and professional in all communications

Working on an exciting product of AI based mobile app. Candidates shall have at least 2 years of development experiences on native IOS and Android apps; leading and completed at least 1 app which could be demonstrated; Based on in Boston area.

Seeking a talented, high performing graphic design interns that help with a variety of
projects to branding, UI/UX and visual design.

This AI startup company is focusing on modern mobile and remote digital services of human-human and human-computer interaction. Our goal is to create a high-tech and easy to use AI product that requires a designer to be involved in UI/UX design, web design and some usability testing. Meanwhile, the design team is also responsible for designing a strong brand identity and support the business team on competitions and business development with visual supplements such as redesign slides and design info graphics.

Primary Job Functions
• Work along with other designer, engineers and researchers to create prototypes for the product that includes icon design, user interface design, interaction design and usability testing.
• Develop branding and style book for the company in order to create a strong band identity.
• Identify design matters and drive creative solutions to fix them

Today, most of us don’t own anything on the internet. We subscribe to things. We rent things. We sign up for things for free in exchange for our data. We strongly believe this is wrong. Everyone on Earth should own digital things they love just like we do in the physical world. They should own their online identities. They should have agency to use, buy, sell, and trade beautiful digital things in any manner they desire. And they should be able to do so while retaining their privacy.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest growing consumer products of all-time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be 🔥🐉 across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, Arrington XRP Capital, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

As a UX developer, you will work with our Engineering and UX team to build proprietary and open-source technology that will be deployed on a global scale.

About You:

  • You a front-end developer and designer that lives for making AMAZING experiences that look equally good on web and mobile?
  • You'll love working with our world-class team of designers to make their incredible vision a living, breathing reality.
  • You are highly experienced in Webflow and are able to produce incredible user experiences in very short order.
  • You love the nimbleness of the startup environment and are capable if dealing with the pace and change that comes with it.
  • You have an eye for quality and detail (e.g. you spotted the typos in this JD, which initially annoyed you, but now know were just part of the test).

Requirements:

  • +6 years JavaScript, HTML & CSS experience.
  • +2 years Webflow experience.
  • Experience with React.js and Redux will be a tremendous advantage.
  • You have experience building rich web front-ends with global reach - please share your portfolio with us.
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures and algorithms.
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across teams spread over multiple time zones.
  • You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take design and wireframes provided by the UX team and author professional and maintainable CSS, HTML and JavaScript to bring it to life.
  • A track-record in Open Source development is an advantage.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics from a recognized university (advantage)
  • But honestly, your portfolio is what counts.

What You'll Do:

  • Build pixel-perfect, fluid, and delightful UIs across web and mobile interfaces. You take the designs to the next level, adding value during the implementation.
  • Optimise components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
  • Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
  • Work with backend and fullstack engineers to integrate your creations into our broader ecosystem.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations.
  • The latest technology and equipment to do your best work

That's all to say: these job listings are approximations! If you're a curious and passionate person, we want to hear from you. We are all generalists who like to dip our toes into different fields and skill sets, so if a job isn't a 100% fit, don't worry! We base our employment decisions on the needs of our business, job requirements, and applicants' qualifications. In other words, we only care that you’re the best person for the job.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (“Sigma”) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma’s unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world’s data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma’s core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we’d love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

About Parallel

A parallel world lives amongst us -- the microbial world. This world impacts not only our lifespan, but also our healthspan.

Our mission is to empower people with real science to make meaningful decisions to improve their healthspan.

Parallel is a microbial diagnostics and next-level skincare company that aims to revolutionize skin health by providing deep insight and true personalization, through best-in-class testing and targeted, clean microbial formulations.

Hiring + Application Instructions

We are passionate about our mission, but also about building an extraordinary team. We believe that every person has a superpower, and it is our job to help you hone this talent so you can be your best self, succeed, and make an impact.

If you think you’re the right fit, we welcome you to reach out to hello@parallelhealth.io. Please include your resume/CV and a letter sharing with us why you are interested in the role.

Ideal Candidate
You are:

  • A conscientious molecular biologist
  • Interested in exploring the skin microbiome and building new products to improve general skin health and wellness
  • Are interested in product development
  • A team player who likes working with other curious scientists that take their mission, but not their egos, seriously
  • Looking forward to building your network with some of the most dynamic startups in the SF Bay Area at Illumina Accelerator.

Responsibilities
You will:

  • Help to isolate and identify new skin microbes with state-of-the-art shotgun genomic sequencing
  • Isolate bacteriophages that can be incorporated into ground-breaking gentle skin microbiome cosmetic products that will actually improve the appearance of people’s skin
  • Learn about the skin microbiome (including your own!) and contribute to product design and development
  • Troubleshoot molecular biology protocols and contribute to laboratory automation and protocol improvement
  • Conduct other research and/or processes to support product development

Technical Requirements + Extras
You have:

  • Graduated with a B.S. or M.S. in microbiology, molecular biology, or related field
  • Successfully carried out an NGS DNA library preparation protocol (Illumina, PacBio, NanoPore, etc.)
  • Worked with bacteria in a BSL-2 laboratory before (in a BSL-2 cabinet/laminar flow hood)
  • Independently identified and corrected mistakes that you’ve made in complex molecular biology protocols

Extra points if you have:

  • Experience reading and writing Python scripts and want to learn more (nice to have, but not the most important thing)
  • Experience working in a corporate or startup laboratory (nice to have, but not essential)

Flashtrend is looking for the best ios devlopers that will join our devlopement team. We're a growing company with a ton of work to be done. If your an entrepeuener with incredible ios devlopement skills to whose looking to be apart of a successful company then feel free to apply for the position.
TravelTaka is currently looking for a talented IOS developer to work alongside our development team.

FLxDER Inc. is an early-stage startup developing cloud-based electric vehicle (EV) charging optimization software for fleets. By addressing shortcomings of conventional approaches to “smart-charging” and grid integration, FLxDER will enable more cost-effective fleet operation, will lessen utility distribution system impacts and costs, and will facilitate the rapid adoption of EVs that is so critical to climate change mitigation. Using a unique power-flow optimization approach, FLxDER will coordinate fleet EV and stationary battery charging jointly with co-located energy resources (solar PV etc.).

FLxDER is looking for a front-end developer student intern to join our team in the development of a prototype of an exciting new cloud-based service that optimizes EV charging for fleets. The position is temporary (January through May 2021), part-time, and remote with flexible hours.

This role provides an opportunity to collaborate with FLxDER’s experts in energy, operations research, economics, and back-end software development to get exposure to complex and challenging problems involving cloud resources, software, and systems integration in the rapidly growing EV infrastructure and smart grid industries.

Responsibilities

  • Develop a clean, attractive user interface for the first prototype of a novel cloud-based electric vehicle charging and distributed energy management application
  • Develop data visualizations that facilitate insight into optimization and system performance
  • Work with our team to iterate rapidly on design, based on user feedback
  • Interact with other members of our team to structure components to work within the larger application

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • High energy and motivated learner
  • Innovative team player who thrives in unstructured entrepreneurial environments
  • HTML/CSS experience, including concepts like layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility
  • Experience with React, Vue, or EmberJS
  • Understanding of browser APIs and optimizing front end performance
  • Experience in building modern websites and modern website design
  • Experience with test-driven development
  • Desire to learn and grow as a software engineer
  • Good critical thinking, presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills

Other requirements:

  • Must attend, or have recently graduated within the past year from, a MA college or university, or must be a MA resident, with proof of residency, who attended an out-of-state college or university
  • Project work/contributions we can check out
  • Applicants located in the metro Boston area preferred
